Therefore, her business is very important in supporting the family. Her convenience store is frequented by her neighbors. They come to her to get products for daily consumption, which they would otherwise have to go to the center of the city to buy. It is worth pointing out that the area where she lives is far from the center of the city. Sara wants to equip her business with a scale. She also wants to expand her business by purchasing more groceries. She is requesting, for the first time, a loan for 1,500 PEN from the Edpyme Alternative. She is a woman who is devoted to her family and her work. Her greatest desire is to keep making her business grow in order to get a better quality of life and get ahead together with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a scale and groceries to expand her business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 29 years old. He is married to Lucy Wanjiku and they have a 3-year-old child. 

John has operated his fast food stall in Naivasha town since 2004. He was introduced to KADET by his friend, and this will be his second loan. His first loan was for Kshs 13,000 and he repaid it well. He plans to use cash from this new loan to buy two more cooking pots, a set of cups and add more seats in his food stall to be able to cater to more clients.

In future, he wants to open a butchery and run it along with the food stall.

loans.use: To buy cooking pots and cups, and add seating for more clients

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel M. Z., tiene la edad de 43 años, está casado, y tiene 4 hijos de 18,14,14 y 9 años. El crédito lo quiere para dar asistencia a su finca, el desea realizar unos trabajos en la finca y así lograr que los cultivos produzcan más. La idea es mejorar y aumentar la capacidad de producción y aumentar el área del cultivo.  Don Gabriel cuenta con área de diversos cultivos en producción tal es el caso del cultivo del café y otros. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento y lograr una mejor calidad y  obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de su cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Gabriel también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una mayor estabilidad económica, y así poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Gabriel M. Z. is 43 years old, married with 4 children ages 18, 14, 14 and 9. The loan that he is requesting will be used to support his farm. He would like to make some upgrades to the farm and in this way increase the crop production. The idea is to improve and augment the capacity of production and increase the cultivatable land. Mr. Gabriel has land with the ability to produce diverse crops such as coffee and others. He would like to do sufficient maintenance and obtain better quality produce and acquire the most income possible when it comes time to harvest. This is the first time that he has requested a loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very pleased with the services they provide. Mr. Gabriel has worked for several years in agriculture. In the future, he hopes to improve his quality of life and have better economic stability in order to continue to grow both as a person and as a producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make upgrades to his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, wheat flour and maize flour

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes K. is currently in the business of selling charcoal in the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Agnes is 48 years old and is married to a soldier. She has three children, and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Stephene

texts.en:
Stephene is 41 years old and blessed with five children. Four of them are in school.  

Stephene has been supplying potatoes for ten years. He was previously employed in a hotel, but currently he has no other source of income. Since he became a member of Faulu Kenya, he has been able to increase his business capital, leading to an increase in sales and customer retention. He hopes to expand his business by opening many branches in future. He also dreams of owning land, being stable and increasing his profit margin. 

He has requested a loan of Kes 80,000 to add to his stock of potatoes and also buy a jiko (cooker) for potato chips. He describes himself as a determined man, honest and friendly to his customers.

loans.use: To add to his stock of potatoes and also buy a jiko (cooker) for potato chips

loans.name: Kathia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Kathia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qory Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 18 años, es soltera y todavía no tiene hijos. Kathia estudia actualmente para dar el examen de ingreso a la Universidad Nacional San Antonio de Abad del Cusco y desea ingresar a la carrera profesional de economía. La socia es una mujer joven, trabajadora y emprendedora, ella apoya a su hermana en la administración de venta de bloquetas de cemento. Ya es un año que se dedican al negocio y les ha ido muy bien gracias a su empeño ponen en su trabajo. Kathia requiere el préstamo para comprar bolsas de cemento.     

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(Los socios del banco comunal se reúnen cada treinta días en la ciudad de Pucyura que es distrito de la ciudad de Anta del Departamento del Cusco, Pucyura se encuentra ubicada a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Cusco).
 
La socia Kathia en la fotografías esta acompañado de su hermana Carla.
texts.en:
Kathia is a member of the “Qory Orcco” communal bank of the Arariwa Association. She is 18 years old, is single, and has no children. Kathia is currently studying for the university entrance exam to the Universidad Nacional San Antonio de Abad del Cusco, where she hopes to earn a degree in economics. She is a hard-working, entrepreneurial, young woman, who assists her sister in the sale of cement blocks. They have had this business for one year and they are doing quite well thanks to their hard work. Kathia is requesting this loan in order to purchase bags of cement.

She is very grateful for this opportunity and is committed to making all payments as stipulated in the repayment schedule.

(The communal bank members meet every 30 days in the city of Pucyura, a district of the city of Anta in the province of Cusco. Puycura is 40 minutes from the city of Cusco.)

The photograph shows Kathia with her sister, Carla.


Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Fatuma Abdu S. from Morogoro. She is divorced with one child, who is three years old. 

Fatuma has been running a Café/Mama Lishe since 2009. A mama lishe (local restaurant or café) in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantains (a cooked savory banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces.

She works at the business for 1-4 hours per day, seven days per week, and is assisted by her younger sister. Fatuma is requesting a loan of 300,000 TSH in order to purchase rice, beans, wheat flour and maize flour as additional ingredients for her cafe. In the future, she plans to have variety of services in her business. Fatuma thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, wheat flour and maize flour as aditional ingredients for her cafe.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday Y. is currently in the business of selling greens at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more greens, vegetables and fruits, to sell. Sunday is 60 years old and is widowed. She has five children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to further educate her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more greens, vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an additional hair dryer, wigs and other hair products

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta, 26, is the single mother of one school-going child. She has been in dairy farming for the past six years, selling milk to her neighbors to earn enough money to support herself and her child.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend, and this will be her second loan after paying her first loan of Kshs. 20,000 well and on time. She plans to buy another cow with the money from this loan. This will increase her milk production and enable her serve her ever growing list of clientele.

She still plans to continue with dairy farming in future, grow her business and even get a supplying contract with one of the milk processing companies.

loans.use: To buy another cow to increase milk production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional cloth and other materials required for making clothes

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
María tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a sus hijas en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijas la llevó hace trece años a dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes y verduras en el mercado El Hueco, de la ciudad de Paiján. Durante estos años ha dado todo de si para que el negocio salga adelante y ahora su negocio goza de una clientela fiel que siempre acude a el para agenciarse de verduras y abarrotes. María no descansa y siempre trata de seguir avanzando para salir adelante junto a sus hijas.

Es siguiendo su objetivo de crecimiento que desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más variedad de verduras y abarrotes con los cuales pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

María es una mujer alegre y muy entregada a su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a sus hijas la posibilidad de estudiar una carrera que les asegure un futuro prometedor. Ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old and a single mother. She lives with her daughters in the “Paiján” district of the “Ascope” province in the “La Libertad” region, located three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Her desire to help her daughters get ahead motivated her to begin selling groceries and vegetables in the “El Hueco” market, in the city of Paiján three years ago. During that time she has given her all to make the business a success, and now it boasts a faithful clientele that regularly goes to her to buy vegetables and groceries. María never rests and always tries to progress so that she can get ahead with her daughters. She wants to grow her business by buying a greater variety of vegetables and groceries to satisfy her customers’ needs, so she finds herself requesting a 2,000 PEN ($700) loan through Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her objective. María is a happy woman very bound to her work. Her greatest desire is to be able to provide her daughters with the opportunity to study and achieve a career that will provide them a promising future. She has worked with our institution in the past and has proven herself to be a responsible and punctual client.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Groceries and vegetables to expand her business

loans.name: Wilmer Humberto

texts.es:
Wilmer Humberto R. A. es un joven de 27 años de edad el cual vive con sus padres en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Wilmer está a cargo de sus padres por lo cual inició un proyecto de cría de cerdo para engorde. El vende sus productos a los vecinos de la comunidad, quienes se muestran muy satisfechos por la calidad de estos. Comenta que desde que inició el proyecto se ha sentido muy feliz puesto que su negocio día con día crece.

Actualmente Wilmer está solicitando un microcrédito de ¢ 656,000 (seiscientos cincuenta y seis mil colones)  para la compra de más cerdos para engorde, así como compra de alimento y otros insumos necesarios para este fin. Con esta inversión espera que su microempresa se fortalezca y crezca más. Todo esto ayudará a mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. 

Wilmer es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Wilmer Humberto is a youth of 27 who lives with his parents in a community called Santa Fé located in Los Chiles, Alajuela province. This community is notable as a mountainous zone and for being near the northern frontier of the country. Its principal economic activities are cattle raising and agriculture specifically, and for producing basic grains, sugar cane, and oranges. Wilmer is obligated to his parents and for that reason, he began a project of raising and fattening pigs. He sells his products to neighbors in the community, who seem quite satisfied with their quality. He comments that from the beginning of this project, he has been very happy to see the business grow day by day. At present Wilmer is requesting a micro-credit of 656,000 colons to buy more pigs to fatten, and to buy feed and other supplies necessary for this end. With the investment he hopes that his micro-enterprise will be strengthened and grow more. All this will help to better conditions for him and his family. Wilmer is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fé, one of 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his 2nd loan and with it he hopes to grow more as an individual and economically. Also, he points out that thanks to these types of organizations and means of facilitating loans, he can dedicate more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PIGS TO FATTEN, PLUS FEED AND NECESSARY SUPPLIES

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: J. Joice is currently in the business of selling bread and beer at home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. Joice is 38 years old and is married to a policeman. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Reynaldo Salvador

texts.es:
El  señor Reynaldo Salvador M., se dedica a la compra venta de productos lácteos, es casado tiene tres hijos ninguno vive con él. El negocio lo tiene ubicado dentro del mercado bisne en el sector del queso y es administrado por él y su esposa.

El  señor Reynaldo tiene más de cuatro años de trabajar                  con nosotros lleva  23 créditos,  durante todo este tiempo  ha demostrado ser una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, el crédito lo utiliza para comprar de lácteos y así mantener inventario en el negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Reynaldo Salvador M. buys and sells dairy products. He is married with three children, none of whom live with him. His business, which is run by him and his wife, is located inside the Bisne Market in the cheese area. Mr. Reynaldo has been working with us for the past four years and has obtained 23 loans. During all this time, he has made it evident that he is hard working and responsible. The loan will be used to buy dairy products in order to maintain the inventory of the business.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory of cheese, curds and cream

loans.name: Velmar Zawadi

texts.en:
Velmar is a 30-year-old single parent of two children: Kelvin and Sofia Kazungu. She was introduced to KADET by an existing client of their group and this is her first loan.

Velmar, is in the business of selling charcoal and has done this for two years in Gede shopping center which is part of the larger Malindi district. Her customers are mainly the residents of the households in Gede-Malindi and she earns a monthly profit of about Kshs 3,000. She plans to use Kshs 3,000 of the loan to add to her stock of charcoal and Kshs 2,000 to buy a stock of greens.


With the extra income from this loan Velmar hopes to open up a big charcoal business to supply wholesalers. She is a woman who describes herself as hardworking and dreams of seeing her children excel academically.

loans.use: To add to her stock of charcoal and to buy a stock of greens

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 33 years old and married with one child. He has been running a retail shop for four years where he sells sugar, rice, flour, and other items. Previously, he was an employee at an industrial company, but now he concentrates on his shop. Since he became a member of Faulu, he has started saving his money. He hopes to expand his business to become a wholesale shop. As a hardworking man, he also dreams of having a bright future. He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to increase his stock of sugar, rice, flour, salt, and other products for his shop.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, flour, salt, and other products for his shop.

loans.name: Julia  Josefa

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Julia ,  pertenece al banco comunal  pertenece al banco comunal  “Los solidarios”, nuestra socia está ubicada en la provincia D. Urubamba ubicada en el departamento D. Cusco a 1 hora D. la ciudad del Cusco

Nuestra socia tiene 36 años D. edad es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos D. 5 y 2 años D. edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la artesanía  desD. el año 1996, Nuestra socia realiza a mano hermosos trabajos D. decoración y utensilios D. arcilla,  Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para ayudar en la construcción D. su propia vivienda.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Julia belongs to the Los Solidarios Communal Bank. She is located in the Urubamba province in the Cusco department. That is one hour from the city of Cusco. She is 36, in a common law marriage, and has two children. They are five and two. She has been alternating her activities between the household and handicrafts since 1996. She makes beautiful handmaD. decorations and clay utensils. She is requesting a loan to help with the construction of her own house. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Help with the construction of her own home

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina D. is currently in the business of selling beans, simsim, and groundnuts in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of beans to sell. Sabina is 48 years old and is married with a husband who is a director. She has six children who all go to school. With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a wholesale shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which targets returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of beans to sell.

loans.name: Peter Ngige

texts.en:
Peter is 34 year old and married to Lucy Wangeni. They have two children: Paul is 12 years old and Magdaline is 10 years old.

Peter, who is on his second loan, was introduced to KADET by his sister, who was also a client. Peter has been selling fish for three years. His business is located in Malindi's old town market where his target-customers are the towns’ residents. Peter also does watch repairs as a secondary business. He is able to earn a monthly profit of 8,000 KES from this business. Peter hopes to put the profits he earns from this loan toward buying a piece of land.

He describes himself as very hardworking and ambitious, and he hopes to own a good house and promising businesses.

loans.use: Opening a retail shop worth 30,000 KES; adding fish stock worth 10,000 KES; and purchasing a deep freezer for storing his fish worth 30,000 KES

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni J. is currently in the business of selling drugs in a shop and is requesting a loan to stock more drugs to sell. Poni is 30 years old and is married with a husband that is a field manager. She has 3 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a clinic.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more drugs to sell

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es: Patricia Del Carmen tiene 22 años, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que tiene 1 hija a su cargo y es una menor de edad. Por lo que ella ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante, pues siempre está buscando la manera de mejorar sus ingresos, su único medio de transporte es una bicicleta en donde recorre diferentes lugares, pues ella tiene algunos clientes son muy estables pues siempre está al pendiente de su familia y de lo que ellos necesitan. El financiamiento que solicitan es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas y vestidos. Ella sueña con mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Patricia Del Carmen is 22 years old, has a young daughter she cares for, and sells general merchandise. She is an ambulatory vendor and is constantly looking for ways to improve her income. Currently, her only means of transportation is a bicycle on which she takes her wares to different areas. She has some established clients due to the fact that she is always attentive to their needs and those of their families. She is requesting a capital loan to invest in the purchase of trousers, shirts, skirts, and dresses. She dreams of improving her living conditions and those of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Edwin Irungu

texts.en:
Edwin is a single, 30-year-old man who was introduced to KADET by an existing client who is also his business partner. Edwin provides pool table services in Saba Saba, Malindi and is also employed as a taxi driver. From his businesses Edwin earns a profit of Kshs 12,000 per month.

With this loan Edwin hopes to add it to his savings and buy his own tuk tuk (a motorcycle pulling a passenger trailer). With the extra income from this asset he hopes to build rental houses on his new plot of land.

Edwin describes himself as a down-to-earth man who wants to succeed and who dreams of owning a big transport company in Malindi town.

loans.use: To add to his savings to buy a tuk tuk

loans.name: Jaime Daniel

texts.es:
El joven Jaime Daniel C. es casado tiene un hijo habita en el barrio Pedro Joaquín Chamorro,  es profesor de primaria en el  Centro Educativo Jesús de Nazareth desde hace seis años.

El señor Jaime C. solicito préstamo para cubrir unos gastos  personales de su familia,  es primer credito que se le otorga.
texts.en:
The young man, Jaime Daniel C., is married, has one child and lives in the Pedro Joaquín Chamorro neighborhood. He has been a teacher in the educational center for six years.

Mr. Jaime C. is requesting a loan to cover some personal family expenses. This is his first loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for personal use

loans.name: Edis José

texts.es:
Edis José C. A. es un joven  de 20 años  de edad el cual vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Edis José se dedica a la cría de gallinas ponedoras, el vende sus productos a los vecinos de su comunidad los cuales se muestran muy satisfechos. Comenta que el proyecto le es muy interesante   ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte.

 Actualmente Edis está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢656.000 (seiscientos cincuenta y seis mil colones) para la compra de más gallinas; concentrado, y productos para el tratamiento de enfermedades. Con esto el espera hacer crecer más su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio va bien pero por falta de dinero no ha podido hacerlo crecer más. Con el préstamo que está solicitando espera aumentar las ventas y así mejorar la condición económica de su familia.

Edis José es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Edis José C. A. is 22 years old and lives with his wife and small son in the community of Santa Fe located in Los Chiles, Alajuela province. This community is located in a mountainous region close to Costa Rica’s northern border. He raises livestock and grows agricultural crops, specifically staple grains, sugar, and oranges.

Edis José raises laying hens and sells his products to his neighbors in the community, who are all quite satisfied with the goods. He is very interested in his work and has seen it grow steadily as demand is constantly increasing.

Edis is currently requesting a micro credit of 656,000 colones to purchase more hens, animal feed, and products to treat illnesses. In this way he hopes to expand his business and increase his quality of life. His business is doing well but due to a lack of capital he has not been able to expand. With this loan he hopes to increase his sales and in turn improve his family’s economic condition.

Edis José is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial (Manantial Communal Credit Company) in Santa Fe, one of a hundred member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This is his first loan and he hopes to use it to grow both at a personal level and an economic one. Thanks to this type of organization and its credit-enabling mechanisms, he can dedicate more time to productive activities.


Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hens

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana Cecilia R. G. es una señora de 49 años de edad quien vive con su esposo en una pequeña comunidad llamada La Trinchera de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos años generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios brindando mayores oportunidades de trabajo.

Desde hace poco doña Ana Cecilia inició un negocio de confección de bolsos para mujer. Dice que empezó con una máquina prestada y poco a poco ha visto que da resultando y le va muy bien. Ella elabora diferentes tipos de bolsos que luego vende en negocios de la comunidad o incluso la llegan a buscar a su casa. Su microempresa ha ayudado a que la condición de vida de su familia haya mejorado considerablemente.

En estos momentos doña Ana Cecilia desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢400,000 (cuatrocientos mil colones), para comprar una máquina para coser y materiales como telas, hilos, etc. Con esta inversión espera poder incrementar su producción y mejorar la calidad de los  productos. Afirma que gracias a este préstamo podrá ofrecer más y mejores opciones para sus clientes actuales y potenciales.

Ana Cecilia es socia de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Ana Cecilia R. G. is a 49 year-old woman who lives with her husband in a small community named La Trinchera de Pital, located in the Alajuela province. The main economic activities there are livestock and agriculture, particularly the cultivation of pineapples, being that these are sold principally in international markets. For this reason the community has seen economic development in recent years, generating an increased demand for goods and services that is providing better work opportunities for the population. A short time ago Ana Cecilia started a business making women's purses. She says that she started with a borrowed machine, and little by little she has seen the business give results and now it is going very well. She makes different types of purses that she later sells in the businesses in the community; people also come to her house to buy them. Her small business has helped considerably to improve her family's living standards. Now Ana Cecilia wants to take a loan of 400,000 Costa Rican colones, to buy a sewing machine and materials such as fabric, thread, etc. With this investment she expects to be able to increase her production and improve the quality of her products. She says that thanks to this loan she will be able to offer more and better options for her current and potential customers. Ana Cecilia is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital" (Successful Women of Trinchera de Pital), one of 100 of such organizations that are part of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and she hopes to continue to grow both personally and economically and to participate actively in the credit organization in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and supplies

loans.name: Katana Kitsao

texts.en:
Katana, 41, is married to Joyce (a businesswoman). They have two children, Sifa and Amina. 

Katana's tailoring business, which is 23 years old, is located in Gede-Malindi, where he targets students at a neighboring college and primary schools within the area. He earns a monthly profit of Kshs. 12,000. 

Katana is borrowing his first loan with Kadet, and has previously borrowed from another microfinance organization. He was introduced to Kadet by the chairman of his group. He hopes to save the extra income from this loan for his children’s education.

Katana, who describes himself as a hardworking man, dreams of owning a big house and being a major supplier of coconuts.

loans.use: To buy sacks for distributing coconuts worth Kshs 6,000, purchasing tailoring materials worth Kshs 10,000 and repair of his business premises with Kshs 4,000

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  Teresa,  pertenece al banco comunal  pertenece al banco comunal  “Los solidarios”, nuestra socia está ubicada en la provincia D. Urubamba ubicada en el departamento D. Cusco a 1 hora D. la ciudad del Cusco

Nuestra socia tiene 32 años D. edad, la socia es soltera, nuestra socia es una joven emprendedora, ella es muy carismática y nos cuenta que el ejemplo D. sus padres la llevó a ser cada vez mejor ser humano; Nuestra socia trabaja desD. hace 13 años en la empresa D. artesanía ubicada en el pleno corazón del valle sagrado D. los inkas, está empresa es exportadora y realiza bellísimos trabajos en arcilla, es una empresa bien consolidada y D. acabados D. altísima calidad, Nuestra socia se siente feliz D. seguir laborando en esta empresa que le ha dado la oportunidad D. crecer y aprender muchísimo, ella podría abrir su propia empresa D. artesanías, pero una cuestión D. lealtad a sus jefes no le permite hacerlo al menos No en los siguientes años; Nuestra socia al contrario con sus ahorros D. pago D. está su empresa abrió una discoteca bar para turistas en pleno centro D. Urubamba, le puso el nombre D. Forastero; Nuestra socia ahora solicita el préstamo para mejorar el local D. su discoteca y comprar luces y sonidos D. mejor y mayor capacidad, comprar una televisión.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Teresa belongs to the communal bank "Los Solidarios." She lives in the Urubamba province, located in the Cusco department, one hour from the city of Cusco. Teresa is 32 years old and single. She is a young entrepreneur who is very charismatic, and she tells us that the example of her parents led her to become a better human being. For 13 years she has worked in a handicraft company located in the heart of the Sacred Valley of the Incas. This company is an exporter and makes beautiful works in clay. It is a well-established company and its finished products are of the highest quality. Teresa feels content to continue working for this company that has given her the opportunity to grow and learn a lot. She could open her own handicraft company, but would not do this due to her loyalty to her bosses, at least not in the near term. On the contrary, with her savings from this work, Teresa opened a nightclub bar for tourists in downtown Urubamba, named Forastero. Teresa now requests a loan to improve the premises of her nightclub: to buy lights and sound to improve the quality, to expand the capacity, and to buy a television set. Teresa is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means and she is committed to make each of her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to improve her nightclub bar: to buy lights and sound to improve the quality, to expand the capacity, and to buy a television set.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Albertina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qory Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 34 años, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos. Albertina  trabaja en el INABIF (El Programa Integral Nacional para el Bienestar Familiar) como cocinera, ya son dos años que trabaja en el programa. Albertina es una persona, trabajadora y emprendedora que aparte de su trabajo tiene un pequeño negocio de crianza de cuyes y actualmente tiene 20 cuyes. El crédito que solicita Albertina, es para comprar 30 cuyes. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(Los socios del banco comunal se reúnen cada treinta días en la ciudad de Pucyura que es distrito de la ciudad de Anta del Departamento del Cusco, Pucyura se encuentra ubicada a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Cusco).
texts.en:
Albertina is a member of the “Qory Orcco” communal bank of the Arariwa Association. She is 34 years old, lives with her partner, and has 3 sons. Albertina has been working as a cook for INABIF (the National Integrated Program for Family Welfare) for the past two years. Albertina is a hard-working, entrepreneurial person. Aside from her regular job she also raises guinea pigs and currently has 20 of them. Albertina is requesting a credit to enable her to purchase 30 more guinea pigs.

She is very grateful for this opportunity and promises to make all payments as stipulated in the repayment schedule.

(The communal bank members meet every 30 days in the city of Pucyura, a district of the city of Anta in the province of Cusco. Puycura is 40 minutes from the city of Cusco.)


Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 30 guinea pigs

loans.name: Agnes Habel

texts.en:
Agness is separated from her spouse and is the mothet of two children, Habel and Fumbi. She has been selling charcoal for two years now in Maweni-Malindi and earns a monthly profit of Kshs 16,000. She also supplies coconuts in Malindi town.

Agnes was introduced to Kadet by her sister and she joined. She has applied for a loan, which she will use to buy sacks of charcoal, purchase coconuts in bulk and set up a store. She hopes to start building on her newly-acquired plot with the extra income from this loan.  

Agness is a woman who describes herself as aggressive and determined to achieve her dreams of building a complete residential house on her new plot.

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal and coconuts in bulk, and to set up a store

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Este cliente es originario del Municipio de Cinco Pinos, comarca el Jicaro. Esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de una vaca parida para mejorar su hato ganadero, de esta manera podrá tener leche y cuajada para sus hijos.
texts.en:
This client is originally from the city of Cinco Pinos, el Jicaro region. He is requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow to improve his livestock herd. This way he can get milk and curds for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es:
María Esther es una madre de familia de 45 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a dos de sus cuatro hijos en el sector Collique Alto del distrito de Zaña, una zona rural que vive de la agricultura y que está ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde que tenía 18 años de edad a la crianza y venta de animales. Cuando empezó a vivir junto a su esposo, este negocio pasó a ser una fuente importante de ayuda para sostener la economía de la familia, ya que su esposo trabaja como obrero agrícola y los ingresos que percibe no bastan para sustentarlos.

Maria Esther suele criar pavos, patos y cerdos en la parte posterior de su vivienda y los vende a los negociantes que visitan la zona regularmente. Su cría ha aumentado y los corrales están quedando pequeños para los animales que actualmente tiene, por ello es que ella desea ampliar sus corrales, pero como no posee el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

María Esther es uan mujer entregada a su familia y a su pequeño negocio. Su mayor anhelo es poder seguir adelante para apoyar a su esposo y brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de tener un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
María Esther is a mother, 45 years old, who lives with her husband and two of her four children in the Collique Alto sector of the Zaña district, a rural area where people make their living in agriculture, located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. Since she was 18 years old, María Esther has worked raising and selling animals. When she moved in with her husband, this business became an important contribution to the family's economic support, since her husband works as an agricultural laborer and his income does not suffice to maintain the family. Maria Esther usually raises turkeys, ducks and pigs in the area behind her house, and she sells them to traders who regularly visit the area. The numbers of animals she is raising has increased, and the pens are becoming too small for the animals she currently has. For this reason, she would like to expand her pens, but since she does not have sufficient capital to undertake this project, she has found it necessary to request a loan for the first time. She is asking for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1200 Peruvian new soles, which will help her achieve her goal. María Esther is a woman who is devoted to her family and to her small business. Her greatest desire is to get ahead so that she can help her husband and give her children the opportunity to have a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding her animal pens

loans.name: La Flor Del Jicaral (Flat) Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  LA FLOR DEL JICARAL porque asi se llama la localidad donde viven.   Las personas que forman el grupo son siete, y son: Cornelia Ramírez C., Carmela Ramírez, Cristina Solís Pérez, Felipa Hernández C., Gladis María  López V., Andrés Ramírez Gómez   y  Mary carmen Gómez López.  Todos ellos  viven en el estado de Veracruz, y se dedican  a la crianza de  borregos, cerdos  y a las labores del hogar o al  trabajo del campo.

Cristina esta casada.  Tiene dos hijos. Cristina se dedica a la crianza de borregos y en temporadas  también a la de cerdos ya que a su esposo le gusta  tener  ganado, pues dice que es como un ahorro.  Ella está segura que esta actividad le rendirá suficientes ganancias como para comprar una becerra y en un futuro también dedicarse a la cría de vacas.  

Con este crédito, quiere comprar unos borregos.  Su meta para el futuro es dar una mejor vida a sus hijos en especial al más chico, ya  que  apenas cuenta con seis años.  Con sus ganancias, ella espera mejorar su calidad de vida, y que algún día su hijo pueda ir a la universidad.  .  

Cristina dice sentirse  muy a gusto en el grupo de LA FLOR DEL JICARAL porque ella  conoce a sus  compañeros  y sabe  que puede confiar en ellos.  

A cristina le parece muy bien que existan  prestarios como los de Kiva que  apoyen las actividades  que les ayudan a mantener  a sus familias.

* La senor a la mano izquierda vestido con azul y blanco no es parte del grupo.  Es solamente una amiga.
texts.en:
This group is called LA FLOR DEL JICARAL, because that is the name of the place where they live. There are seven members in the group: Cornelia Ramírez C., Carmela Ramírez, Cristina Solís Pérez, Felipa Hernández C., Gladis María López V., Andrés Ramírez Gómez and Mary Carmen Gómez López. All of them live in the state of Veracruz, and they work raising sheep and pigs, doing household labor or working on farms. Cristina is married and has two children. She works raising sheep, as well as pigs in some seasons. Her husband likes having livestock, since he says it is a form of savings. Cristina is sure that this activity will give her sufficient income to buy a heifer and also begin raising cattle in the future. With this loan, she would like to buy some sheep. Her goal for the future is to give her children a better life, especially the younger one, who is now only six years old. With her earnings, she hopes to improve her quality of life and someday send her son to the university. Cristina says that she feels very comfortable with the group LA FLOR DEL JICARAL, because she is well acquainted with her fellow members and knows that she can trust them. Cristina thinks that it is very good that loan programs such as Kiva exist to help support the activities that allow them to provide for their families. * Note: the woman on the left side of the photo dressed in blue and white is not part of the group; she is only a friend.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sheep to raise

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
La señora María Antonia E. Catillo es madre soltera tiene un hijo vive con sus padres en el barrio Roberto González del hospital España 2c. al norte, es trabajadora activa de la alcaldía Chinandega desde hace cinco años como operaria de limpieza en el barrio Santa Ana.
La Señora María Antonia E.,  trabaja con créditos desde hace tres años, ha tenido cinco créditos el cual ha demostrado responsabilidad en la administración de ello, los créditos anteriores los ha utilizado para cubrir gastos de la familia y mejorar su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
María Antonia E. Catillo is a single mother and has one son. She lives with her parents in the Roberto González neighborhood, which is north of the España 2C hospital. She is a hard-working individual from the municipality of Chinandega. She has worked for the past five years as a cleaning employee in the Santa Ana neighborhood. María has been working with loans for three years. She has had five loans and has shown she is responsible with repaying her debts. Her past loans were used to cover family expenses and on household improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to cover family expenses

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
La Sra. Emiliana Q. tiene 59 años de edad, es soltera, tiene una hija que es mayor de edad y esta casada, vive cerca de la casa de su madre.

La sra. Emiliana se dedica a la lecheria desde hace unos 40 años, vive en una zona dedicada solamente a lecheria y agricultura. Tiene mucha experiencia sobre el manejo del ganado lechero, elabora quesillo y entrega leche a una empresa que produce toda clase de productos lacteos.

Ella esta requiriendo el prestamo de dinero para poder construir un muro para su casa, asi para que este protegida de robos y para que este muro sirva como corral para que su ganado lechero.

Es segundo credito que solicito de nuestra institucion, es buena cliente, tiene buen historial crediticio
texts.en:
Sra. Emiliana Q. is 59 years old, single, and has a grown daughter who is married. She lives near the home of her mother.

Sra. Emiliana has been operating a dairy for approximately 40 years. The area she lives in is known solely for dairy farming and agriculture. She has a great deal of experience in raising dairy cattle, making cheeses, and delivering milk to a business that produces all types of dairy products.

She is requesting a loan to build a security wall for her home to protect her from robbers. The wall will also serve as a corral for her dairy cows. This will be the second loan she has requested from our Institution. Sra. Emiliana is a good client and has a good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a security wall around her home

loans.name: Andrew Muthaisu

texts.en:
Andrew, 41, is married to Rose Mueni, and together they have two children, Justus and M..

Andrew runs a cyber cafe/photocopy service shop, and this he has done for the past four years, with a monthly profit of Kshs 8,000. His clients are mainly in Malindi town, where he operates his business.

Andrew had a credit history with another microfinance and joined Kadet after he was introduced by a friend who was already a client. He has applied for a loan, which he will use to upgrade his photocopying machine and computers, repair his business premises and add stock of printing paper and files. With the extra income from this loan, he plans to pay school fees for his children.

A hardworking man, Andrew dreams of owning a promising wholesale business.

loans.use: Upgrade a photocopying machine and computers, repair his business premises and add stock of printing paper and files

loans.name: Papa Mar

texts.fr: Monsieur Papa Mar S. Habite a Yoff Mbenguene a quelques mètres de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC ou il est sociétaire depuis aout 2007. Il est âgé de 39 ans, marie et père d’un enfant de 2 ans 2 mois. Il a déjà bénéficié  de 3 prêts  antérieurs. Depuis plus de 15 ans il évolue  dans l’enseignement  Arabe. Mais il est aussi en même temps ouvrier soudeur depuis 11 ans. Monsieur  S. vit chez son père sous le toit  familial. Par conséquent  il emprunte  250 000 frs pour participer a la construction d’une dalle d’un bâtiment  a la maison. Ceci peut aboutir a la possibilité  d’augmentation du nombre de chambres et contribuer a l’amélioration du cadre de vie cette  famille polygame qui vit dans la promiscuité.
texts.en:
Mr. Papa Mar S. lives in Yoff Mbenguene, a few meters from the U-IMCEC branch office, where he has been a member since August 2007.  He is 39 years old and the father of a child, aged 2 years and 2 months.  Mr. S. has already benefited from three previous loans.  For fifteen years, he has been progressing in Arab studies.  But at the same time, he has been working as a welder for eleven years.   He lives at his father's place in his family's home.  Consequently, he is borrowing 250,000 francs for taking part in the construction of a concrete foundation at home. This could end up increasing the number of bedrooms and helping to improve living conditions for this polygamous family living in crowded conditions and lacking privacy. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Natividad De La Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Natividad de la Concepción S. O. es soltera tiene cuatro hijo tiene dos a su cargo, habita en barrio Pedro Joaquín tiene casa propia, La Señora Natividad S. es trabajadora  de la alcaldía Chinandega como operaria de limpieza publica.
Ella es una mujer emprendedora y con la ayuda de Dios ha sacado adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Natividad de la Concepción S. O. is single and has four children, two of whom are dependents. She lives in her own home in the Pedro Joaquín neighborhood. Natividad is from the municipality of Chinandega and works hard as a public cleaning employee. She is a very enterprising woman and has brought up her children with the help of God.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy iron roofing, wood, nail guns, and nails

loans.name: Dickson Mungathia

texts.en:
Dickson, 29, is single and resides in Malindi town. He runs a retail shop and a cafe in Maweni area, but he also has a barber shop as his secondary business. His customers are mainly households within Maweni.

He was introduced to Kadet by a business partner, who is the founder of their existing group, and is now on his second loan. He has applied for a loan, which he will use to equip his barber shop and add stock to his retail shop. With the profits he receives from this loan, he plans to open up another barber shop. 

Dickson, who describes himself as hardworking, dreams of opening a supermarket in Malindi town.

loans.use: To equip his barber shop and add stock to his retail shop

loans.name: Emma Mauricia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Emma pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qory Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 32 años, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos. Emma es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde vende comestibles y también útiles escolare. El crédito que solicita Emma es para comprar cuadernos, lapiceros, papel, etc.   

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(Los socios del banco comunal se reúnen cada treinta días en la ciudad de Pucyura que es distrito de la ciudad de Anta del Departamento del Cusco, Pucyura se encuentra ubicada a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Cusco).
texts.en:
Emma is a member of the Communal Bank “Qory Orcco”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is 32 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Emma is a hardworking and enterprising person who has a store where she sells groceries as well as school supplies. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy notebooks, pens, paper, and other items. She is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

(The members of this Communal Bank meet every 30 days in the City of Pucyura, Anta District, Department of Cusco. Pucyura is located 40 minutes away from the City of Cusco.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks, pens, paper, and other items

loans.name: Josefa María

texts.es:
La señora Josefa María B., es profesora de primaria desde hace cuatro años, en el Centro Educativo Jesús de Nazareth. Es madre de dos niños, solo uno en periodo escolar, Actualmente  cursa quinto año en la UNAN León. 
Tiene una pequeña casa ubicada en el barrio Pedro Joaquín en donde habita con sus  hijos y su esposo que también es profesor de la Escuela Madre Virginia en Chinandega.
texts.en:
Ms. Josefa María B. has been a primary school teacher for four years, in the Jesús de Nazareth educational center. She is the mother of two children, only one is in school. Now that child is in the fifth year at UNAN (National Autonomous University of Nicaragua) León. She has a small house located in the Pedro Joaquín neighborhood where she lives with her two children and her husband who also is a teacher at the Madre Virginia school in Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to cover family expenses and university payments

loans.name: Sipi Kazungu

texts.en:
Sipi, 32, is married to Mwangombe, who is 61 years old, and together they have eight children. Sipi operates a retail shop, a grocery store and also does some farming on the side in Gahaleni-Malindi area. She earns a monthly profit of Kshs 3,000 from her businesses.

Sipi, who was introduced to Kadet by an existing member, has applied for her first loan, and she has serviced a previous loan with another microfinance. She plans to use the loan amount to add vegetables to her grocery business and other goods like sugar and soap in her retail shop. With the extra income from her loan, she plans to increase her farm acreage and dreams of boosting her children's education.

Sipi describes herself as a hardworking woman.

loans.use: To add vegetables to her grocery business and other goods like sugar and soap in her retail shop

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  Gladys,  pertenece al banco comunal  pertenece al banco comunal  “Los solidarios”, nuestra socia está ubicada en la provincia D. Urubamba ubicada en el departamento D. Cusco a 1 hora D. la ciudad del Cusco

Nuestra socia tiene 39 años D. edad, la socia es madre soltera, y tiene 4 hijos D. 17, 15, 10, 7; Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, La socia antes vendía ropa, viajaba mucho para traer ropa al por mayor D. Juliaca y D. Lima, y el año pasado decidió cambiar D. trabajo y abrió su propio bar restaurante, ella misma cocina y cuida cada detalle D. sus negocio, la socia solicita el dinero para comprar gaseosas y algunas cervezas pequeñas.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our member Gladys, belongs to the communal bank “Los solidarios”. She lives in the province of Urubamba, located in the department of Cusco, 1 hour from the city of Cusco.

Our member is 39 years old. She is a single mother and she has 4 children, ages 17, 15, 10 and 7. Our member alternates her household activities with retail sales. Before she sold clothes and was traveling a lot to Juliaca and Lima. Last year she decided to change jobs and she opened her own restaurant-bar. She cooks and takes care of each detail of her business. She is requesting the money in order to buy soft drinks and some small beers.

She is grateful for and values the opportunity offered to her through this resource and she promises to repay her loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and some small beers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improvements on a daycare center

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Sonia,  pertenece al banco comunal  pertenece al banco comunal  “Los solidarios”, nuestra socia está ubicada en la provincia de Urubamba ubicada en el departamento de Cusco a 1 hora de la ciudad del Cusco

Nuestra socia tiene  32 años  es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de 15, 13, 11 años, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia vende gaseosas, agua mineral, papas, fritas, canchitas, dulces, y todo tipo de snack en un pequeño puesto en camino inka; Nuestra socia también vende algunos trabajos de artesanía desde el año 202 en el mismo camino del inka, Nuestra socia nos manifiesta que debido a las lluvias y al actual problema de inaccesibilidad de la zona a Machupicchu y a muchas otras provincias de Cusco, por las inundaciones ella se ve afectadísima y no sabe cuando arreglarán las autoridades el acceso a diferentes centros arqueológicos; Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar útiles escolares para sus hijos porque en el mes de marzo muchos colegios abrirán sus puertas para un nuevo año escolar.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Solidarios”. She lives in the Province of Urubamba, which is in the Department of Cusco and located an hour away from the City of Cusco.

Sonia is 32 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children (ages 15, 13, and 11). She divides her time between her household activities and her small business. Sonia sells soft drinks, mineral water, French fries, chips, candy, and all types of snacks from a small vending post along one of the Incan roads. She also has been selling handicrafts since 2002 from the same location. Sonia says the recent heavy rains have resulted in floods, thereby making the area of Machupicchu and several other provinces around Cusco inaccessible. The authorities do not know when people will be able to access the various archaeological sites.

Sonia is requesting a loan to buy school supplies for her children because March is the month when many schools open their doors for the new school year. She is grateful for this opportunity and commits to completing her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies for her children

loans.name: El Eden Group

texts.es:
EL EDEN

LA Alcancía Comunal “EL EDEN” está formado por 9 socios, que cursan su sexto ciclo, todos son trabajadores y buscan cualquier circunstancias para salir adelante ya que con su esfuerzo diario pueden brindar un futuro mejor a sus hijos. 
Los socios realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. verduras, comestibles, comida, golosinas y otros socios brindan servicios D. mototaxi y costura.
La presidenta del grupo es Juana, ella se dedica a la venta D. verduras y especerías en el mercado hace varios años, es casada y tiene dos hijos  por las cuales tiene que trabajar ya que su objetivo es la mejora D. su situación económica, el crédito recibido lo invertirá en comprar productos para mejorar sus ganancias.
Como tesorero Juan es una persona responsable en el grupo así como también con su familia, él es electricista hace 15 años negocio que le ha ayudado a aportar con los gastos en casa. Eso para el no es suficiente así que en esta época escolar abrió una librería juntamente con su esposa, esto le  permitirá mejorar la economía en su casa.
Nuestra socia Candelaria se dedica a la venta D. golosinas en su casa hace 1 año, este tipo D. trabajo la favorece ya que es una persona D. avanzada edad, además cuenta con la ayuda D. sus 4 hijos que están pendientes D. ella. Ellos están orgullosos ya que mediante este trabajo pudieron salir adelante.
Los socios agradecen el préstamo y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “El Eden” consists of nine members who are beginning their sixth loan cycle. They are all hard workers who look for any opportunity to get ahead. Already, through their daily efforts, the members have been able to proviD. a better future for their children. They engage in different businesses selling vegetables, groceries, prepared foods, and candy. Others proviD. services such as motorcycle transport and tailoring.

Juana is the group president. She has been selling vegetables and spices at the market for a number of years. She is married and has two children, which is why she has to work. Her main objective is to improve her financial situation. Her loan will be used to buy products to help increase her earnings.

As the group treasurer, Juan has demonstrated responsibility within the Communal Bank and also with his family. He has worked as an electrician for 15 years, and his business helps to pay for his household expenses. At the moment, his business income is not enough. Since the school year has started, he and his wife have opened a bookstore to help improve their finances at home.

Candelaria is a group member who has been selling candy at home for the past year. This type of work is well-suited for someone who is a bit older. She also has the help of her four dependent children. They are proud of the fact that their work has helped them to move forward.

The members are grateful for this loan and promise to complete their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary O. is the 49-year-old divorced mother of three children who lives in Kisoko, Nambale. Mary sells secondhand clothes which she ventured into in 2005. Before that she used to keep poultry as a source of income but the income wasn’t enough to be able to sustain her family. She is the sole breadwinner and wasn’t able to give ample time to engage in other activities since it was not easy to manage.

Mary buys her stock twice a year in Nambale and sells it at the same market. She would like to start buying her stock outside Nambale due to the increase in demand of the commodity and this would mean expanding her business. To achieve this, Mary would like to obtain a loan of Ksh 10,000.

Mary’s future plans are to revive her poultry business by buying a chicken hutch and at the same time expanding her clothing business to a wider market. This will assure her economic stability for the better future of her children.

loans.use: To increase her stock and expand her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Giovanna,  pertenece al banco comunal  pertenece al banco comunal  “Los solidarios”, nuestra socia está ubicada en la provincia D. Urubamba ubicada en el departamento D. Cusco a 1 hora D. la ciudad del Cusco

Nuestra socia tiene  34 años D. edad, la socia es conviviente, y tiene 1 hijo D. 4 años; Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades con la artesanía, la socia manifiesta que este año se casara con su pareja, porque ya pudieron ahorrar un poco D. efectivo; Nuestra socia trabaja en un taller D. artesanía, con más D. 50 empleados elaborando diferentes etapas D. la realización D. la artesanía este taller, abre sus puertas a los turistas para ver todo el proceso desD. la materia prima hasta el proceso final del producto antes D. la venta, al final del recorrido hay una galería para comprar los productos; Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para terminar con los acabados D. sus casita propia.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Giovanna is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Solidarios”. She lives in the Province of Urubamba, which is in the Department of Cusco and located an hour away from the City of Cusco.

Giovanna is 34 years old, living with her partner, and has a four year old child. She divides her time between her household activities and making handicrafts. Giovanna says that she and her partner will get married this year since they were able to set asiD. a bit of savings. She works at a craft shop with more than 50 employees who are involved in various stages of producing artistic works. The doors of her workshop are open to tourists who can watch the entire process from raw material to the completion of the final product before purchasing an item. At the end of her tour, customers walk into a gallery to buy the products.

Giovanna is requesting a loan so that she can complete the finishing touches on her house. She is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Complete the finishing touches on her house

loans.name: Pascalia

texts.en:
Pascalia P. is a local businesswoman who does dairy farming, a business she went into after ditching poultry farming for economic reasons. She started her business in 2009 as an income generator for the family and does it at Namable Center where she also stays with her family

Pascalia gets her dairy stock from the local farmers but she has big dreams. She would like to increase her stock to be able to have sufficient income to build a better housing structure for her chickens. Then she would revive her poultry farming business and be able to run two businesses. That would assure her enough money to support her family. To be able to realize this, she wants a loan for Ksh.20000. She is 38 years old and married with four children. Her dream is to expand and run a big business.

loans.use: To increase her stock and build a better place for her animals

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jada Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Jada Virginia L. C. es casada tiene un hijo menor de edad a su cargo, habita en el municipio de el Viejo con la familia de el esposo, es profesora de primaria en el  Centro Educativo Jesús de Nazareth desde hace ocho años.
La señora Jada L. C. solicito este financiamiento para completar para comprar un pequeño solar ya que actualmente vive en casa de su suegra y desea superarse poco a poco con la ayuda de su esposo y su esfuerzo propio.
texts.en:
Jada Virginia L. C. is married and has a minor son under her care; she lives in the El Viejo municipality with her in-laws. She has been an elementary school teacher at Jesús de Nazareth educational center for 8 years. She requested this loan in order to purchase a small lot because she currently lives in her mother-in-law's house and she wants to improve herself gradually with her husband's help and through her own efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a lot.

loans.name: Lillian Dama

texts.en:
Lillian, 28, is married to Enoch, who is a casual laborer in Mbaraka Chembe in Malindi. Together they have four children, three of whom are in preschool. Lillian operates a grocery business in the same area. Her business, which is a year old, targets residents of Malindi and earns a monthly profit of Kshs 7,000.

Lillian was introduced to Kadet by one of the members of her group. She has applied for a loan, which she will use to buy fruits and vegetables and to use part of the money on transport. With the extra income from this loan, Lillian hopes get a bigger kiosk (retail shop) and dreams of building a residential home on the family plot.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables, and pay for transport

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Magdalene is a 46-year-old mother of three children between the ages of 18 and 25 years old. She owns rental houses in Nairobi, and earns extra income through selling sweaters, tablecloths and kangas (African garments), a business she has been running for the past ten years. She has requested a second loan of Kes. 40,000 to improve the condition of her rental houses. She desires to own market stalls, where she can sell her wares. She says that since joining Faulu Kenya, she has been able to pay her utility bills and increase her inventory. She describes herself as happy and confident.

loans.use: Renovate her rental houses

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata B. habite dans la localité de Guediawaye. Elle  a 39 ans et est membre de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis 6 ans. Elle a déjà bénéficié de 4 prêts  antérieurs. Elle  est mariée et mère de 2 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 1 et 8 ans. Mais en plus de ses enfants elle a en charge une autre personne. Madame B. évolue dans le commerce de tissus et de produits cosmétiques. Elle a choisi cette activité  par amour mais aussi pour aider sa famille et son mari. Ce qui la passionne le plus c’est le contact avec la clientèle. Elle sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs pour l’achat de tissus. Elle souhaite renforcer son stock et améliorer  ses revenus financiers.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata B. lives in Guediawaye. She's 39 years old and has been a member of U-IMCEC from six years. She already benefited from four previous loans. She's married and the mother of two children, age 1 and 8. In addition to her own children, she has another person to support. Mrs. B. sells fabrics and cosmetics. She chose this business out of love, but also to help her family and her husband. She's really passionate about being in touch with customers. She's seeking a loan of XOF 400'000 to purchase fabrics. She would like to bolster her stock and increase her income.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Paulina Enoe

texts.es:
La señora Paulina Enoe C., tiene 45 años de edad es casada tiene cuatro hijos todos viven con ella dos estudian en el colegio del barrio. 

La señora paulina  tiene más de cuatro años de trabajar                  con nosotros  lleva 25 créditos,  durante todo este tiempo  ha demostrado ser una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, los crédito anteriores los ha utilizada para mejorar su estilo de vida y mantener estable su negocio. Este desembolso los utilizara para compra de frutas bolsas y otros productos, ya que además de hielo desea vender frescos naturales y popsicles en su casa de habitación, el hielo lo distribuye diario en el bisne  a unas personas que venden pescado,  a diario entrega 30 bolsas de hielo a veces mas .
texts.en:
Paulina Enoe C., 45, is married and has four children, all of whom live with her; two go to the local neighborhood school. Paulina has collaborated with us for 4 years; she has had 25 loans. During all this time she has shown herself to be a very hard-working, responsible person. She used her previous loans to improve her lifestyle and to keep her business stable. She will use this latest loan to buy fruits, bags and other products because she'd like to sell various natural fruit beverages and popsicles besides ice in her home. She delivers ice daily at El Bisne to people who sell fish; she delivers 30 bags of ice daily, sometimes more.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit, sugar, bags and other products.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en: Analie, 36, has businesses in rice farming and hog raising located in Banga, South Cotabato. The eldest of her three children is 13 years old. To help finance her business, she is making a loan of PHP 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., since it provides the lowest interest rate as compared to her previous experience from others, and lessens her financing charge. This loan will help her purchase farm supplies and carabao.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is a 25-year-old single man who sells second hand shoes in Nairobi. He has been running this business for the past four years and says that his business is in a good position and secure. He has requested a loan of Kes. 40,000 to add stock of second hand shoes. He says that since joining Faulu Kenya, his business has improved, due to sufficiency of stock attracting more customers. He describes himself as development-conscious.

loans.use: To add to his stock of shoes

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana María tiene 24 años, esta casada vive con su esposo, tienen una hija de 3 años, quien ya va al colegio. Ana tiene una tienda de artìculos de consumo diario la cual empezó hace tres años cuando la despidieron de su empleo, y le dieron indemnización, fue cuando tomo la decisión de tener su propio negocio y decidio que este fuera una venta de artículos de consumo diario, el cual le ha ayudado bastante a salir adelante y actualmente puso una venta de panes preparados (salchichas, cebolla, mayonesa, mostaza, ketchup, repollo, etc) y por eso pide a que se le apoye con un crédito para poder darle a su familia un mejor futura y ver a su hija con buna salud y estudiando.
texts.en:
Ana María is 24 years old, married, and has a three year old daughter who is already attending nursery school. She operates a convenience store that she established three years ago after she was laid off from her job. With her severance money, she started her own business and decided to sell daily consumer products. Her income has been enough to keep her moving forward. Ana María currently sells prepared sandwiches (containing sausages, onions, mayonnaise, mustard, ketchup, cabbage, and other items). Therefore, she is requesting a loan so that she can provide a better future for her family and ensure that her daughter maintains good health and receives an education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more products for her store

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge Alberto R. G. es un señor de 52 años de edad quien vive con su mamá en una pequeña comunidad llamada La Trinchera de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos años generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios brindando mayores oportunidades de trabajo.

Desde muy joven don Jorge se ha dedicado a la cría de cerdo para engorde. El vende sus productos a los vecinos de la comunidad, quienes se muestran muy satisfechos por la calidad de estos. Comenta que desde que inició el proyecto se ha sentido muy bien ya que ha podido sacar a sus hijos y su familia adelante.

Actualmente don Jorge esta solicitando un préstamo de ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones)  para la compra de más cerdos para engorde, así como compra de alimento entre otros insumos necesarios para que su negocio salga adelante Con esta inversión espera que su microempresa crezca más, para poder atender a más clientes y ofrecerles mejores productos. 

Jorge Alberto R. G. es socio de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto R. G. is 52 years old and lives with his mother in the small community of La Trinchera de Pital, which is located in Alajuela Province. The main business activities in the area are livestock breeding and agriculture, with an emphasis on the cultivation of pineapple to be sold primarily to international markets. Community development has been growing in recent years, thereby generating more demand for goods and services, as well as creating job opportunities.

From a young age, Don Jorge has been raising pigs for fattening. He sells the animals to residents of the community, who are very satisfied with their quality.
