Since his business started, Don Jorge says it has done very well and has enabled his family to get ahead. He is now requesting a loan of 500,000 CRC to acquire more pigs for fattening. Part of the money will be used to purchase feed and other supplies needed for his business to succeed. With this investment, he hopes his micro-enterprise will continue to grow so that he can serve more customers and offer them better products.

Jorge Alberto R. G. is a member of the Communal Enterprise of Successful Women for La Trinchera de Pital, one of 100 partner organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he hopes to continue growing personally and financially. In addition, he plans to actively participate in his local micro-credit organization.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs, animal feed, and supplies

loans.name: Phanice

texts.en:
Phanice A. is a 43-year-old single mother of three (3) children and a businesswoman in Nambale. She has been in business since 2007. She started with raising poultry and later ventured into clothes selling which acts as an income-generator and is less time-consuming.

Phanice buys her stock in Busia on a monthly basis and has a plan to expand her business. After learning about how to improve one's business from KMET and about loans, she was interested and saw that this might be her opportunity to meet her goal. She would like a loan for Ksh.10,000 as a way of starting somewhere on her road to success.

loans.use: To increase her stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Marlon Antonio R. U. es soltero tiene dos hijo  su cargo, habita en el barrio Roberto Gonzales tiene casa propia, es profesor de primaria en el  centro educativo Jesús de Nazareth desde hace ocho años en el turno de la tarde.
El señor R. U. es una persona emprendedora y con buenos principios con el crédito anterior mejoro su casa de habitación, pero ahora necesita asegurarla un poco mas ya que la zona donde vive es bastante peligrosa y su casa la mayor parte del tiempo permanece sola.
texts.en:
Marlon Antonio R. U. is single and has two children under his care. He lives in the Roberto Gonzalez neighborhood in his own house. He has been an elementary school teacher at the Jesús de Nazareth educational center's afternoon shift for 8 years. Mr. R. U. is an enterprising person with good principles. He used his previous loan to improve his home but now he needs to secure it better because the area he lives in is quite dangerous and his house is left unattended most of the time.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two doors and other materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma, 50, requested a loan of 15,000 PHP for her bakery business. She has been a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc., since 2008. Now she has requested additional capital to operate her business. She has businesses also in rice farming and motorcycle transport for passengers. She is the mother of two children. The loan will be used to buy ingredients for the bread and fertilizers for her rice field.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for baking bread, and also to purchase fertilizer for her rice field

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es: Don Carmelo Z. pequeño agricultor de la comarca El Banco del municipio de el Rama, es casado con la Sra. Justina Flores, tiene 4 hijos, Santos de 42 años, Abelardo de 40 y Francisca de 30, quienes ya se casaron y tienen su propia familia, unicamente habita con el el menor, Darvis de28 años quien le ayuda a trabajar la tierra y a cuidar la finca.  Don Carmelo esta solicitando financiamiento de su 4to credito para la siembra de 3 mnz de arroz para posteriormente comercializarlos y obtener ganancias que le permitan mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia. Cuenta con la experiencia necesaria en esta actividad, ya que trabaja sembrando la tierra desde hace mas de 40 años. Tambien siembra maiz, banano, frijoles, tuberculos y se dedica a la actividad pecuaria, ya que tiene unos cuantos animalitos donde obtienen ingresos diarios para el sustento familiar. Se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora, honesta, y muy responsable con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Don Carmelo Z. is a small farmer in the district of El Banco in town of El Rama. He is married Sra. Justina Flores and they have four children. Santos (age 42), Abelardo (age 40) and Francisca (age 30) are all married and have their own families. Darvis (age 28) is the youngest child and the only who still lives at home. He helps his father work the land and look after the farm.

Don Carmelo is requesting his fourth loan so that he can plant rice and sell it within three months. This will help him generate revenue to improve the living standards for himself and his family. He has the necessary experience since he has been working the land for more than 40 years. He also grows corn, bananas, beans, and tubers. In addition, Santos raises livestock and currently has a few small animals that provide daily income to sustain his family. He is known as an individual who is hardworking, honest, and responsible in all of his commitments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire inputs for planting rice

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a business lady based in Machakos. She provides a M-Pesa service (mobile-phone based money transfer service) to her neighbours. She has been running this business for two years. She also earns extra income through operating a pharmacy. Beatrice has requested for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to add cash float to her mobile phone for M-Pesa. She hopes to work hard and open more branches. In 10 years, she wants to be driving and have grown to be wealthy. She describes herself as God-fearing, hardworking and caring.

loans.use: To add cash float to her phone

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline, 26, is a rice farmer in Banga, South Cotabato. She also raises pigs and chickens for additional income. She supports her family through these businesses. She has a 7-year-old child to support.

Jacqueline needs to purchase feed and fertilizers for her businesses. Since she has limited capital, she requested an 8,000 Philippine peso loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc.

loans.use: To buy feed and fertilizers

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Madame Mariama D. habite dans la localité de Dalifort. Elle est âgée de 42 ans et a une ancienneté de 6 ans a la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Dalifort. Elle est mariée et sans enfants. Elle évolue  dans le commerce et vend des marchandises de  boutique. C’est sa volonté d’aider son mari dans la gestion de la famille qui l’a pousse à choisir cette activité.  Elle emprunte 300 000 frs pour l’achat de marchandises diverses (bonbons, biscuits, lessives, etc.) en vue de renforcer le stock de la boutique. Son objectif principal est d’améliorer  sa situation économique  et son bien être  social.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariama D. lives in the town of Dalifort. She is 42 years old and has for the past six years been a member of the Dalifort savings bank, which belongs to U-IMCEC (a Senegalese association of mutual savings and loans institutions). She is married but has no children. She has been developing a business and sells goods in a shop. It is her desire to help her husband look after the family which has pushed her to choose this activity. She is borrowing 300,000 francs to buy various goods (sweets, biscuits, washing powder etc..) in order to boost her shop's stock. Her principal aim is to improve her economic situation and her social well-being.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her business

loans.name: Silvia Helena

texts.es: Silvia Helena tiene 43 años, por lo que siempre ha luchado por mejorar su condición económica es la venta de materiales de construcción. Por lo que ha demostrado ser una excelente cliente que se esfuerza cada día para  mejorar su ingresos. Pues todos los días busca la manera de mejorar sus ingresos y ha demostrado que puedo mantener a sus 4 hijos, pues tuvo que mantener este negocio para proporcionarles a sus hijos estudios. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de cemento, bloques, arena, piedrín, cal y cantera. Ella siempre sueña con seguir ampliando su local y proporcionar mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Silvia Helena is 43 years old and has always fought to improve her economic condition. She sells construction materials and has proven herself as an excellent client who strives each day to earn more income. Silvia has demonstrated that she is capable of supporting her four children, providing them with an education, and maintaining her business.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy cement blocks, sand, gravel, limestone, and quarry rocks. She always dreams of expanding her business and providing better conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement blocks, sand, gravel, limestone, and quarry rocks

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth supports her family with a hog raising business. She owns two pigs in Banga, South Cotabato. She is 29 years old and has two children. Her eldest child is just 5 years old. She is thankful for her business because it finances the education of her children.

Janeth’s now requesting a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. of 8,000 Philippine pesos. This will be very helpful in providing feed necessary for her pigs.

loans.use: To buy hog feed

loans.name: Segundo Anastasio

texts.es:
El  señor  Segundo Anastasio P. M., vive en la comarca la Grecia tiene 44 años de edad es casada tiene seis hijos todos viven con él,  tres de ellos estudian. Cabe señalar que toda su familia trabaja con huertos en el patio de su casa y crían aves de patio. 

El  señor Segundo es trabajador de la alcaldía de Chinandega desde hace cinco años como vigilante en el mercado central ha trabajado con créditos desde el    2005 hasta hoy con cinco créditos, ha demostrado ser una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, los crédito anteriores los ha utilizada para mejorar su estilo de vida y brindar condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Anastasio P. M., 44, lives in the La Grecia area. He is married and has 6 children, all of whom live with him; three are students. It is worthy of note that all the family works the orchards in his yard and raise barnyard fowl. Segundo has worked for Chinandega's city hall for 5 years as a watchman at the central market. He has managed loans since 2005 and has had 5 loans to date. He has shown himself to be a very hard-working, responsible persons. He used the previous loans to improve his lifestyle and to offer better living conditions to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
la sra. Valentina M. F. tiene 52 años de edad, vive en la colonia Fatima de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa. Valentina se dedica a la venta de lacteos como ser queso, quesillo y mantequilla. tambien tiene una pequeña pulperia, su fuerte son las ventas de lacteos, antes hacia chorizos pero los materiales para elaborarlos subieron de precio y no tenia capital para poder hacerlos. Valentina en estos momentos esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas lacteos, este tipo de producto le deja buenas ganancias, muchas personas compran estos lacteos ya que son muy sabrosos e higienicos.
Valentina es una mujer casada y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales todos ya estan casados. 
Valentina dice sentirse muy feliz ya que su negocio esta creciendo cada dia mas.
texts.en:
Sra. Valentina M. F. is 52 years old and lives in the Fatima subdivision of the city of Tegucigalpa. She sells dairy products, such as cheeses (in different sizes) and butter. In addition, she manages a small grocery store. Her dairy product sales are strong. Valentina previously made chorizo sausages, but the cost of her ingredients and supplies kept increasing, and she did not have enough capital to keep making them. At the moment, Valentina is requesting a loan to buy more dairy products. This type of product generates good sales because many people enjoy it for its flavor and hygienic preparation.

Valentina is married and has four grown children who have their own families. She says she is very happy that her business continues to grow each day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheeses & butter

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Dignidad

texts.es:
Maria Dignidad tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos en el sector San Luis, un caserío de la zona rural del distrito de Monsefú, ubicado a treinta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace cinco años tiene instalada en su vivienda una pequeña bodega en donde ofrece a sus clientes productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes y bebidas. Ella instaló el negocio con el dinero que su esposo le daba mensualmente para que lo invirtiera en el hogar. Inició poniendo en venta pocos productos,pero despues fue creciendo y ahora ya es un negocio estable.

El negocio goza de buena acogida por parte de sus vecinos y clientes, ya que María Dignidad les ofrece un buen trato y porque tienen a su alcance productos de consumo diario, en la zona no hay mercado cercano por lo que negocios como estos son de vital importancia.

María Dignidad desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de utiles escolares para ofrecerlos durante la presente campaña escolar. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer carismatica y bastante trabajadora. Sus vecinos y clientes le tienen mucha estima ya que la consideran una persona honrada y que siempre ayuda a los que la necesitan.
texts.en:
Maria Dignidad, 35, is married and lives with her husband and their 3 children in San Luis, a small village in the rural area of Monsefú district, located 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For 5 years she has had a small shop in her house where she offers her customers basic necessities, groceries and drinks. She established this business with money that her husband was giving her monthly to invest in the home. She started out selling a small number of products, but later the business grew and now it is a stable business. The business is well-accepted by neighbors and customers, since Maria Dignidad offers them good deals and because she makes her consumer products available daily. In this neighborhood there is not a market close by, so businesses like hers are of vital importance to the community. Maria Dignidad wants to increase her business, buying school supplies to offer during the current school season. For this reason she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 Peruvian soles that will help her to achieve this goal. She is a woman who is charismatic and hardworking. Her neighbors and customers hold her in high esteem, since they consider her to be an honest person who always helps those in need.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy school supplies to increase her business during the school seasons

loans.name: Douglas Ignacio

texts.es:
En municipio de Nagarote, el señor Douglas C. es propietario de una pulpería que atiende desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, es una persona trabajadora dedicada a su negocio.
Está solicitando el crédito para compra de los productos de la pulpería como: granos básicos arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, café, papel higiénico, entre otros productos. Con este crédito logrará obtener mayores ventas y utilidades para el sustento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Douglas C. has a grocery store in Nagarote. He is open for business from 6am until 6pm; he is a hard-working, dedicated person. He is requesting funding to buy stock items for the store like: basic grains, rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, soap, coffee, toilet paper, among other products. This loan will make it possible for him to increase his sales and profits for his family's support.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Adriana De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Adriana de Los Ángeles S. F. es una joven señora de 23 años de edad que vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo en una comunidad llamada San Ramón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche, la agricultura mayormente de café, plátano y también se da mucho la cría de cerdos. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. 

Adriana se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de plátano desde hace aproximadamente 2 años. Dice que el mercado para este producto es muy bueno. Comenta que gracias a este proyecto sus condiciones de vida han mejorado considerablemente y dice además que ha crecido como persona y ha adquirido mucho conocimiento, dice que se siente muy capaz y muy feliz de poder mantenerse activa.

En estos momentos Adriana desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢656,000 (seiscientos cincuenta y seis mil colones), para sembrar y darle mantenimiento a su cosecha además comprar fertilizantes, abonos entre otros insumos. Con esta inversión  espera lograr una buena cosecha, con un producto de características apropiadas para conseguir un precio de venta alto poder incrementar la producción.
 
Adriana es socia de la Asociación de Productores Agrícolas Ramonenses, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Adriana de Los Ángeles S. F. is a 23 year old young woman who lives with her husband and young son in a community called San Ramón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Province of Cartago. It's a small rural community. Its residents work in milk production and in agriculture- mostly in coffee and plantains. There is also a lot of raising pigs. It has an irregular landscape and a lot of its land is maintained a a tropical rainforest. Adriana is a farmer, specifically of plantains for approximately the last two years. She says that the market for this product is very good. She comments that thanks to this project her living conditions have improved considerably and she says that she has grown as a person as well and acquired a lot of knowledge. She says that she feels very capable and very happy to be able to stay active. At this time Adriana wants to obtain a microloan of ¢656,000 (six hundred and fifty six thousand Colones) to plant and to maintain the harvest. In addition, she wants to buy chemical and organic fertilizer and other materials. With this investment, she hopes to have a good harvest, with a product with appropiate characteristics to fetch a high price to be able to increase production. Adriana is a member of the Asociación de Productores Agrícolas Ramonenses, one of 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan and with it she hopes to continue growing on a personal and economic level as well as continue to participate actively in the credit organization in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for planting and maintaning plantains.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: 39-year-old Jean has been a rice farmer since 1990.  Her rice field in Banga, South Cotabato is one hectare.  She’s married to Romulo and has four children. Her eldest child is 18 years old.  Currently, she is applying for a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. of PHP 15,000.  She joined CEVI and took a loan with only 2% interest.  The loan will help her purchase fertilizer for her field and send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Carlos José

texts.es:
El  señor Carlos José C. C.  es obrero, casado,  Tiene dos hijos menores vive en el barrio la florida con su familia, trabaja como operario de limpieza en el tren de aseo desde hace nueve años en la Alcaldía de Chinandega.
El  señor Carlos C. tiene tres años de trabajar con  crédito en esta financiera con cuatro créditos. El señor C. ha demostrado responsabilidad y honestidad.
Siempre ha trabajado arduamente para llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar y para que a sus pequeños hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Carlos José C. C. is a laborer. He is married and they have two, minor children. They live in the La Florida neighborhood. He works as a cleaning crew member for Chinandega's municipal government. Mr. Carlos C. has collaborated with this financial institution for three years. He has demonstrated responsibility and honesty. He has always worked hard to support his home and so that his children wouldn't lack anything.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For personal expenses.

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
el sr. Jose Maria P. R. tiene 44 años de edad, vive en la colonia 3 de Mayo de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa. Jose se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, su puesto esta ubicado en el mercado los Dolores, tiene mas de 8 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, anteriormente tenia su local en plaza los Dolores pero le salio la oportunidad de conseguir un local en el mercado y esto es mucho mejor para el, ya que en este lugar las ventas son muy buenas. cuesta mucho conseguir un puesto en este mercado. 
Jose tiene un trabajador el cual le ayuda en el negocio.
Jose es casado y tiene 3 hijos, los cuales estan cursando sus estudios.
las ganancias que Jose obtenga las necesita para cubrir con todos los gastos de su hogar y de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Maria P. R., 44, lives in Tegucigalpa's 3 de Mayo neighborhood. Jose sells fruits and vegetables in a stand located in Dolores market. He has been in this line of work for over 8 years. He used to have his fruit stand in the Los Dolores square but the opportunity arose to get a stand inside the market and this is much better for him because sales here are very good; acquiring a stand inside the market is very difficult. Jose has an employee that helps him with the business. Jose is married and has three children, who are students. Jose will use any profits from his busienss to meet household and family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Emprendedores Del Valle Triunfo Group

texts.es:
EMPRENDEDORAS DEL VALLE TRIUNFO
La  Alcancía Comunal “EMPRENDEDORAS DEL VALLE TRIUNFO” es un grupo nuevo, cursan su 1 ciclo y está representado por su presidenta Raquel que es responsable y dedicada al grupo, sobre todo tiene las ganas D. trabajar para su mejora económica al igual que D. sus compañeras.
Ella se dedica a la venta D. comida en su casa hace varios años, y con las ganancias pueD. contribuir con la economía ya que tiene 2 menores hijos. Raquel es una mujer positiva, tiene como objetivo abrir un restaurant y así poder dar trabajo a otras personas.
Lucila es la tesorera del grupo, ella fue quien motivo a las personas para formar el grupo, es una persona responsable y dedicada a sus 4 hijos, Lucila venD. abarrotes en un puesto del mercado hace varios años, ello contribuye a la economía en casa ya que es separada.
Yolanda tiene una bodega en casa hace 8 años, es su única fuente D. ingresos para mantener a sus dos hijos. Ella empezó con una vitrina y algunas golosinas, poco a poco pudo juntar dinero y comprar algunos productos que sus clientes solicitaban. Ahora desea poner otro tipo D. negocios por las noches para así mejorar sus ingresos.
Los 10 socios son responsables D. sus negocios y sus familias, por eso tienen como objetivo mejorar su situación económica y brindarles a sus hijos alguna profesión que en el futuro les permita solventarse a sí mismos.
texts.en:
EMPRENDEDORAS DEL VALLE TRIUNFO The communal fund “EMPRENDEDORAS DEL VALLE TRIUNFO” is a new group. They are in their first cycle and are represented by their president Raquel. She is responsible and dedicated to the group. More than anything she has enthusiasm to work for her economic improvement as well as the other members. She has sold food from her house for several years. With the profits, she is able to contribue to expenses since she has two minor children. Raquel is a positive woman. Her goal is to open a restaurant and thus be able to give work to other people. Lucila is the group's treasurer. She was the reason these people formed the group. She is a responsible person and dedicated to her 4 children. Lucila has sold groceries from in a stall in the market for several years. This contributes to the household finances since she is separated. Yolanda has had a store at her house for 8 years. It is her only source of income to support her two children. She started with a window display and some candies. Little by litte, she was able to get money together and purchase some products that her customers were asking for. Now she wants to start another type of business at night in order to improve her income. The 10 members are responsible with their businesses and their families. This is why they have the goal of improving their financial situation and offering their children a profession in the future that wil allow them to be financially independent.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE OF PRODUCTS

loans.name: Jobert

texts.en:
Jobert, 45, grows rice and corn in Banga, South Cotabato. He started farming last year. Now he manages two hectares of corn and rice fields. He takes good care of the three children in his family. The eldest child is 20. He wants his children to have a bright future. That's why he works hard on the farm in order to provide their needs.

He joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in order to take a loan of 8,000 PHP. He lacks capital and sought help from CEVI. This loan will help to provide fertilizer for his farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
Rosibel C. C. es una señora de 44 años de edad que vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en una comunidad llamada San Ramón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche, la agricultura mayormente de café, plátano y también se da mucho la cría de cerdos. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. 

Doña Rosibel se dedica a la ganadería de leche. Comenta que desde hace 3 años inició su proyecto y que poco a poco ha visto como su negocio crece día a día. Además dice que se siente muy orgullosa como microempresaria ya que se ha ido superando en muchas áreas de su vida tanto profesionalmente como personalmente.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita doña Rosibel es un micro crédito de ¢656,000 (seiscientos cincuenta y seis mil colones), para comprar una vaca más ya que así podrá  mejorar su negocio y hacerlo crecer más. Dice que gracias a esto podrá tener un mayor  ingreso y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Doña Rosibel es socia de la Asociación de Productores Agrícolas Ramonenses, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Rosibel C. C. is 44 years old. She lives with her husband and their three children in a community called San Ramón de Santa Teresita de Turrualba in the Cartago Province. It is a small rural community. Its inhabitants devote themselves to milk production, and the farmers mainly grow coffee and bananas. Raising pigs is also a common activity. It has an irregular terrain, and much of the land is maintained as tropical rain forest. Rosibel devotes herself to milk producing cows. She started this project three years ago. Little by little she has seen how her business grows day to day. She also says that she feels very proud as a small businesswoman. She has been improving in many areas of her life, professionally as well as personally. Rosibel is now requesting a loan for ¢656,000 (six hundred fifty six thousand colones) to buy one more cow. That way she will be able to improve her business and make it grow more. She says that thanks to this she will be able to have more income and give her family a better quality of life. Rosibel is a member of the Asociación de Productores Agrícolas Ramonenses, one of the 100 partner organizations with Edesa in Costa Rica. This will be her second loan. She plans on continuing to grow on a personal and economic level and participating in the loan organization in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Cesar Francisco

texts.es:
El  señor Cesar Francisco R. R.  es Lic. En contaduría pública casado tiene un hijo y vive con su familia de cruz Lorena 2 1/2c. Abajo. Trabaja para la alcaldía de Chinandega como auditor fiscas desde hace diez años.

El  señor Cesar es primera  vez que trabaja con crédito en esta financiera. El crédito lo utilizara para cubrir gastos de la universidad ya esta sacando otra carrera en Administración de empresa, y le corresponde pagar matricula y dos meses que tiene pendiente por pagar.
texts.en:
Cesar Francisco R. R. is a graduate in public accounting. He is married and has a son. He and his family live two-and-a-half blocks below Cruz Lorena. He has worked for Chinandega's city hall as a fiscal auditor for ten years. This is Cesar's first loan with this financial institution. He will use the funds to pay university costs because he is studying a second career, Business Administration, and he must pay entrance fees and two months back tuition that he owes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay universtity tuition costs.

loans.name: Marcial Rafael

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote el señor Marcial T. se dedica a la actividad ganadera desde hace 20 años dedicándose a la crianza de vaquillas para la extracción de leche y comercializarla.
Está solicitando un crédito para la compra de 4 vaquillas preñadas para aumentar su hato ganadero y así aumentar su venta de leche para mantener sus cuatro hijos en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Marcial T. has been a cattleman for 20 years in Nagarote. He specializes in raising dairy cows for milk production. He is asking for funds to buy 4 cows to increase his herd and thereby increase milk production, the sale of which makes it possible to support his four, school-age children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy four cows.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin is a 32-year-old father of two school-going children. He owns a mechanical and electrical garage where he provides clients with mechanical, electrical, panel beating and re-spraying services. He has been running this business for 11 years and says that the environment of his business is good and friendly. He has requested a second loan of Kes. 40,000 to buy electrical tools and a compressor. He says that Faulu Kenya has enabled him to be a good businessman, since he can afford most of the things required by his customers. He describes himself as dedicated and serious.

loans.use: To buy electrical tools & a compressor

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 45 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en el sector Callanca del distrito de Monsefú, una zona agricola ubicada a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar como obrero en una fabrica de ladrillos ubicada cerca a su vivienda, pero como esta actividad no le provee los ingresos necesarios para sustentar a su familia también se dedica a la agricultura: posee media hectárea de terreno de cultivo donde suele sembrar hortalizas y diversos cereales.

Miguel desea instalar en su terreno el cultivo de maíz, pero aún le falta completar el dinero necesario para realizar esta acción, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de semilla certificada y de fertilizantes para instalar y mantener su cultivo.

El es un padre trabajador y bastante honrado. Su mayor anhelo es darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Miguel, 45, is married and lives with his wife and two children in the Callanca sector of Monsefú district; this is an agricultural area located half an hour from the city of Chiclayo. He works as a laborer in a brick factory near his house but, because this employment does not produce sufficient income to support his family, he also farms. He has half an acre of farmland where the tends to grow vegetables and grains. Miguel wants to start to plant corn but needs funds to do so. He is asking Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 new soles to buy certified seed and fertilizers for his crops. He is a hard-working and quite honest father. His greatest wish is to provide his family with a better quality of life. He has collaborated previously with our Institution and has shown himself to be a punctual and responsible client with respect to meeting his repayment obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy certified corn seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gualacenitas(Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras dispuestas a dar lo mejor de sí para sus familias formaron el Banco Comunal Gualaceñitas, ubicado en Gualaceo un hermoso  cantón oriental de la provincia D. Azuay en el  centro sur D.  Ecuador bañado por los ríos Santa Bárbara y San Francisco. Debido  a su localización y la belleza de su tierra  se le conoce como “Jardín Azuayo”, aquí su gente se dedica a la confección de calzado y otros artículos en cuero, así como la manufactura de paños y otras  artesanías típicas D. lugar.

Celia Sanmartín vive en este  hermoso Cantón y es socia activa hace dos ciclos de la fundación, ella tiene 35 años de edad, soltera vive en casa de su hermana donde tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres hace ya 18 años, su horario de atención es de 06H30 a 21H00 todos los días sin descanso.

Con el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue  va adquirir  arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón, y otros productos de primera necesidad y cuidado  personal, su gran sueño es concluir el curso de belleza que estaba siguiendo y montar su propio gabinete.

Natali Y. es una socia muy alegre y gran amiga de todas sus compañeras D. banco comunal, tiene 24 años de edad,  está casada  y lleva seis meses de gestación de su primogénito que esperan con ansia, su esposo  es comerciante de productos de primera necesidad abasteciendo a las  tiendas de abarrotes de la localidad mientras que ella se dedica a su tienda de abarrotes en la que lleva tres años, el local donde funciona su negocio es arrendado y paga a medias con su hermano, éste está ubicado junto a una escuelita y su horario de atención es de 06H30 a 14H00,  no tienen casa propia  aún pero viven en casa de su cuñada.

Además nos comenta que  el local lo arrienda a medias con su hermano y esta ubicado a lado de una escuela, su horario de atención  es de 06:30 a 14:00, con el crédito  solicitado a  la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR comprará  una vitrina, galletas, caramelos, gelatinas, pastas y más golosinas, así como arroz, azúcar, sal, etc. para abastecer su tienda.

Su gran sueño es finalizar su carrera de Contabilidad Superior.
texts.en:
A Group of enterprizing women determined to give the best to their familias formed the “Gualaceñitas” communal bank, located in Gualaceo, a beautiful western countryside in the Azuay province in the center of Ecuador. It is bathed by the Santa Bárbara and San Francisco rivers and its location and land’s beauty makes it known as “Jardín Azuayo.” The people here make shoes and other leather goods, towels and other crafts typical of the region. Celia lives in this lovely countryside and has been active with the foundation for two cycles. She is 35 years old, single and lives in her sister’s home, where she has had a small food store for the past 18 years. She works from 6:30am to 9:00pm every day without rest. She will use the money from this loan, though FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR, to buy sugar, cooking oil, soap, and other personal and household products. She wants to finish the beauty course she has been taking and open her own beauty salon. Natali is happy and good friends with all the members of the communal bank. She is 24 years old, married six months into her pregnancy. She and her husband are awaiting with anticipation. Her husband sells basic need items to grocery stores in the area, while she tends her own grocery store, which she has had for three years. Her business location is rented and she and her brother each pay half. It’s located next to a small school and she works from 6:30 am to 2:00 pm. They don’t have their own home yet, but they live with her sister-in-law. She will use the money from this loan to buy a showcase and cookies, caramels, gelatin treats, and other treats and snacks, also rice, sugar, salt, etc. to supply her store. She hopes to be able to start her accounting career.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Jorge Humberto

texts.es:
el sr. Jorge Humberto O. tiene 38 años de edad, vive en la colonia Sempe de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, tiene un pequeño comedor en el cual vende desayunos, almuerzos y la especialidad del negocio es la carne asada. Don Jorge cuenta con 4 empleados. Jorge se levanta a las 5 de la mañana todos los dias ya que tiene un contrato de servicio de alimentacion con la policia Municipal.
Jorge es casado y tiene 4 hijos, 3 de ellos estan estudiando y uno es recien nacido.
el credito que solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en su negocio ya que las ventas estan mejorando y no se da abasto para cubrir las necesidades de todos sus clientes.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con todos los gastos de su familia y de su hogar. dice sentirse muy feliz ya que tuvo la bendicion de Dios de darle otro hijo que nacio sano. su hijo apenas tiene dos semanas de haber nacido.
texts.en:
Jorge Humberto O., 38, lives in Tegucigalpa's Sempe neighborhood. He has a small eatery where he sells breakfasts and lunches; his specialty is grilled meat. Jorge has 4 employees. Jorge gets up at 5am every day because he has a contract to prepare food for the municipal police department. Jorge is married and has 4 children, three of whom are students and one, who is a new-born. He needs funding to invest in his business because sales are improving and he does not have enough supplies to meet all customer demand. He needs the profits to cover family and household expenses. He states that he is very happy because God blessed him with another son who was born healthy; his son is barely two weeks old.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beef, pork, chicken, vegetables, soft-drinks, lard, cooking oil, spices, tortillas, bread, beans, rice, sugar, disposable plates and drinking glasses, coffee, water, juices, potatoes, cabbage, yucca, eggs. butter, cheese, quesillo (a type of cheese similar to cottage cheese)

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine, 53, is a rice farmer in Banga, South Cotabato. She also sells a variety of vegetables as additional income for her family. She is married to Nelson and they have no children. She started in the farming business a long time ago. She's now requesting a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. for 15,000 PHP. This will enable her to buy farm supplies and more vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and vegetables

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana, de 45 años, vive en compañía de sus dos hijos adultos, quienes son agricultores y la ayudan con los gastos del hogar.

Esta trabajadora mujer se ha dedicado desde muy pequeña a la agricultura, en la región sierra la mayoría de personas trabajan en el campo porque se aprenden de generación en generación. Cuando tuvo sus hijos continuó con estas labores y desde entonces siembra maíz y alverjas, ya que son productos que tienen un alto precio en el mercado nacional. En la actualidad, aunque no tiene a quien mantener, sigue sembrando. Sus hijos le propusieron que descansara después de tantos años de esfuerzo, pero a Maximiliana le gusta mucho trabajar la tierra, dice que ya está acostumbrada a despertarse todos los días al amanecer y cuidar de sus verdes campos. Para el futuro tiene muchos planes, entre ellos está su deseo de sembrar en mayor cantidad, sobretodo la alverja, ya que sabe que el precio de este producto se mantiene muy bien en el mercado.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al crédito que le permitirá seguir trabajando para salir adelante. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y semillas de alverja, ya que quiere continuar sembrando y debe asegurar sus tierras para siembras futuras.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is 45 years old. She lives with her two adult children who are farmers and help her with household expenses. This hardworking woman has worked in agriculture since she was very small. In the mountain region, most people work in the field because they learn from generation to generation. When she had her children, she continued with this work and since then she has planted corn and peas. These are products that have a high price in the domestic market. At present, although she is not supporting anyone, she keeps planting. Her children suggested she should rest after so many years of work, but Maximiliana really likes to work the land. She says that she is used to waking up every day at dawn to care for her green fields. She has a lot of plans for the future. Among them is her wish to plant in greater quantities, especially peas, since she knows the price for that product is maintained in the market. This is the second loan that she has had with MFP and she is very grateful to all the people who make it possible to be able to access credit that will allow her to continue working to get ahead. The money she is asking for she will invest in the purchase of fertilizers and pea seed, since she wants to continue planting and she must secure her lands for future plantings.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and seed

loans.name: Leovilgildo

texts.en:
Leovilgildo G. is engaged in the rice farming business. He started tilling his farm in 1980. He still does farming because for him it is a very good business. The income that Leovilgildo gains from his farm really helps him buy food, clothing and other basic needs for their home. 

He would like to apply for a loan of PHP 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies to achieve a bountiful harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy, 43, is living in Banga, South Cotabato with a rice farming business.  He devotes his time to working in his five-hectare rice field to provide for his family's needs.  He heard that Community Economic Ventures, Inc. offers financial support to entrepreneurs like him, and he later joined in May 2009.

His business is continually growing and now he is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP.  This amount will be helpful to sustain his business with a low interest charge.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando es un padre de familia de 35 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus cinco menores hijos en el sector Colector, una zona rural del distrito de San José, ubicado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Lleva mas de 14 años viviendo en la zona y desde ese entonces se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas. Posee un terreno de cultivo donde usualmente siembra alfalfa para venderla a los acopiadores que llegan a la zona, pero en esta ocasión ha decidido sembrar tomate. El cultivo ya está instalado y el se encuentra trabajando arduamente para asegurarse una buena producción.

Orlando desea brindarle mantenimiento a su cultivo, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que  piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes.

El es un padre muy entregado a su familia, es trabajador y honrado. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad. Ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Orlando is a 35 year old father who lives with his wife and five young children in the Colector sector which is a rural area in the San José district located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has lived in this area for the past 14 years working as an agricultural laborer. He has a plot of land where he usually plants alfalfa to sell to local venders, but this time he has decided to plant tomatoes. The seeds have been planted and he is working hard to ensure a good production. Orlando would like to maintain his land, and for this reason he is soliciting a loan of 1500 Nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy fertilizers. He is a father who is very committed to his family. He is a hard and honorable worker. His greatest wish is to give his children a quality education. He has worked previously with our institution and has proved to be a client who is punctual and responsible in his repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers in order to maintain a tomato crop

loans.name: Catalina Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Catalina del Socorro C., es profesora de primaria desde hace quince años, en el centro educativo Jesús de Nazareth. Es madre soltera tiene 2 hijo pero ninguno a su cargo.
Actualmente vive en el barrio Abrahán Rugama junto a  una hermana que tiene problemas mentales.
La señora Catalina Chavarria solicito el crédito para para invertirlo en productos que le encargan por catalogo y cubrir otros gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Catalina del Socorro C. has been an elementary school teacher for 15 years at the Jesús de Nazareth educational center. She is a single mother of a two children, neither of whom is under her care. She currently lives in the Abrahán Rugama neighborhood with a sister, who has mental problems. Catalina needs funds to buy products that she sells by catalogue and to cover some other family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay family expenses.

loans.name: Mae Grace

texts.en:
Mae Grace S., 24 years old, is a goat herder. She also owns a 1½- hectare rice field. She has hired someone to prepare the soil for her and she closely monitors the growth of her rice plants.  The income really help helps her buy the basic needs for their home.

She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow her harvest and to construct a barn as well.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and construct a goat barn

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia, de 54 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus 3 hijos de 23, 18 y 13 años, en una populosa zona de la sierra del Perú.

Desde que tenía 14 años, esta carismática mujer, aprendió las técnicas del bordado en fustanes, primero veía a su madre y luego ella misma empezó a bordar. Ya han pasado 40 años desde entonces y siente que cada vez lo hace mejor. En el camino ha aprendido mucho y lo ha sabido plasmar con dedicación en cada uno de sus bordados en los vestuarios de los danzantes de las fiestas patronales de la zona donde vive, además es una actividad que le entretiene. En la actualidad debe cubrir sola los gastos de sus hijos, ya que estudian y los mantiene con el bordado de fustanes y chalecos. Cuando tiene muchos pedidos contrata el servicio de dos jóvenes que le ayudan a avanzar más rápido, labor que realiza en su casa. Emilia es una mujer que no puede vivir sin hacer nada, pues mientras conversa va armando su ovillo de lana.  Para el futuro tiene pensado instalar un pequeño taller de bordado en su vivienda y para trabajar con cantidades mayores.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hacen posible que pueda recibir el crédito para seguir trabajando. Emilia tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de lanas e hilos de diversos colores para continuar bordando, ya que quiere cumplir con un pedido grande de fustanes y chalecos para un grupo de baile de danzas de la zona.
texts.en:
Emilia, 54, lives in her own house with her three children, who are 23, 18 and 13 years old, in a densely populated mountain area of Perú. Since she was 14 years old, this charismatic woman learned to embroider fustanes (woman’s white skirt), first by watching her mother and then on her own. Forty years have gone by since then and each time she does it bettter. Along the way, she has learned much and her knowledge is refelcted in each of the embroideries she does on the costumes that area feast day dancers wear. Besides, this is an activity that keeps her entertained. Currently, she must see to her children's needs by herself. They are in school and she must support them with earnings from her embroidery on fustanes and vests. When she has a lot of orders, she hires two young people to help her get the work done faster; the work is done in her home. Emilia is a woman that doesn't know how to be idle; even when she's chatting her hands are busy assembling her ball of wool. For the future, she plans to set up a small embroidery shop in her home so that she can manage larger work orders. This is her first loan with MFP and she is very grateful to all the people that make it possible for her to receive credit to continue working. Emilia plans to use the money to buy wool and thread in various colors to continue embroidering because she wants to finish a large order of fustanes and vests for a dance group in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool and thread.

loans.name: Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Auxiliadora C. C. es una señora de 39 años de edad que vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en una comunidad llamada San Ramón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche, la agricultura mayormente de café, plátano y también se da mucho la cría de cerdos. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. 

Doña Auxiliadora se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de banano desde hace 4 años. Dice que el mercado para este producto es muy bueno. Comenta que gracias a este proyecto sus condiciones de vida han mejorado considerablemente y dice además que ha crecido como persona y ha adquirido mucho conocimiento.

Doña Auxiliadora desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢656,000 (seiscientos cincuenta y seis mil colones), para darle mantenimiento a su cosecha además comprar fertilizantes entre otros insumos. Con esta inversión  espera lograr una buena cosecha, con un producto de características apropiadas para conseguir un precio de venta alto poder incrementar la producción. 

Doña Auxiliadora es socia de la Asociación de Productores Agrícolas Ramonenses, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Auxiliadora C. C. is a 39-year-old woman who lives with her husband and their two children in a community called San Ramón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, in the province of Cartago. It is a small rural community. Its residents work in milk production, agriculture--mainly coffee and banana farming--and raising pigs. The terrain in this area is irregular, and much of it is still tropical rainforest. Auxiliadora works in farming; specifically, she has grown bananas for four years. She says the market for this product is very good. She tells us that thanks to this project her living conditions have gotten much better, and she also says she has grown as a person and has learned a lot. Auxiliadora wishes to get a loan for ¢656,000 (six hundred fifty-six thousand colones), to take care of her plants and also to buy fertilizer and other supplies. With this investment, she hopes to have a better harvest of a product suited to sell for a high price so she can expand production. Auxiliadora is a member of the Asociación de Productores Agrícolas Ramonenses, one of EDESA's 100 member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be her second loan, and with it she hopes to continue growing on both a personal and an economic level, and to continue participating actively in her community's credit organization.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for banana farming

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.es:
la sra. Eleuteria G. V. tiene 54 años de edad, tiene un pequeño local que esta ubicado en el mercado los Dolores de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa. su negocio opera bajo el nombre de "Quesitos Tellitas".
Eleuteria esta casada, con su esposo trabajan en el mercado, hace mucho tiempo obtuvieron su local en este mercado.
sus productos se venden mucho, este mercado es muy bueno para las ventas, mas los fines de semana.
cabe decir que Eleuteria se dedicaba antes a la costura.
gracias a este negocio logro graduar a su hijo de la universidad, lo cual la tiene muy feliz porque era una de sus metas en su vida.
Eleuteria tiene 3 hijos, los otros dos toda via estan estudiando y espera que tambien sean profesionales algun dia.
Eleuteria necesita el credito para comprar mas lacteos y chicharrones ya que muchos de los clientes que ella tiene son personas que trabajan en la Alcadial Municipal de Tegucigalpa y les vende al credito y hasta finales de mes le pagan lo que consumen.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eleuteria G. V. is 54 years old. She has a small store that is in the Dolores market in the city of Tegucigalpa. Her business operates under the name "Quesitos Tellitas" (Small Tellita Cheeses). Eleuteria is married. She works with her husband in the market. She started her store in this market a long time ago. Her products sell well. The market is very good for sales, especially on weekends. It is appropriate to add that Eleuteria was previously a seamstress. Thanks to her current business, her son has graduated from the university. His graduation made Eleuteria happy because it was one of the goals of her life. Eleuteria has three children. The other two children are studying, and she hopes they will also become professionals some day. She needs a loan to buy more dairy products and fried, ground pork. Many of her customers work in the city hall of Tegucigalpa. She extends credit to them, and they pay their debt to her at the end of the month.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase cheese, soft cheese, butter, and fried, ground pork

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Macario

texts.en: Rice farming is the main source of income for Macario, 54. He has four children. The eldest is 26. He said that his farm today is progressing. But he does not have enough capital to provide farm supplies. Lately, he joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and requested a loan of 10,000 PHP. This loan will enable him to operate his business well and have a good harvest in the future.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Mario Alonso

texts.es:
Mario Alonso M. R. es un señor de 45 años de edad que vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en una comunidad llamada San Ramón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche, la agricultura mayormente de café, plátano y también se da mucho la cría de cerdos. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. 

Desde hace 10 años don Mario se dedica al transporte; él específicamente reparte y vende mercadería alrededor de la provincia de Cartago. Comenta que de esta forma ha podido salir adelante y mantener a su familia.

Debido a tanto desplazamiento en su camión, este ha sufrido diferentes daños y no está en muy buenas condiciones, por lo cual Don Mario requiere un préstamo de ¢656,000 (seiscientos cincuenta y seis mil colones) para la reparación y compra de repuestos para su vehículo, ya que si no está en condiciones apropiadas no puede realizar de forma efectiva su trabajo.

Don Mario es socio de la Asociación de Productores Agrícolas Ramonenses, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Mario Alonso M. Ramirez is 45 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a community called San Ramon de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, in the province of Cartago. It is a small rural community. Its residents primarily work in producing milk, growing coffee and plantains, and raising pigs. The area has an irregular landscape and the majority is a tropical forest. For the past 10 years, Mario has worked in transportation; specifically he sells and distributes merchandise all around Cartago. He relates that thanks to his work he has been able to progress and take care of his family. Due to so much movement in his truck, it has had various problems and isn't in great condition; this is why Mario is seeking a $1200 loan to repair it and to buy the necessary parts for his truck. If his truck isn't in good shape, he can't carry out his work. Mario is a member of the Ramonenses Agricultural Producers Association, one of the 100 partnership organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his second loan with which he hopes to improve his standard of living and actively participate in the credit organization in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Juana Sugey

texts.es:
La señora Juana S. trabaja en elaboración y ventas de mochila en su casa de habitación oficio que aprendió desde joven en el municipio de Nagarote.
Las mochilas que elaboran las vendes en el mercado de Managua donde lo ofertan a los comerciantes ya que las mochilas son de excelentes calidad.
Esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de tela, zíper, hilos, y otros insumos para llevar a cabo su actividad.
texts.en:
Juana S. makes and sells knapsacks in her home; this is a skill she learned when she was a young girl in Nagarote. The knapsacks she makes are sold in Managua's market to merchants because they are of excellent quality. She is asking for funds to buy fabric, zippers, thread and other supplies needed for her work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Isidro Santos

texts.es:
El señor Isidro Santos Z. es Pastor Evangelico de la Iglesia de Dios Pentescostes ubicada en la Colonia Henry Merrian, el recibe un salario de L. 10,000.00 mensuales, Isidro vive en la Populosa 
colonia Flor del Campo y es muy conocido por los vecinos, por su buen desempeño como lider cristiano de su Colonia, se caracteriza por ser muy honesto y responsable, esta casado con Doña Margelia Martinez, viven con una nieta a quien le ayudan con los estudios y la alimentacion,  Necesita el
prestamo para repellar y pulir un cuarto donde vive su hija y suegra, asi mismo quiere colocar ceramica.
Isidro con este credito va a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
el recurrio a solicitar un credito ya que no tiene dinero ahorrado para hacer las modificaciones en su casa de habitacion y con el salario que recibe cubre con la cuota mensual para el pago del credito.
texts.en:
El señor Isidro Santos Z. is Evangelical Pastor of the Pentecostal Church of God located in the Henry Merrian neighborhood. He receives a salary of 10,000.00 Lempiras ($530) monthly. He lives in the populous Flor del Campo (Flower of the Field) neighborhood and is well-known by his neighbors as an effective Christian leader. He is very honest and responsible. He is married to Doña Margelia Martinez. They live with a niece whom they help with studies and meals. He needs a loan to plaster and finish the room where his daughter and mother-in-law live. In addition, he wishes to have ceramic tile installed. With this loan, Isidro will improve the living conditions of his family. He has turned to applying for a loan because he has no money saved to make improvements in his home. He will be able to make timely loan repayments from his monthly salary.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cement, sand, ceramic tile, materials for plastering and remodeling his house

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis, de 42 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposa María (40), que se dedica a la crianza de animales y de sus 5 hijos de 16, 9, 7, 6 años y el último de 7 meses.

Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la construcción de casas, al principio era ayudante, pero con el tiempo y el aprendizaje se hizo maestro de construcción. Hoy dirige obras medianas con un grupo de ayudantes (3 personas). Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque obtiene buenas ganancias económicas y sus servicios son muy buscados, pues el acabado de las obras encargadas es óptimo, ya que cuenta con las herramientas necesarias que hacen posible el buen desempeño. Paralelamente a esta actividad cría ganado vacuno y ovino, los que comercializa en los mercados de su ciudad, para esto cuenta con la ayuda incondicional de su esposa, que sin descuidar la crianza de sus hijos, también vigila el ganado. Para el futuro, Luis tiene planeado ampliar el negocio de construcción que tiene, además también desea comprar mayor cantidad de ganado.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecido con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al crédito para continuar trabajando. Luis tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales de construcción (ladrillos de adobes y arena) para culminar con una obra pendiente; también quiere comprar algunas ovejas para seguir con la comercialización de animales.
texts.en:
Luis, 42, lives in his own house with his wife, María, 40, who raises small farm animals, and their five children, who are 16, 9, 7, 6 years old and the last one, who is 7 months old. For the last 4 years he has been in home construction; first as a helper but, with time and experience, he became a master builder. Today he supervises medium-sized projects with the help of a group of 3 assistants. He likes his work very much because he makes good profits and his services are highly sought-after because the finishings on the jobs he supervises are always of optimal quality; he has the necessary tools to do good jobs. In addition, he also raises sheep and cattle to sell in his city's market. For this activity, he has his wife's unconditional support who, without neglecting raising the children, tends to the cattle. For the future, Luis plans to enlarge his construction business and also wants to buy more cattle. This is his first loan with MFP and he's very grateful to all the people that make it possible for him to have access to credit to continue working. Luis plans to use the funds to buy construction materials (adobe bricks and sand) to finish a pending job; he also wants to buy a few sheep to raise for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Cristian Gerardo

texts.es:
Cristian Gerardo A. H., tiene la edad de 27 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y 3 hijos de 5,10 y 12 años de edad, son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Cristian también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Cristian Gerardo A. H., 27, is married and lives with his wife and three children, who are his main priority in life; they are 5, 10, and 12 years old. He needs funds to support his farming, specifically his coffee crops. The idea is to buy manure and fertilizer. He wants to give his plants proper care and maintenance so that the coffee produced will be of the best quality in order to command the best possible sale price at harvest time. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the terms given. Cristian has been a farmer for many years. He hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability in the future and to continue to grow as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For his coffee crops.

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth del Socorro M. C. es casada tiene cuatro hijos todos  a su cargo y estudian, habita en el barrio Gerardo Lindo es profesora de primaria en el  centro Educativo Jesús de Nazareth desde hace dieciséis años.
La señora Elizabeth además de ser profesora es ama de casa, es primer crédito el que utilizara para sufragar gastos personales, como vive con sus familiares utilizara el crédito para mejorar un poco su condición de vida, además cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que también es profesor.
texts.en:
Elizabeth del Socorro M. C. is married and has four children, all of whom are under her care and are students. She lives in the Gerardo Lindo neighborhood and has been an elementary school teacher at Jesús de Nazareth educational center for 16 years. Elizabeth, besides being a teacher, is also a housewife. This is her first loan and she will use it to pay some personal expenses. Since she lives with relatives, she will use the loan to improve her living conditions a bit. In addition, she can count on her husband's support because he's a teacher, too.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For personal expenses.

loans.name: Agustín Leonel

texts.es:
El señor Agustín C., es de oficio Albañil, tiene su domicilio en el Municipio de Nagarote, ha tenido tres préstamos con CEPRODEL, lo que han sido utilizados en mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, la cual tenía paredes cubiertas de plástico.
Actualmente solicita un nuevo préstamo, para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como: Cemento, Piedra Cantera, para levantar otra pared de su casa, tiene la ventaja que estas mejoras el mismo las realiza dado que su oficio es albañil.
Con este crédito mejora sus condiciones de vida y seguridad de su familia.
texts.en:
Agustín C. is a bricklayer who lives in the Municipality of Nagarote. He has had three loans with CEPRODEL, which have been used to improve the conditions of his home, which had walls covered in plastic. Currently, he is requesting a new loan to use for the purchase of construction materials, such as cement and quarry stone, in order to put up another wall in his house. He has the advantage that he himself can perform these improvements since he works as a bricklayer. With this loan, he will improve the living conditions and security of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy quarry stone and cement

loans.name: Melfa

texts.en: Melfa is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP for raising ducks. She now has 500 ducks and sells 200 eggs a day. She needs more feed for the ducks. She is now 31 years old with three children. Her eldest child is 11 years old. She supports her family with the income she receives from her duckery business. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. because it has a low interest rate and helps a lot to save for her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy duck feed

loans.name: Santos Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Santos Antonio O. B., tiene la edad de 35 años vive en el Barrio Los Rios es acompañado y su mujer trabaja como comerciante, ellos son una familia de cuatro miembros, tienen dos hijos de las edades de 15 y 13 años, ellos ayudan a sus padres en los trabajos del campo y estudian la secundaria. La familia O. se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 16 años.

Ellos siembran Piña, y uno de los principales problemas que han experimentado dede mucho tiempo atras, ha sido la afectación de las plagas a los cultivos y las enfermedades del suelo, es por esta razon que ellos solicitan se le apoye en la compra de fertilizantes que aporten un buen mantenimiento a sus tierras y con esto producir un producto de calidad que se venda a un buen precio y que les garantize un aumento en los ingresos que venga a beneficiar las condiciones de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Santos Antonio O. B., age 35, lives in the Los Rios neighborhood with his life partner. She works as a businesswoman. There are four members in their family. They have two children, ages 15 and 13. The children go to high school and help their parents with the field work. The O. family has been in farming for 16 years. They grow pineapples. Pests that attack the crops and bad soil are the main problems they have had for some time. That is why they are asking for a loan to buy fertilizers to provide good maintenance for their land. This way they will produce a good quality product, which will sell for a good price. It will guarantee them an increase in earnings, which will benefit the family’s living condition.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Zenia Yojana

texts.es:
La joven Zenia S., tiene 27 años de edad, recibe ingresos por el Alquiler de dos Habitaciones
que  logro construir con el dinero que le dieron de su trabajo, ya que tuvo que retirarse porque salio embaraza y necesitaba tiempo para cuidar a sus dos hijos, esta casada con  Angel Flores, una persona trabajadora, es albañil de profesion, ella necesita el dinero para la compra de materiales para realizar mejoras a una habitacion y poder alquilarla y mejorar sus ingresos. Tiene un niño de nueve años el cual asiste a la Escuela y ahora con su bebe que tiene solo un mes de nacido. Zenia es una persona joven, muy humilde y con deseos de sacar adelante su familia. 
Su esposo se va encargar de realizar las mejoras y con eso se ahorran el pago de mano de obra.
con el credito acondicionara una parte mas de su casa para alquilarla y tener mas ingresos, las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Zenia S., 27, earns income by renting out two rooms that she built with money she got from her employment when she had to leave it due to pregnancy. She needed to have time to care for her two children. She is married to Angel Flores, a hard-working person; he's a bricklayer by profession. She needs funds to buy building materials and supplies in order to make improvements to a room so that she can rent it out and improve her income. She has a 9-year-old son in public school and her one-month-old newborn. Zenia is a young, very unassuming person, who wants to see her family do well. Her husband will do the work on the room so that they can save on labor costs. She will use the loan to convert another part of her home to rental space so that their income will increase; she needs the profits to meet family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger supports his family with his hog raising business.  He owns pigs in Banga, South Cotabato.  He is 54 years old and has three children.  His eldest child is 25 years old.  He is thankful for his business because it sustains the finances for the education of his children.  

He’s now requesting a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. of PHP 10,000.  This will be very helpful to provide the feed necessary for his pigs.

loans.use: To buy more pig food

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna P., is a rice grower from Norala, South Cotabato. She has five children, the eldest being 21 and helps her on the farm. Currently, she owns a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm and this is what she solely depends on for income to accommodate their daily needs.

The loan that she applied from Community Economic Ventures Inc., Myrna will use the money to buy farm supplies to grow her harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is a mother of 2 children.  Her eldest is 21 years old.  She supports her family by raising ducks.  She now has 500 ducks available, and is working hard to expand her business.

She would like to request a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. of PHP 10,000.  She will use the loan to buy more feed for her ducks. She likes CEVI's services because they offer a low interest rate and insurance benefits.

loans.use: feeds

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia P. is a pig grower from Norala, in the province of South Cotabato.  She has seven children, most of whom are already married. She decided to grow pigs because it is a very good business, and she would like to help her family more.  Investing in her hog business will go a long way toward paying the daily costs for her family.

She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy piglets and feed.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr: Madame Mariam D. est une jeune dame de 29 ans. Elle habite a Hann Mariste une des cites environnantes de Dalifort. Elle est mariée et évolue dans le commerce de produits cosmétiques. Elle sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs pour renforcer son stock de marchandises. Son objectif principal est d’augmenter ses bénéfices et renforcer  le bien être de sac famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Mariam D., age 29, is a young lady who live in Hann Mariste, one of the housing developments surrounding Dalifort.  She is married and is advancing in the commerce of cosmetics.  She's requesting a loan of 400,000 francs for bolstering her stock of merchandise.  Her main goal is to increase her profits and improve her family's well-being.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her working capital

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José tiene 39 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en el sector Nuevo Santa Rosa del anexo Lagunas, un centro poblado de la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de pavos desde hace 20 años, cría pavos en la parte posterior de su domicilio, los engorda para luego venderlos a los negociantes que visitan la zona de modo regular. Este negocio es la fuente más estable de ingreso económico que posee, ya que también se dedica a la agricultura pero esta actividad no le provee los ingresos que el necesita para solventar los gastos familiares.

José desea mejorar la producción de su negocio, brindandoles a sus pavos una mejor alimentación, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1400 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus aves de corral.

El es un padre honrado y bastante trabajador. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos la posibilidad de seguir estudiando, de modo que puedan asegurarse un futuro prometedor. En la imagen aparece junto a su esposa.
texts.en:
José, 39, is married and lives with his wife and four children in the Nuevo Santa Rosa sector of Lagunas Annex; this is a populated ares in a rural zone of Mórrope district, which is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has raised turkeys for 20 years. He raises them in his back yard, fattening them up and then selling them to merchants who come around the area on a regular basis. This activity is his most stable source of income; he also farms but this activity does not provide enough income to meet all his family expenses. José would like to improve his production by providing his turkeys with better nutrition. For this reason, he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for his first, 1400 new sol, loan to buy nutritionally balanced barnyard fowl feed. He is an honest, quite hard-working father. His greatest wish is to provide his children with the opportunity to continue their education so that they can be assured a more promissing future. ' His wife appears wtih him in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced turkey feed.

loans.name: Jesica Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Jesica del Carmen M. C., vive con su familia en el barrio Carlos Fonseca  tiene un  hijo menor a su cargo y es madre soltera.
La Señora Jesica del Carmen C. es  profesora de primaria desde hace diez años, en el centro educativo Jesús de Nazareth. Es primera vez que trabaja con crédito en esta Financiera. El crédito lo va utilizar para cubrir gastos de la familia.
texts.en:
Jesica del Carmen M. C. lives with her family in the Carlos Fonseca neighborhood. She is a single mother and has a minor son under her care. Jesica del Carmen C. has been an elementary school teacher for 10 years at the Jesús de Nazareth educational center. This is her first loan with this financial institution. She will use the funds to pay family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for family expenses.

loans.name: Julia Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Julia Catalina C. G., vive con su familia en el barrio san Agustín tiene tres hijos uno a su cargo es madre soltera.
La Señora Julia Catalina C. es  profesora de primaria desde hace diez años, en el centro Educativo Jesús de Nazareth.
 Es primera vez que trabaja con crédito en esta Financiera.
texts.en:
