Julia Catalina C. G. lives with her family in the San Agustín neighborhood; she is a single mother and has three children under her care. Mrs. Julia Catalina C. has been an elementary school teacher for ten years at the Jesús de Nazareth educational center. This is her first loan with this financial institution.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for family expenses and for my son's school fees.

loans.name: César

texts.es:
César A. L., tiene la edad de 27 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don César también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
César is 27 years old. He is married and lives with his wife. He is asking for this loan in order to maintain his fields, specifically for growing coffee. He wants to buy fertilizers. He wants to adequately maintain the coffee crop in order to produce a better quality and be able to get the best price come harvest time. This will be his first loan thorough FEDECOSUR and he is very grateful for their help. César has been farming for a number of years. He hopes for a brighter future for his family, for a better quality of life, and to be able to continue to develop as a person and producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizers

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es:
La señora Claudia María B. tiene tres años ½ de trabajar con CEPRODEL, ha tenido siete créditos el cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable, es soltera tiene tres hijos vive en la ciudad de el viejo Chinandega,  es empleado en la Alcaldía de Chinandega desempeñándose como recaudadora tributaria.
Los créditos anteriores han sido importantes ya que he mejorado mis condiciones en mi hogar.
texts.en:
Claudia María B. has collaborated with CEPRODEL for three and a half years; she has had 6 loans and has shown herself to be a responsible person. She is single and lives in El Viejo, Chinandega. She is employed by City Hall as a tax collector. Her previous loans were important because they made it possible for her to improve the conditions of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For personal expenses.

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene I. is 33 years old. He owns 1½ hectares of rice fields, where he closely monitors the growth of his rice plants. Aside from rice, he also raises chickens. The income really helps him to be able to afford the basic needs for his home.

He would like to apply a loan of PHP 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow his harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Myanzi Tukolerewamu Group 1, Mityana

texts.en: K. Sulaiman A. (in the top right corner of the photo) is the leader of his group in Mityana. He is married with 14 children. Some of his children are senior six levers with no other dependants to take care of. He is a businessman, and has maintained his retail shop in the Myanzi trading centre for the last eight years. He is able to earn 30,000 USh as weekly profits. Sulaiman says that his business is faced with challenges, like the seasonal changes and the high cost of transportation (since he always gets his stock from the wholesale shops in the town of Mityana, which is a good distance from his area).  He hopes to expand his shop to have more stock, and educate his young children to reach a higher level in school. Sulaiman needs this loan to be able buy more sugar, salt, cooking oil and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: Buying more sugar, salt, cooking oil and other general merchandise to sell

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
Ramón Sandí B., tiene la edad de 66 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa. No tiene hijos. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Ramón también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Ramón Sandí B., 66, is married and lives with his wife. He has no children. He wants funding to assist his farm, especially his coffee crops. The idea is to buy manure and fertilizers. He wants to provide his plants with adecuate care so that his coffee crop will be of the best possible quality in order to command the best possible sale price at harvest time. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the loan terms offerend. Ramón has been a farmer for many years. He hopes to provide his family with better living conditions and greater economic stability in the future as well as to continue developing as a person and as a grower.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: María Violeta

texts.es:
María Violeta tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su madre y a sus hermanas en el sector Los Siesquenes del caserío Muy Finca, una zona rural dedicada básicamente a la agricultura y que se ubica en el distrito de Mochumí, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la elaboración de chicha de jora (bebida típica de la zona norte del país) desde hace doce años. Ella nos comenta que empezó preparando la chicha para vendérsela a los trabajadores agrícolas que laboran en la zona y que poco a poco fue creciendo, actualmente ya distribuye su mercadería en los caseríos cercanos.

La chicha es consumida por los trabajadores del lugar porque creen que esta bebida les brinda nuevas energias para continuar con sus labores. Esta bebida se prepara desde tiempos ancestrales y su ingrediente principal es un tipo especial de maíz, el cual se muele y se hierve para ser mezclado con azúcar. Eventualmente se le deja fermentar y se consume en fiestas de la zona.

María Violeta desea ampliar su negocio para seguir saliendo adelante. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de maíz y azúcar para seguir elaborando chicha.

Ella es una jovencita hacendosa y muy honrada. Sus vecinos y familiares le tienen mucha estima y la consideran una persona que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar en el momento en que se le necesita.
texts.en:
María Violeta is 28 years old. She is single and lives with her mother and her sisters in the Los Siesquences region of Muy Finca, which is a rural area dedicated primarily to agriculture. It is located in the Mochumí district, an hour from the city of Chiclayo. For the last twelve years she has had a business making and selling chicha de jora (a traditional drink in the northern part of the country). She tells us that she started by making chicha to sell to the agricultural workers who worked in the area. Bit by bit her business grew and now she distributes her merchandise to nearby shops. Workers in this area drink chicha because they think it provides new energy to help them in their labor. This drink has been made since the time of our ancestors and its main ingredient is a special type of maize which is ground and boiled so that it can be mixed with sugar. Eventually it is left to ferment and then be consumed during festivals in the area. María Violeta hopes to grow her business and move forward. With this goal in mind, she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1200 nuevos soles for the first time. She is planning on investing it in buying corn and sugar so she can continue making chicha. She is young and very honorable. Her neighbors and family members hold her in high regard and know that she is always willing to lend a helping hand the moment it is needed.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy maize and sugar for making chicha de jora

location.town: Los Siesquenes - Muy Finca - Mochumí - Lambayeque

loans.name: Myanzi Tukolerewamu Group 2, Mityana

texts.en: B. Kaloli is a hardworking and determined man. He is married with 30 children from different wives. He also takes care of 3 orphans. Kaloli has had a clothes shop in Myanzi on the Mityana-Mubende highway for 24 years, and he is able to make 150,000 USh in profits each week. Kaloli’s biggest business challenge is the high cost of transport from Kampala, where he buys his stock. His experience in business has taught him good customer care skills, which has brought him more customers. He hopes to expand his business further, and although he has already bought more land for his family, he hopes to buy more land for the same purpose. He needs this loan to be able to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
En Barnaoa,  segundo municipio del Departamento del Atlántico, todos conocen a Orlando Suarez S. Bolívar, porque hace bloques  para la venta;  su negocio lo inició en el año 2003 al construir una casa familiar,  con bloques que él mismo elaboró  utilizando un molde arrendado;  desde ese momento se dispersó en el pueblo su saber y la demanda  de este producto fue en aumento, porque los pedidos de sus  vecinos no se hicieron esperar, así como los de algunos  negocios cercanos  como ferreterías, con  las cuales aun sigue negociando;  así comenzó su bloquera, una vez adquirió sus propios moldes y herramientas de trabajo y desde entonces  no ha dejado de trabajar en esta empresa de donde salen todos sus gastos y diariamente brinda satisfacciones al sentir que las viviendas son construidas con sus bloques . Esta es la razón por la cual aplica a un crédito por valor de $800.000 que invertirá en la compra de materia prima para elaborar  los bloques que vende,especialmente de cemento y arena.
Su sueño es organizar su negocio mediante la construcción de un local donde montar su proceso y mantener una mayor producción. Su desafío constante es el no tener mucho capital de trabajo para este propósito, pero sabe que poco a poco con disciplina lo irá construyendo.
texts.en:
Everyone in Barnaoa, Atlántico department's second city, knows Orlando Suarez S. Bolívar because he manufactures and sells bricks. He started the business in 2003 with the construction of a house using bricks he, himself, made with a leased mold. From that day forward, his repute swept through town and demand for his product grew. Orders from his neighbors, as well as from nearby hardware stores (with which he is still in business), were quick to appear. Thus started his brick factory. Once he got his own molds and work tools he hasn't stopped working in this firm, which produces enough income to meet all his expenses; in addition, it daily provides him with the satisfaction of knowing that homes are built with his bricks. This is the reason behind his asking for funding, in the amount of $800.000, to buy raw materials, particularly cement and sand, to make the bricks he sells. His dream is to organize his business in a site where he can both set up his production process and keep a larger stock of product. His constant challenge is not having sufficient capital for this purpose but he knows that, with discipline, he will gradually build it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy brick-making raw materials, especially cement and sand.

loans.name: Nancy Karina

texts.es: La joven Nancy C., reside en la colonia Flor del Campo, tiene una pequeña pulperia desde hace cinco años, la cual ha ido creciendo poco a poco. sus clientes son sus vecinos. Nancy esta casada y su esposo se dedica a trabajar en el servicio de taxi. Ellos tienen dos hijos y tambien le ayuda a su hermano al cuidado de dos sobrinos y les da dinero mensualmente para su alimentacion. Tambien vive con sus dos padres que le ayudan a atender la pulperia, su negocio es muy visitado debido a que es la unica pulperia en el sector. Por lo tanto, Nancy solicita el credito para comprar productos de los cuales tiene mucha demanda, ya que se le terminan rapido en la semana y debe tener en inventario una buena cantidad de cada uno. Asi mismo, recibe otros ingresos porque alquila un cuarto en su casa de habitacion.
texts.en:
Nancy Carvajal lives in the Flor del Campo neighborhood. She has had a small mini-market for five years. It has been growing little by little. Her customers are her neighbors. Nancy is married, and her husband works as a taxi driver. They have two children, and they also help her brother by taking care of their two nephews. He gives them money monthly for their food. She also lives with both of her parents; they help her with the mini-market. Her business is well-frequented because it is the only mini-market in the area. Therefore, Nancy is asking for a loan to buy products that are much in demand. She runs out quickly during the week, and she needs to have a good quantity of each product in stock. At the same time, she receives other income because she rents out a room in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, eggs, condiments, cakes, corn flour, coffee, instant soups, churros, juice, soft drinks, water, salt, spices, and crackers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Pedro R. se dedica al servicio de Transporte "Fletes"  el cual consiste en traslado de Arena, Grava y Piedra de un lugar hacia otro, mismo que realiza con su camion, ya cuenta con clientes fijos en su mayoria son ferreterias. Realiza viajes dentro y fuera de la ciudad, tiene cinco años de 
experiencia en este tipo de actividad, cuenta con dos empleados los que le ayudan a cargar y descar
el material, don Pedro esta casado con la señora Candida la cual tambien tiene un negocio de Venta de Golosinas, juntos se ayudan y han logrado salir adelante, el necesita el credito para poder comprar  
el material a las ferreterias y distribuirlo directamente a sus clientes y asi poder obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Pedro R. has a delivery service specializing in the transportation of sand, gravel and stone from one place to another. He uses his truck and his regular customers are, for the most part, hardware stores. His deliveries are done both within and outside the city. He has five years experience in this type of work and has two employees that help him load and unload the materials. Pedro is married to Candida, who sells snacks and sweets. Together, they have managed to get ahead in life. He needs funding to buy materials from the hardware stores to then distribute directly to his customers thus obtaining higher income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Myanzi Twekembe Group, Mityana

texts.en: B. Perusi, pictured as well in the bottom left, is a part of and the leader of her lending group in Mityana. She is a widow with children most of whom have already completed school. She also takes care of orphans, most of them her grandchildren. Perusi is a business lady and a matooke (steamed green plantain) and beans seller from Myanzi.  She has ten years of business experience. Her businesses are doing well and this is due to the fact that she is so cooperative with her community members. She works hard to ensure that she continues to educate her grandchildren and for them to have good health and a better standard of living. She has her own plantation from which she gets her produce for sale and with the loan that she hopes to get she plans to improve her gardens by buying fertilizers and paying her workers. She is grateful because she has been able to pay school fees for her grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay workers on her farm.

loans.name: Denia Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Denia M. vive en la Colonia Flor del Campo, se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de Tortillas desde hace veinticinco años, Denia comienza a las 12:00 del mediodia y termina a las 4:00 de la tarde su produccion, cuenta con clientes fijos que le entrega las tortillas diariamente, tiene la ayuda de una hija que es la que se encarga de entregarlas,  vende todos los dias de la semana, su esposo labora para una empresa constructora, desempeñandose como motorista.
Tiene cinco hijos de los cuales solo dos dependen de ellos.
Juntos Denia y su esposo han trabajado los dos y han logrado ayudarle a sus hijos.
La señora necesita el dinero para la compra de materia prima como ser harina de maiz y leña. En esta temporada han tenido problemas para encontrar leña y necesita tener en inventario.
texts.en:
Denia M. lives in the Flor del Campo neighborhood. She has made tortillas for sale for the past 25 years. Denia starts production at noon and finishes at 4pm. She has regular customers to whom she delivers tortillas daily; her daughter helps by making the deliveries. She sells every day. Her husband is employed as a driver by a construction company. They have five children but only two are dependent on them still . Together, Denia and her husband have worked and have managed to help their children. She needs funds to buy raw materials, like corn flour and firewood. They have had difficulties this season finding firewood and she needs to have it in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn flour, firewood, lime powder, water.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lwamba Development Group, Mityana

texts.en: M. Samuel, pictured separately at the top left, is a part of the big group. He is a patient and hard working man, married with five children, out of which three are in secondary and two in primary school.  He also takes care of two dependants. Samuel is a produce buyer from Lwamba of Mityana from which he is able to make profits that enable him to take good care of his family. This is Samuel’s second loan from Kiva partner Pearl Microfinance and he is happy that his first loan helped him buy more produce for resale just as he hopese this will do in order to enable him  to make more profits. He buys produce such as rice, beans, maize, etc. for resale.

loans.use: To buy more produce.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 45 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su madre y a su hermano en caserío El Horcón, una zona rural del ditrito de Túcume, ubicado a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicios de costura desde hace diez años, ella tiene instalado en su domicilio un pequeño taller donde confecciona todo tipo de prendas. Aprendió el oficio de una amiga y empezó con una máquina pequeña, poco a poco fue ampliando su negocio y ahora ya cuenta con una máquina de coser semi – industrial.

Su servicios son muy solicitados debido a la calidad con la que ejecuta su trabajo. Victoria se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de tela y en el mantenimiento de su máquina de coser, ya que actualmente tiene muchos pedidos de confección de uniformes por campaña escolar.

Ella es una mujer bastante responsable y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo y ampliar su taller para darle trabajo a otras mujeres del lugar.
texts.en:
Victoria, 45, is single and lives with her mother and brother in the El Horcón settlement, which is a rural area of Túcume district, located 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has been a seamstress for 10 years. She has a small, tailoring workshop in her home where she makes all kinds of articles of clothing. She learned the skill from a friend and she started off with a small sewing machine. Gradually, she expanded her business and now she has a semi-industrial sewing maching. Her services are very sought-after thanks to the high quality of her work. Victoria is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1500 new sol, loan to buy fabric and to service her sewing machine because she currenty has a lot of orders for school uniforms for the new school term. She is quite a responsible and hard-working woman. Her greatest wish is to continue to grow and to expand her workshop so that she can employ other area women.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and to service her sewing machine.

loans.name: Roy

texts.en: Roy I. is a farmer. As the head of the family, he thinks of ways to provide his family with an adequate supply of food, clothing and other basic needs. He is busy in the farm. He has been tilling it for many years now. He would like to apply for a loan of Php 15,000 from Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures Inc. in order to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Luisa Natali

texts.es:
La señora Luisa C. tiene diez años de dedicarse a la Costura, aprendio cuando trabajaba en una Maquila durante seis años, pero tuvo problemas de salud y no podia seguir trabajando, por eso decidio instalar su pequeño taller de costura, en su mayoria sus clientes le solicitan reparaciones a la 
ropa como ser cambio de ziper, pegar botones, hacer ruedos a pantalones entre otros, asi mismo esta temporada es buena porque comienzan las clases y le han solicitado la elaboracion de varios uniformes, tambien hace pantalones, camisas y faldas, doña Luisa es madre soltera, tiene dos niños
los cuales ya estan en las escuela, recibe ayuda monetaria del papa de los niños. 
Es muy trabajadora ya que tambien elabora refrescos naturales y charamuscas de varios sabores.
necesita el credito para comprar materiales para costurar.
texts.en:
Luisa C. has been a seamstress for 10 years. She learned while employed for six years at a Maquila (bonded assembly plant set up by a foreign firm). Health problems prevented her from continuing in that employment so she decided to set up a small tailoring workshop. Most of her customers request clothing repairs like: zipper replacements, button attachments, hemming pants, etc. In addition, this season is good because the new school term is starting and she has been asked for several school uniforms. She also makes pants, shirts and skirts. Luisa is a single mother; she has two children who are in school; she receives some child support help from the father of her children. She is very hard-working because she also prepares fruit juices and charamuscas (frozen fruit drink served in plastic bags) of various flavors. She needs funding to buy sewing materials.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons, needles, pins and zippers.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rose Jean

texts.en: Rose Jean is managing a small rice field. She has one child, who is 8 years-old. Her husband is a farmer and they work together to improve their harvest to support their child more.  The family is now preparing the farm for another planting. They need additional money to buy all the farming materials. She would like to have a loan of Php 12,000 from Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Alinyikira Jungwe Bukooka Group, Mityana

texts.en: B. Margaret is 34 years-old. She appears in the group photo (and in the small photo at the bottom left) and is the leader of her lending group in Mityana. For the last five years, she has had a business selling produce where she buys produce like maize, beans, rice, etc. from farmers in the villages and then resells to trucks and store owners in Kampala and Mityana town. She is able to make 120,000/=  weekly profit and she attributes this to her good customer care in addition to the help of loans. Margaret hopes to expand her business in the future and educate all her children up to tertiary institutions. She needs a loan to be able to purchase more produce for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more produce.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.es:
Madeleine, de 21 años, vive con sus padres y aunque es joven, cada día se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante.

Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la confección de ropa, al principio ayudaba a su primo y veía cómo trabajaba él en su taller ubicado en la ciudad, pero tiempo después aprendió y empezó a trabajar sola. Le gusta mucho la costura, debido a que es un trabajo tranquilo, además obtiene buenas ganancias económicas que le permiten ahorrar para estudiar diseño de modas que es lo que más le interesa ahora. Esta joven emprendedora tiene muchas metas por cumplir y piensa concretarlas a corto plazo. En adelante, planea instalar un pequeño taller de confección, además le entusiasma mucho la idea de darles trabajo a otros jóvenes como ella que quieran progresar con su trabajo.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que acceda al crédito que le permitirá seguir trabajando en lo que tanto le gusta. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de varios fardos de telas, ya que quiere cumplir con un pedido de uniformes que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Madeleine, 21 years old, lives with her parents and although she is young, every day she tries very hard to succeed.

For 2 years, she has worked making clothing. At first, she was helping her cousin and she saw how he worked in his studio, located in the city. However, later she learned and started to work on her own. She likes sewing a lot, since it is a calm job. In addition, she earns a good income, which allows her to save money so that she can study fashion design, which is what she is most interested in now. This young enterprising woman has many goals to achieve and she thinks they will be a reality in the short term. She plans to set up a small sewing workshop; in addition, she is excited about the idea of offering work to other young people like herself who want to make progress with their work.

This is the first loan she has had with MFP and she is very grateful for all the people that make her loan possible, since she will be able to continue working in what she likes so much. The requested money will be invested in the purchase of various bundles of fabric, now that she wants to fulfill a pending order of uniforms.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Protector 2&3 Group

texts.en:
Roselie is the coordinator of her group, Jehova es mi Protector (God is my protector), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Santiago, an area renown for its production of tobacco and beef, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her child.

Roselie is excited to be taking her second loan from Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling used clothing by buying a large package of used clothing that come from places like the Salvation Army. She will use the profits to invest in her home, as she would like to add a room for her child. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Severo

texts.es:
Severo, de 32 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su hermana, su cuñado y su sobrino, a ellos los considera su familia porque aún es soltero.

Cada día se debe despertar al amanecer para dirigirse a vigilar sus campos de cultivo donde siembra maíz, alverja y papa. Desde la siembra el trabajo requiere de mucha dedicación, puesto que primero debe preparar la tierra con los fertilizantes necesarios para después de un tiempo recoger la fructífera cosecha, sin ningún problema. Las labores de campo, según dice, necesitan de constante dedicación por las variables condiciones climáticas que se presentan y porque las plagas acechan constantemente. Aunque la labor es sacrificada, a Severo le gusta mucho, ya que es lo que mejor sabe porque lo aprendió cuando era muy pequeño, él vende toda su producción a los comerciantes mayoristas de los mercados de su zona y las ganancias económicas que obtiene le sirven para vivir cómodamente. Para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad la alverja, ya que su precio en el mercado está muy alto. 

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecido con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que reciba el crédito que le permitirá seguir trabajando. También está muy satisfecho de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que esta integrado por personas muy responsables. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de alverja, fertilizantes y abono para asegurar sus tierras para la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Severo is 32 years old and lives in his own home next to his sister, his brother-in-law, and his nephew. He considers them to be his family because he is single. Each day he rises at dawn to tend to his corn, pea, and potato fields. This job requires much dedication beginning with the planting. He must first prepare the land with fertilizer so that he can later reap a fruitful harvest without complications. He says that the labor of land requires much dedication because of the varying weather conditions and constant insect problems. Even though the work requires much sacrifice, Severo likes it very much and this is what he knows best because he learned when he was a boy. He sells his entire production to large businesses in the marketplace within his zone, and his income allows him to live comfortably. He plans to plant more peas, as the market price for this crop is high. This will be his first loan through MFP and he is very grateful to all the people who make this loan possible, allowing him to continue to work. He is also proud to be a member of his communal bank, because it’s made up of very responsible people. He will use the money from this loan to invest in pea seed and fertilizers to prepare his land for the next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Rex

texts.en: Rex is 32 years old. He owns a small rice field. The farm that he has tilled for so many years has been very helpful to him and his family in buying basic necessities at home. He would like to increase his harvest. Applying for a loan of PHP 10,000 at Community Economic Ventures Inc. will really help achieve his goals. If ever he gets a loan, he will buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Paula Genoveva

texts.es:
Paula tiene 65 años D. edad, es casada, todos sus hijos ya están independizados y vive junto a su esposo en el distrito D. Mochumí, un distrito agrícola ubicado media hora al norte D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Tiene instalada una bodega en su domicilio desD. hace diez años. El negocio nació debido a la necesidad por obtener un ingreso económico estable con el cual sostener a su familia, ya que su esposo es agricultor y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para mantenerlos.

En su bodega ella ofrece todo tipo D. productos D. primera necesidad, abarrotes y verduras a sus clientes que siempre acuden a su establecimiento debido a la calidad D. servicio que brinda. Paula desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. más mercadería con la cual poder seguir satisfaciendo la demanda D. sus cientes, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Paula es una mujer emprendedora y que dia a dia lucha por salir adelante. Sus vecinos y clientes la consideran una mujer honrada y que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar cuando se le necesita.
texts.en:
Paula is 65 years old, married, and has two adult children. She lives with her husband in the Mochumí district, which is an agricultural district located 30 minutes north of the city of Chiclayo. She’s been running a small shop from her home for the past 10 years. The business was born from the need to establish a steady income with which to support her family. Her husband is a farmer and his income is not enough. She sells basic household items, groceries and vegetables to her customers who frequent her shop because of the good service she provides. Paula would like to expand her business by investing in more items so she can continue to satisfy her customers’ needs, so she is requesting this first loan of 2,000 PEN ($700) to help her meet her objective. Paula is an enterprising woman who works daily to get ahead. Her neighbors and customers consider her to be an honest woman who is always available whenever they need her.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de mercadería para ampliación de negocio.

loans.name: Antonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
la sra. Antonia del Carmen V. elabora y vende tortillas, doña Toña como cariñozamente se le conoce en su barrio tiene que levantarse muy temprano para elaborar sus tortillas y que esten bien calientitas antes de que los clientes se vayan a sus centros de trabajo. este negocio es muy bueno aqui en la zona ya que la mayoria de los pobladores consumen tortillas.
imaginence ustedes que hay personas que no pueden llevarse un poco de comida si no es con tortillas..
la tarea de Doña Toña como madre ya termino, pero tiene dos nietos a su cargo los que ella cuida ya que su hija trabaja fuera de casa.
necesita el credito para comprar mas materiales para la produccion de sus tortillas,.
texts.en:
Antonia del Carmen V. makes and sells tortillas. DoñaToña, as she is affectionately called in her neighborhood, has to get up very early in the morning to make the tortillas so that they will be nice and hot before her customers go off to their work sites. This business is very good in the area because most of the inhabitants eat tortillas; just imagine that there are people who are incapable of eating even a small bite of food if they can't do it with a tortilla. Doña Toña's work as a mother has ended; however, she has two granchildren under her care because her daughter works outside the home. She needs funding to buy tortilla raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn flour, lime powder, firewood, water.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Erlinda Del Rosario

texts.es: Erlinda Del Rosario tiene 33 años, por lo que se dedica a una pulpería, hace más de 17 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella es una persona muy responsable, este negocio le pertenecía a su Mama quien le dejo a cargo esta actividad económica, pues siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionarle a su hijo que todavía está a su cargo el pan de cada día. Ella se levanta todos los días con la esperanza que situación mejorara. Es por eso que realiza este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de golosinas, galletas, refrescos y un poco de productos de limpieza para el hogar. Su deseo es que su inventario sea más grande.
texts.en:
Erlinda Del Rosario is 33 years old. She runs a small grocery store. She has worked in this business for more than 17 years. She is a very responsible person. This business belongs to her Mother who left her in charge of this economic activity. She has always made sure she provided for her son who is still under her care. She gets up every day with the hope that the situation will improve. That is why she is doing this financing, for working capital. It will go towards the purchase of candy, cookies, soft drinks and some household cleaning products. Her wish is that her inventory were larger.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy, cookies, soft drinks and some household cleaning products

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: 45-year-old Rosalinda I. is dreaming to increase her harvest. Currently, she tills a one-hectare rice field but needs additional money to buy all the farming necessities. Rosalinda is from Norala, South Cotabato. The income in her business will go directly to the needs of her family. She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 15,000 at Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Dolores Z. se dedica al comercio cuenta con un FOTO Estudio y venta de variedades, 
 actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace mas de 12 años, es madre de familia tiene 3 hijos 2 de ellos estudian.  
Maria y su esposo son los que administran y atienden en el negocio, gracias a los ingresos que ellos persiben de este negocio les han podido suplir los gastos familiares, es notoria la solidez y el 
deseo de superacion que ellos tienen como familia ya que para lograr tener estabilidad en su negocio don Juan Varela su esposo sale ha realizar su trabajo fotografico en los diferentes eventos sociales y escolares que se desarrollan en el Municipio de Las Trojes y lugares vecinos y despues llega a su negocio para revelar las fotos y venderlas. juntos han sacado adelante su negocio.
necesitan el credito para comprar rollos fotograficos, material para enmarcar cuadros y fotos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Dolores Z. has a PHOTO Studio and general store. She has worked in this business for more than 12 years. She is the mother of 3 children, 2 of which are students. Maria and her husband manage and tend to the business. They have been able to cover family expenses thanks to the income they receive from this business. The stength and desire to get ahead that they have as a family is notorious. In order to gain stability in their business, Mr. Juan Varela and his wife go to do their photography work at different social and school events happening in the Town of Las Trojes and neighboring areas. Afterwards they go back to their store to develop the pictures and sell them. Together they have moved their business forward. They need the loan to purchase rolls of film and material to frame pictures and photographs.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase rolls of film, rings, bracelets, framing material.

loans.name: Tusuubira Mobilizers Group 1, Kampala

texts.en: K. Hamida is the leader of her lending group in Kampala. She is the lady at the top left and in the front of the group photo. She is a widow with nine children. One of her children is still in school and is joining the University soon. She also takes care of three dependants. Hamida has had a retail business for two years where she sells home supplies and paraffin from Nakwero B, Gayaza town council. She is able to make 35,000/=  weekly profit. Her desire is to have a variety of goods for sale, hence the expansion of her shop. She is very hard working and as a result, she has been able to offer the best gift to her children and that is education. Hamida needs a loan to be able to buy more paraffin and other general merchandise for resale.

loans.use: To buy more general merchandise and paraffin for her business.

loans.name: Nofo

texts.en:
Nofo L. is 32 and married with 6 children (ages 1 - 12).  She owns a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish .  Nofo has 4 years of experience in this business.  Nofo needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2007, Nofo joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Nofo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Nofo L. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.3 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.4 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline is a 30-year-old rice farmer with four children. She would like to expand her rice farm business. Right now, she has been busy preparing it for the next planting. However, she said, she still needs additional money to complete the process. She thinks of applying for a loan of PHP 12,000 at Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia E. is 72 and widowed with 8 children (ages 24 - 51).  She owns a business venture, selling food products in the local community.  Malia has 4 years of experience in this business.  Malia needs a loan of WST $1650 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Malia joined SPBD.  This is her 5th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Malia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Malia E. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.6 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juan Humberto

texts.es:
el sr. Juan Humberto M. se dedica a la venta de granos de maiz, los cuales son molidos para hacer masa para las tortillas de maiz, tiene muchas clientes ya que la mayoria son las productoras de tortillas. Juan y su esposa son los encargados de darle vida a este pequeño proyecto economico
ubicado en su casa de habitacion del municipio de trojes. El Sr. M. realiza las venta de manera domiciliar.
con su esposa tuvieron tres hijos de los cuales solo una depende de ellos y es pasante en la licenciatura en enfermeria.
el se traslada a lugares donde venden este grano a precios muy bajos y de esta manera ofrecerle un mejor precio a su clientela a la que atienden junto a su esposa con mucho esmero y dedicacion , Juan tambien se deica a la caficultura lo que le genera otros ingresos para bienestar de su familia , El nos esta solicitando el credito para invertirlo en su negocio ya que por los momentos no cuenta 
con el capital de trabajo suficiente.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Humberto M. works selling corn seed which is ground to make flour for corn tortillas. He has a lot of customers since the majority make tortillas. Juan and his wife are in charge of keeping this small business project alive. It’s in a room in their house in the town of Trojes. Mr. M. sells door to door. They have three children. Only one is their dependent and she is a university teaching assistant in nursing. He travels to places where they sell the seed at a low cost and this way can offer a better price to his clientele. He and his wife tend to them with care and dedication. Juan also grows coffee which generates more income for the well being of his family. He is applying for the loan to invest it in his business since at the moment he doesn't have enough working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase corn

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina I. is 38 and married with 4 children (ages 4 - 12).  She owns a business venture, selling local Samoan snacks such as palusami (coconut cream wrapped in taro leaves), cooked taro, yams, and soupo ese (hearty papaya soup).  Sina has 2 years of experience in this business.  Sina needs a loan of WST $750 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Sina joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Sina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Sina I. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.3 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.3 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.4 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en: Nemia is a 33-year-old rice farmer. Her husband is a farmer also and they work together to earn an income to accommodate their daily needs. The income that she makes from her farm is really helpful in ensuring the supply of food for their family. The one beside her in the photo is her youngest child. She really would like to increase her harvest but she needs a small amount of money to buy all the farming necessities like fertilizers and farm supplies. She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 18,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. The loan will mean she can increase her harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Tusuubira Mobilizers Group 2, Kampala

texts.en: K. Fred is the leader of his lending group in Kampala. He is a hardworking and friendly man who is married with five children aged 9, 5, 4, 3, 3.6 and 1 years-old and he takes care of two other dependants. For the last eight years, Fred has had a dry cleaning business in Makindye from which he is able to make 200,000/= a week profit although he faces challenges with electricity problems and limited capital. One of his reasons for success is that he is caring to his customers and has good time management therefore winning his customers’ trust. He hopes to develop his dry cleaner business and educate all his children to higher levels. Fred needs a loan to be able to buy an additional washing machine to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy another washing machine.

loans.name: Sapini

texts.en:
Sapini T. is 52 and married with 3 children (ages 6 - 15).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Sapini has 4 years of experience in this business.  Sapini needs a loan of WST $1800 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business to improve/expand the business.

Sapini joined SPBD.This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Sapini's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Sapini T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.4 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.6 out of 3

The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Maimoaga

texts.en:
Maimoaga T. is 30 and married with 1 child (1-month-old).  She owns a business venture, driving a taxi.  Maimoaga has 4 years of experience in this business.  Maimoaga needs a loan of WST $1200 to maintain the vehicle.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Maimoaga joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Maimoaga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Maimoaga T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.3 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.3 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.4 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to maintain vehicle

loans.name: Julia Teresa

texts.es:
Julia C. Martínez  vive en el Barrio Crespo de Cartagena de Indias, donde tiene un negocio con el nombre de   “Peluquería Julia”; su ubicación al norte de la ciudad, en un barrio turístico, muy cercano al mar, hace de su negocio un espacio especial lo que favorece un mayor número de clientes. Inició hace 15 años cuando aprendió su oficio en una academia de belleza Francesa y se instaló en un local muy pequeño, al que gradualmente mejoró su infraestructura  y finalmente empleó a dos peluqueras, con las que ofrece tratamientos para embellecer el cabello de mujeres y de hombres cortes, tinturas aliser y cepillados.
Este es Segundo crédito  con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y está aplicando por un monto de $2.300.000, el cual será invertido en adecuaciones de su nuevo local y en la compra de insumos para peluquería como shampoo, tinturas y masajes para el cabello. Para ella el financiamiento recibido ha sido efectivo, pues ha logrado cambiar los muebles de su peluquería y ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes, así como también ha  aumentado sus ingresos familiares, pues ellos han dependido de la peluquería y del trabajo de su esposo que igualmente es una microempresas de comidas, producto del ahorro logrado con la peluquería y  es otro ingreso familiar.  
 Ella sueña con poder dar empleo a más personas que lo necesiten mediante una sucursal de su peluquería.  Su principal  desafío ocurre  en la primera época del año, cuando disminuyen los clientes, pero ella sale adelante con promociones y descuentos  especiales a clientes especiales
texts.en:
Julia C. Martínez lives in the the Crespo neighborhood in Cartagena de Indias where she has a business called "Julia Hair Salon; it's location in the north of the city, in a tourist area, very close to the ocean, makes her business a special place, frequented by a large number of customers. Julia started 15 years ago, when she learned her trade in a French beauty school and opened in a very small location, gradually improving her infrastructure and finally employing two hairdressers. They offer beauty treatments for men's and women's hair, including cuts, coloring, straightening and styling. This is the second loan Julia has requested through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she is applying for $2.300.000, which she will invest in improvements to her new location and the purchase of supplies for her salon like shampoo, dyes and hair treatments. The financing she has received previously has been effective because she has been able to change the furniture in her salon and make her clients more comfortable, as well as increasing her family's income. Her family depends on her salon and her husband's work which is a food micro-enterprise that was created with the savings from the hair salon and also adds to their family's income. Julia dreams of giving jobs to more people who need them by opening another branch of her salon. Her greatest challenge happens in the beginning of the year, when she has fewer customers, but she overcomes it through promotions and special discounts for her regular customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to her hair salon and to purchase of supplies like shampoo, dyes and hair treatments

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es:
Leonel Sandí M., tiene la edad de 36 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y 2 hijos de 14 y 7 años de edad,y son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Leonel también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Leonel is 36 years old, is married and lives with his wife and two children, ages 14 and 7. They are his top priority. He is asking for this loan in order to maintain his fields, specifically for growing coffee. He wants to buy fertilizers. He wants to adequately maintain the coffee crop in order to produce a better quality and be able to get the best price come harvest time. This will be his first loan thorough FEDECOSUR and he is very grateful for their help. Leonel has been farming for a number of years. He hopes for a brighter future for his family, for a better quality of life, and to be able to continue to develop as a person and producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

texts.en: N. Joyce is an accountant by training. She is the leader of her lending group and is very hard working and smart. In addition, she is a businesswoman with a retail shop that helps her bring in a daily income in addition to the monthly salary. As a result, she is able to better take care of her family and pay her children’s education since she wants them to be better off than her in the future. Joyce needs a loan to be able to restock her retail shop with more goods such as sugar, salt, pepper, bread, chocolate, etc. and she is grateful that she is able to employ someone to help her run her shop in her absence, therefore also improving someone else’s standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop.

loans.name: Pablo Andres

texts.es:
Pablo A. de 58 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento pero solo cuenta con luz y agua como servicio básico. Su esposa le ayuda en la heladería con ella tienen 2 hijos. 

Pablo esta actualmente trabajando en la heladería Gino (Heladería Ecuatoriana), hace uno meses atrás el pidió vender en su casa los helados Gino, cuando tuvo la autorización invirtió su sueldo en helados. 

Ahora el vende los helados en su casa con la ayuda de su esposa, trabaja todos los días, una de las complicaciones que tiene con las lluvias ya que les baja la clientela.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar helados y tortas heladas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener una heladería mucho mas grande y poder construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Pablo A., 58 years old, lives in the outskirts of the city along Guayaquil’s Perimetral highway. His house is made of cement but only has electricity and water as basic utilities. His wife helps him in the ice cream shop and they have two children.

These days Pablo is working in the Gino ice cream shop (an Ecuadorian ice cream shop). A few months ago, he asked to sell Gino ice cream, when he received authorization he invested his salary in ice cream.

Now he sells the ice cream in his house with the help of his wife. He works every day. One of the difficulties he’s having is that the rains have decreased the number of customers.

With the loan he wants to buy ice cream and ice cream cakes for his business. In the future, he wants to have much larger ice cream shop and to be able to better build his house.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ice cream and ice cream cake

loans.name: Marisela Dusley

texts.es:
Marisela  es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el pueblo joven San Martín, un área urbano - marginal de la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada 20 minutos al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica al comercio de productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes y verduras en una bodega que tiene instalada en su vivienda. La idea del negocio nació ante la necesidad de apoyar al sostenimiento de su familia, ya que los ingresos que su esposo percibe como obrero de construcción no son suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares.

La creciente demanda de sus clientes y la cercanía de el inicio de clases escolares en todo el país la han llevado a querer ampliar su negocio con la compra de un lote de utiles escolares. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora y bastante entregada a su familia. Sus vecinos y clientes le tienen mucha estima ya que la consideran una mujer honrada  y que siempre está dispuesta a apoyar cuando se le necesita.
texts.en:
32-year old mother Marisela lives with her husband and their two children in the neighbourhood of San Martín on the outskirts of the city of Lambayeque which is located 20 minutes north of Chiclayo. She sells basic necessities such as groceries and vegetables in a little store which she runs out of her own home. The idea for the store arose out of the need to support her family, since her husband’s income from his job as a construction worker did not cover household expenses. The growing number of requests from her customers and the approaching start of the school year across the country have made her want to expand her stock by buying school supplies. For this reason she approached Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 2000 soles to help her achieve her goal. Marisela is a hardworking mother who is very devoted to her family. Her neighbours and customers hold her in high esteem and consider her an honourable woman who always does her best to help whenever possible.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Rosas Rojas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Rosas Rojas se encuentra  en el cantón Paute, sector  reconocido por su clima cálido propiciando para que  sea   la región  mayor productora de flores, además encontramos  la hidroeléctrica más grande del país, su gente  es  muy trabajadora y dedicada a sus labores pensando siempre en salir adelante junto a sus familias, como nuestras socias que comparten sus historias.

La señora María es una de las socias del banco Comunal  Rosas Rojas, vive en el cantón Paute sector la Estancia, tiene 42 años de edad y es viuda hace tres, su esposo falleció en el extranjero pero hasta ahora no sabe de qué  enfermedad murió, vive con sus cuatro hijos que  se encuentran de 21, 18, 14, 12 años y sus tres nietos hijos de su hija mayor que es madre soltera,  ella junto a sus dos primeras hijas son las que mantienen  el hogar  y se siente segura al saber que cuenta con su casa propia.

María se dedica a la cría de pollos para mantener a su familia y  tener estabilidad económica,  con el primer credito recibido hace tres ciclos inició esta actividad, ahora tiene 20 pollos porque son delicados y cuando entra el mal se mueren perdiendo toda su inversión.

Nuestra socia  fue invitada por su cuñada a formar parte de este gran grupo de mujeres luchadoras y ahora  con el nuevo crédito va a montar un criadero de cuyes, comprar crías y alimento, su sueño es de ver que sus hijos estudien y se preparen.

Al igual que la otra socia  María  Azucena R. vive en este hermoso cantón en la parroquia  el Cabo, es una mujer  muy alegre y siempre esta dispuesta a colaborar en su bankito, se encuentra en su tercer ciclo y el  dinero recibido  le ha beneficiado en su criadero de cuyes por lo que ya cuenta con su clientela fija que van a comprar en su casa o ella vende en el mercado de su localidad,  nos comenta que su negoció empezó con el primer crédito realizado.

María tiene 40 años de edad está casada pero su esposo vive en el extranjero hace once años, migró al exterior  para entregar una mejor calidad de  vida a sus hijos y esposa, y gracias a los grandes sacrificios conyugales  ahora pueden contar con su casa propia para  tranquilidad de toda la familia  así que sólo vive con sus cuatro hijos de 20, 18, 16, 13 años, con el nuevo crédito solicitado va a comprar bloques, hojas zinc, palos  para construir un galpón mucho grande  para incrementar su criadero de cuyes

Su meta es  seguir creciendo con su negocio y dedicarse también a la cría de pollos.
texts.en:
The Rosas Rojas (Red Roses) Community Bank is located in the Paute canton, an area known for its warm climate and consequently a major grower of flowers. The largest hydroelectric pwer station is the country is also located there. Its people are very hardworking and dedicated to their jobs, always thinking about helping their families get ahead in life. Our members share their stories: Señora María is one of the members of Rosas Rojas Community Bank. She lives in the Paute canton in the Estancia neighbourhood. She is 42 years old and was widowed three years ago. Her husband died overseas but she still doesn’t know from what illness. She lives with her four children aged 21, 18, 14, and 12 as well as her three grandchildren (the children of her oldest daughter who is a single mother). María and her two older daughters support the family, and she feels secure knowing that she owns her house. Her work raising chickens supports the family and provides financial stability. With her first loan received three cycles ago, she began this work. She now has twenty chickens. They are delicate and when they get sick, they die, so she then loses all her investment. María was invited by her sister-in-law to join this group of feisty women. Now with this new loan she is going to buy young guinea pigs to raise and food for them. Her dream is to see her children in school. Another member of the Bank is María Azucena R. who also lives in this beautiful canton in Cabo parish. She is an energetic woman who is always pleased to work with her colleagues in the bank. This is her third loan cycle, and the money received to date has helped her with her work raising guinea pigs. She has regular customers who come to her house to buy them. She also sells them in the local market. María says that she started her first business with her first loan. She is 40 years old and married, but her husband has lived overseas for eleven years. He left the country so he could provide a better quality of life for his children and wife. Thanks to their sacrifices as a couple, they now own their house and the whole family has some security. She lives alone with her four children aged 20, 18, 16, and 13. With this new loan she is going to buy cement blocks, zinc sheeting, and posts to build a much bigger shed and increase the number of guinea pigs. María’s goal is to continue expanding her business and eventually start raising chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and food, zinc sheeting, posts, cement blocks

loans.name: Fulidier

texts.es:
Fulidier Rubí V., tiene la edad de 46 años, está soltero, y no tiene hijos.Vive con los padres y hermanos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ovejas para engorde y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento a las ovejas para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría de las ovejas. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Fulidier tiene varios años dedicado a la cría de ovejas. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Fulidier Rubí V., 46, is single and has no children. He lives with his parents and siblings. He wants funding to buy sheep and feed for them. He wants to provide them with proper care and maintenance so that they will produce the highest possible sale price when they are sold. He also wants to increase the size of his herd and raise them under better conditions. He has an area suitable for sheep raising. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the loan terms obtained. Fulidier has raised sheep for many years. He hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability in the future as well as to continue to develop both as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Jairo Manuel

texts.es:
Jairo F. Rodríguez, tiene 57 años vive en el barrio Quiroga Central en la ciudad de Bogotá, donde tiene su negocio “Abner A.C. Manufacturas Cuero y Textil”, allí se dedica  al diseño, elaboración  y comercialización de manufacturas en cuero y textiles tales como finos calzados para dama y caballeros, gorras y  elegantes botas. Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, solicita $1.200.000  y comprará  materiales en mayor volumen, como cuero y telas especiales para fabricar gorras y calzados, porque quiere aumentar el número de productos que elabora actualmente y obtener con este nuevo recurso económico un crecimiento productivo.
Su meta es lograr en cinco años el liderazgo de su microempresa a nivel nacional y consolidarse por su excelencia.
Su mayor desafío es superar los problemas de la competencia que genera el contrabando de productos chinos y taiwanés, pues al cliente le  sale más  económico y desvía su mercado actual.
Vive en un barrio residencial que tiene sectores eminentemente comerciales, esta combinación favorece su entorno mercadológico pues sus clientes son también familias y propietarios de negocios vecinos
texts.en:
Jario is 57 years old and lives in the “Quiroga Central” in Bogotá, where he has his business, “Abner A.C. Manufacturas Cuero y Textil.” There he dedicates himself to the design, manufacture, and sale of leather and textile items, such as fine shoes for ladies and gentlemen, hats, and elegant boots. This will be his first loan through “Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.” He is requesting $1,200 to buy raw materials, such as leather and cloth, in bulk, in order to manufacture hats and shoes. He wants to increase the number of items that he makes in order to grow his business and improve his income. His goal is to grow his factory to the national level and have it become well known for its quality, all within five years. His greatest desire is to beat the competition he faces from counterfeit items from China and Taiwan, which are cheaper and redirects the demand [for his goods]. He lives in a residential neighborhood which includes some commercial areas. This mix benefits his market, as his customers are also small business owners.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Leather, cloth, and raw materials

loans.name: Sapani

texts.en:
Sapani S. is 37 and married with 4 children.  She owns a business venture, selling BBQ (sausages, chicken, plantains).  Sapani has many years of experience in this business.  Sapani needs a loan of WST $2000 to buy BBQ meat, ketchup, plastic plates & utensils, and coal.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business. Sapani wishes to develop her business and support her family.

Sapani joined SPBD, and this is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Sapani's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Sapani S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy BBQ meat, ketchup, plastic plates & utensils, and coal

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 20 años de edad, convive con su esposa y no tiene hijos. Vive en el caserío El Romero del distrito de Mórrope, una zona rural cuya principal actividad es la agricultura y que queda ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de carbón y a la venta de animales, compra carbon a los productores de la zona y los comercializa con los negociantes que visitan el lugar regularmente, además cría sus aves en su domicilio para comercializarlas. Estas actividades le proveen los recursos necesarios para mantener a su joven familia. 

La temporada de lluvias que se ha presentado en la zona ha hecho que la producción de carbón disminuya, Elmer desea abastecerse de este producto para luego venderlo a un mejor precio. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permita comprar más carbón para lograr su objetivo.

El es un joven bastante responsable y entregado a su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es seguir saliendo adelante y bridarle a su esposa y a los hijos que vengan en el futuro una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elmer is 20 years old and lives with his wife. They don’t have any children and live in the El Romero neighborhood in the Mórrope district, a rural zone whose principal activity is agriculture, and is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He sells charcoal and animals. He buys charcoal from the local producers and sells it to the businessmen who regularly visit his place. He also raises birds in his home. These activities provide the resources needed to maintain his young family. The rainy season has slowed charcoal production and Elmer would like to stock up so that he can later resell it at a better price. He has seen fit to request his first loan of 1,000 PEN ($350) through Edpyme Alternativa so that he can buy more charcoal and help him reach his objective. He is a very responsible young man bound to his work. His greatest desire is to continue to get ahead and give his wife and future children a good future and a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchse charcoal for resale

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo tiene 35 años, vive con su esposa Domitila (en la foto) y su hija Camila, en su casa propia.
Desde hace 5 años se dedica a brindar servicios eléctricos a domicilio de forma independiente, mientras que su esposa se encarga de las labores del hogar. Generalmente, Alfredo trabaja durante todo el día y gracias a su profesionalismo se ha hecho de fieles clientes, quienes confían en la calidad de su trabajo y es por ello que su actividad le resulta rentable. Para este tipo de oficio se necesita trabajar con buenos materiales, los cuales sean seguros, ya que es un trabajo muy riesgoso, por lo que Alfredo toma muchas precauciones al respecto.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete ser muy puntual con el pago de todas sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará las herramientas que le hacen falta para el cumplimiento de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 35 years old and lives in his own home with his wife Domitila (in the photo) and their daughter Camila. For the past five years he has been working independently doing home electrical work, while his wife takes care of the home. Alfredo generally works during the day and thanks to his professionalism, he has established loyal customers who trust in the quality of his work. This is why his work is very profitable. This type of work is risky and requires quality materials, so Alfredo takes many precautions. This will be his first loan through MFP and he promises to make all of his payments on time. He will use the money to buy some tools that he needs for his work.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tools

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.es:
Jonathan es un joven muy trabajador y responsable, tiene 24 años y vive en la casa de sus padres, junto a sus hermanos.

Desde hace 2 años se dedica la venta y soporte de motores para carros en su pequeño taller. Esta es una labor muy sacrificada debido al esfuerzo físico que requiere; además gracias a las ganancias que obtiene puede ayudar a sus padres y hermanos con los gastos de su hogar.
