Jonathan se siente feliz con su trabajo y quiere salir adelante en el mismo, aunque no descarta la posibilidad de incursionar en otro rubro, pero cree que eso sería más adelante; por el momento quiere trabajar mucho para salir adelante y progresar.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de todas sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará algunas herramientas necesarias para la refacción de los motores.
texts.en:
Jonathan is a hard working and responsible young man. He is 24 years old and lives with his parents and siblings. He’s been servicing cars and selling auto supplies from his small shop for the past two years. This job requires great physical effort and sacrifice, but the income he earns allows him to help his parents and siblings with the household expenses. Jonathan is happy with his work and wants to move ahead with it, even though he does not reject the idea of moving into another line of work, but this will have to wait. At this time, he would like to work hard and progress. This will be his fourth loan through MFP and he has always made his payments on time. He will use the money from this loan to buy some tools he needs to repair motors.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 58 años, vive sola y es muy conocida en su vecindario gracias a su carisma y amabilidad.

Desde hace 3 años cuenta con un camión para el que contrata a un chofer, quien se traslada a las diferentes zonas brindando el servicio de transporte de carga. Para ello, Juana debe tener su movilidad en las mejores condiciones y administrar adecuadamente sus ganancias; como el pago al chofer, los contratos que realiza con los clientes, los repuestos mecánicos, etc. Todas estas actividades no le dejan mucho tiempo disponible, por lo cual se siente muy contenta, ya que se mantiene ocupada y se distrae. Para el futuro comprar otro camión para conformar una empresa, pero sabe que para eso necesita de mayor capital y mucho más trabajo, pero también sabe que con optimismo y mucha paciencia logrará todas sus metas.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se encuentra contenta de que le hayan dado la oportunidad de mejorar su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita comprará nuevas llantas para renovar las que actualmente tiene su camión.
texts.en:
Juana is a 58 year old woman who lives alone and is well known in the neighborhood for her charisma and kindness. For the past 3 years she has owned a truck which she contracts out to a driver who travels to various zones transporting cargo. For this, Juana must maintain her vehicle in the best condition and adequately administrate her earnings to pay things such as the driver’s salary, her customer’s contracts, mechanical repairs etc. All this activity does not leave her a lot of free time, for which she is grateful as she likes being busy and occupied. In the future, she will buy another truck in order to shape her business but she knows that for this she will need more capital and much more work. But she also knows that with optimism and patience she will achieve her goals. This is her first loan with MFP and she is very happy that she has been given the opportunity to improve her business. With the money that she is soliciting, she will buy new tires to replace those that are currently on her truck.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To replace the tires on a truck

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 21 años, es una joven madre que se dedica a la venta de plantas, al igual que su pareja; juntos educan a su hija de 9 meses de nacida.

Desde hace 2 años ambos decidieron incursionar en este rubro, por los consejos que le dieron sus amistades acerca de las buenas ganancias que se obtenía en este negocio. Es así que en la actualidad es su principal fuente de ingresos y a la cual le ponen todo su esfuerzo. Su esposo se dedica a la venta y distribución de las plantas, viajando a otras ciudades y ella se dedica a la compra y contratos con los proveedores. Lo bueno de su trabajo es que solo lo realizan 3 días a la semana: los jueves, viernes y sábados, quedándole tiempo disponible para dedicárselo a su pequeña hija. A su vez, están planeando realizar otro tipo de negocio para sus días libres, pero aún no han decidido qué hacer, además no quieren descuidar a su hija, porque creen que es tan importante el trabajo como el tiempo que pasan con ella.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y María promete ser muy responsable en el pago de sus cuotas. El dinero solicitado será destinado a comprar más plantas para distribuirlas en las ciudades donde tienen pedidos.
texts.en:
María is a 21 years old mother who sells plants along with her partner. Together they are bringing up their 9 month old daughter. Two years ago, they both decided to become involved in this field after hearing advice from their friends about the potential profitability of such a business. This is how plant selling became their principle source of income and where they put all their efforts. Her husband travels to other cities selling and distributing the plants, while she buys and contracts with the suppliers. The best part of her work is that it only keeps her occupied for 3 days a week: Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays, which leaves her spare time to dedicate to her baby daughter. One day they will plan another type of business for her days off, but they still haven’t decided what to do and also they do not want to neglect their daughter. They believe that spending time with her is just as important as time spent working. This is her first loan with MFP and María promises to be very responsible with the repayments. The money that they are soliciting will be used to buy more plants to distribute to the cities where they have orders.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy additional plants to sell.

loans.name: Niliver

texts.es:
Niliver, de 25 años, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, quienes son independiente y generan sus propios ingresos. Toda la familia vive junta en su casa propia.

Su negocio es la venta de bolsas a diversas tiendas, consigue su mercadería comprándole a las fábricas los sobrantes. De esta manera obtiene los ingresos necesarios para solventar los gastos de su hogar, aunque toda su familia también pone de su parte, como su esposa quien se dedica a la venta de productos por campaña. Niliver se siente contento con su trabajo y le gusta mucho realizarlo, aunque deba permanecer durante casi todo el día fuera de su hogar para entregar sus pedidos. Para el futuro, quiere tener una tienda de venta de CDs porque cree que este negocio le resultará muy rentable.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de todas sus cuotas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará una cantidad grande de bolsas para aumentar sus ventas e ir comprando los CDs para implementar su futuro negocio.
texts.en:
Niliver is 25 years old and lives with his wife and her three children who are all independent and earn their own living. The whole family lives together in a home they own. His business consists of selling bags to various shops; he gets his merchandise from the leftovers from factories. His job helps him to earn a living to cover his household expenses, though the rest of the family also puts forth their part. His wife also works a field saleswoman. Niliver is happy with his work and he enjoys doing it though he has to spent almost his entire day outside of his home to deliver his orders. In the future, he would like to have a store selling CDs because he believes it would be more profitable. This is his 4th loan from MFP and he has always been very punctual in his payments. With the loan, he will buy a larger quantity of bags to increase his sales and buy CDs for his future business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory and invest in new business

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria De Los Ángeles tiene 55 años, por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar las condiciones económicas para la compra de materia prima necesaria. A lo que ella se dedica es una pulpería pues ella ofrece lo más elemental para la elaboración de las comidas diarias. Ella es una persona muy triunfadora y que está al pendiente de lo más necesario de su familia.  Por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra materia prima necesaria para su negocio. ella sueña con ampliar su negocio poco a poco.
texts.en:
Maria de Los Angeles is 55 years old and has always tried to improve her standard of living through providing the basics for people. She runs a small store where she offers basic ingredients for daily cooking. She has a winning personality and she is always taking care of the needs of her family. She has always enjoyed working. She is seeking this loan to buy those basics for her business. She hopes to expand her business little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.es:
Rogelia tiene 48 años, es una mujer luchadora en todo lo que hace, vive con sus dos hijos en su casa propia.

Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de comida en uno de los mercados más conocidos de la zona en la que vive. Allí ofrece gran variedad de exquisitos platillos, pues tiene grandes dotes culinarias. Trabaja desde muy temprano en la mañana hasta las 2 ó 3 de la tarde, que es la hora en que se le termina el menú; posteriormente realiza las labores en su hogar. Rogelia se siente tranquila y contenta con su trabajo, puesto que le gusta mucho cocinar, aunque no piensa que es una labor sencilla, más bien todo lo contrario, porque debe poner gran atención a toda la preparación de los alimentos; además a veces la visitan gran cantidad de clientes con los cuales no se da abasto. Para el futuro quiere mejorar su puesto y comprar mejores mesas y hacer su local más cómodo y llamativo.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Rogelia con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará ingredientes al por mayor, (arroz, azúcar, fideos) porque así le resultará más económico.
texts.en:
Rogelia, 48, is a woman who fights hard to get ahead. She lives with her two children in a house she owns. For 2 years, she has made a living selling prepared meals at one of the best-known markets in her neighborhood. She is an excellent cook and serves up a variety of tasty dishes. She works from very early in the morning until everyone finishes their lunch at 2 or 3 in the afternoon. She then goes home to her household chores. Rogelia is happy with her business because she likes to cook. She doesn't think it's an easy job, though, because she has to be very careful about how she prepares her dishes and, at times, the rush of customers is more than she can handle. For the future, she wants to improve her food stand and buy better tables so that her customers will be more comfortable and able to talk to each other more easily. This is Rogelia's second MFP loan and she was very careful before to repay all the installments on time. She will use this loan to buy wholesale supplies of the ingredients (rice, sugar, pasta) because they are less expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock inventory items.

loans.name: Bartolomé

texts.es:
Bartolomé tiene 32 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el anexo Santa Rosa del caserío Lagunas, una zona rural dedicada a la agricultura y que pertenece al distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace trece años a la crianza y venta de aves de corral y de cerdos. El cría los animales en la parte posterior de su vivienda, los engorda y luego los vende en el Mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo). Este negocio le brinda los ingresos necesarios para solventar la economía de su familia por lo que día a día se esfuerza al máximo para sacar su negocio adelante.

Pensando en mejorar su negocio de modo que pueda percibir más ganancias, Bartolomé está planeando mejorar la calidad de sus animales brindándoles una alimentación balanceada. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en alimento balanceado para cerdos y aves.

Bartolomé es un padre de familia responsable y muy entregado a su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es bridarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de seguir estudiando para que puedan asegurarse un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Bartolome, 32, is married and lives with his wife and their two children in Santa Rosa, a farming area in the Morrope district, about 45 minutes from the Peruvian city of Chiclayo. For the last thirteen years, Bartolome has made a living raising and selling poultry and pigs. He rears the animals at the back of his property, fattens them up and sells them in the Moshoqueque market, the largest market in Chicalayo. The business provides the money necessary to pay the family's bills, but it requires an all-out effort. Always thinking of ways to improve his business so that he can earn more money, Bartolome plans to improve the quality of his animals by providing them a more balanced diet. He is applying for his first Edpyme Alternative loan for 2000 new soles so that he can buy a more balanced supply of feed for his pigs and poultry. Bartolome is a very responsible and hard-working man. His greatest wish is that he can provide his children with a good education that will help them to secure better futures.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy better animal feed for poultry and pig farm.

loans.name: Armando Jose

texts.es: Don Armando vive en el barrio Sol de Libertad,  de edad de 37 años trabaja como técnico de pista desde hace  tres años, pues anteriormente había trabajo en lo mismo pero por lo horarios renuncio ya que se hacia turno día por medio y era agotador, lo cual con su liquidación la invirtió en ropa y cosméticos y comienza a vender ambulante por lo que depende solo de sus ventas. Su esposa procreo tres hijos  los cuales son estudiantes de primaria, lo que mas desea es poder darles una buena educación. Pasado los años regresa a buscar trabajo por lo que los horarios habían cambiado y comienza a laborar otra vez, ya que las venta abecés eran bajas y le quedaba poco ganancias es por eso regresa a buscar un trabajo fijo, lo cual no se le hizo dificultoso por el buen record de su labor Con el préstamo lo que quiere terminar  de cerrar bien su casa,  pues a un falta repellar paredes, embaldosar, poner las verjas y las puertas para una mejor seguridad ya que tiene tapado con zinc las ventana y de gran necesidad lo cual no ha terminado por falta de capital, muy contento por el financiamiento ya que lograra  hacer estas mejoras en beneficios de su familia.
texts.en:
Don Armando lives in the Sol de Libertad neighborhood. He is 37 years old and has worked for three years as a repairman. He used to do the same job before but the hours were brutal and, worn out, he resigned. With a payment that he then received, he bought supplies of clothes and cosmetics and began working as a street vendor, his sales being his sole source of income. His wife has had three children, all now in elementary school, and what Armando most wants is to give them a good education. He decided to go back to work as a repairman after some years because his sales were often too little to justify his hard work and the terrible hours he had to work before have improved. He will use this loan to improve his house. The walls and floors are unfinished, so he will finish those and add bars to the window and doors to make the house more secure. He has needed to make the improvements, especially those to the doors and windows, for some time but he hasn't had the cash to do it. He is very happy about this loan because it will allow him to make improvements that will help his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for house repairs.

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es:
Ligia Jiménez D. A., es una mujer viuda y tiene 6 hijos que han conformado ya su familia,  a sus 65 años vive en el barrio Quiroga D. Bogotá, la capital D. Colombia y se dedica a la comercialización D. víveres y abarrotes en una cigarrería D. su propiedad; se inició como negociante con artesanías, específicamente  fabricación D. escobas y también D.  flores; allí nació el deseo D. tener una  cigarrería, la cual comenzó en su vivienda con recursos propios y un crédito D. $1.000.000 que le hizo a Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en el año 2003; desD. entonces ha recibido 8 créditos que ha tenido el cuidado D. reembolsar oportunamente, pues los ha invertido en su negocio y también en mejoras que ha realizado en su vivienda. En la actualidad Solicita financiamiento por valor D. $2.200.000 para mejoras D. su vivienda, estará dirigido al cambio D. la cubierta, arreglo D. canales y pintura D.  puertas y ventanas. Respecto al beneficio social del crédito Ligia dice  que los créditos D. la fundación la han ayudado a crecer lo mismo que a su   negocio, ellos  son la fuente principal D. sus  ingresos y   ha podido arreglar gradualmente  su casa, ella desea seguir creciendo con su microempresa  y surtirla  con lo que los clientes necesitan.
Los desafíos han estado asociados a la perdida D. seres queridos como su esposo su madre y su yerno, que aunque son irremplazables debe superar.
texts.en:
Ligia Jiménez D. A. is a widow with 6 children who make up her family. At the age of 65, she lives in the Quiroga neighborhood of Bogotá, the capital of Colombia. Her work is selling groceries in a small store she owns. She began as a businesswoman dealing in handicrafts, especially the production of brooms and artificial flowers. Out of this grew the desire to have her own store, which she began in her home using her own resources as well as a loan of 1,000,000 Colombian pesos granted to her by the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation in 2003. Since that time, she has received 8 loans, and she has always been careful to repay them on time. She has invested them in her business and also in improvements to her home. Currently, she is requesting financing in the amount of 2,200,000 Colombian pesos for improvements to her home. These funds will be used to replace the roof, repair the pipes and paint the doors and window frames. With respect to the social benefit of the loan, Ligia says that credit from the Foundation has helped her to grow personally along with her business. The business is the main source of her income, and she has gradually been able to renovate her home. She wants to continue expanding her small business and stock it with products that her customers need. The challenges she has faced have included the loss of loved ones such as her husband, her mother and her son-in-law, which she must overcome although they are irreplaceable.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement: replacing roof tiles, repairing pipes and painting doors and window frames

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen M. C., tiene la edad de 35 años, está casada, y vive con el esposo  y sus 3 hijos. Ellos tienen 17,11 y 7 años.El crédito lo quiere para la compra de una maquina de coser y materiales para la confección de prendas de vestir. Desea aumentar su capacidad para fabricar la ropa de vestir. Tiene bastante tiempo y experiencia en la costura y cuenta con una máquina y local adecuado para realizar su trabajo. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como comerciante.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Carmen M. C., 35, is married and lives with her husband and three children. They are 17, 11 and 7 years old. She wants funding to buy a sewing machine and dressmaking supplies. She wants to increase her production capabilities for making articles of clothing. She has been a seamstress for quite some time and she has both the experience and the proper space to do her work. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the loan terms offered. She hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability in the future as well as to continue developing as a person and as a merchant.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: San Judas Tadeo Group

texts.es:
La  alcancía comunal denominado “SAN JUDAS TADEO” está ubicada en Santa Clara, en el distrito D. ate, se encuentra  representado por la señora  Ricardina Guillermina y conformada por 10 socios que radican en dicha zona.
La señora Ricardina tiene 54 años D. edad, es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos D. 26, 28 y D. 32 años D. edad, todos ellos independientes. El negocio al cual se dedica: es la venta D. verduras o tubérculos en la puerta D. su vivienda desD. hace 5 años, se inicio en este negocio porque ayudaba a su mamá y decidió independizarse.
San judas Tadeo; trabaja con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desD. hace 2 años, nuestros socios se dedican a diferentes actividades como la confección y el comercio minorista; con el reciente préstamo otorgado, por ejemplo la señora Ricardina comprará mercadería para su negocio, todos los demás miembros incrementarán su capital para así obtener una mayor producción, mejor posesión en el mercado y captar mayor cantidad D. clientes. Los socios tienen grandes sueños y metas y se encuentran muy agradecidos con la institución por todo el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos y seguir trabajando para sus ahorros.
texts.en:
The SAN JUDAS TADEO community outreach program is located in Santa Clara and is represented here by Sra. Ricardina Guilermina. Its 10 members live in the area. Sra. Ricardina, 54, is partnered and has 3 children, 26-, 28- and 32-years old, all living on their own. She has operated a business selling vegetables and potatoes from the door of her house for 5 years. She used to help her mother with a similar business before deciding to strike out on her own. San Judas Tadeo has worked with EDAPROSPO for 2 years. Our members operate businesses such as retail confectionery sales. Sra. Ricardina, for example, will use the loan recently granted to buy merchandise for her business. Other members will increase their working capital to increase their output, improve their market position and bring in more customers. The members have big dreams and goals and all are grateful to the institution for providing the support they need. They are committed to repaying their loans on time and continuing to use their businesses to build their savings.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.es:
Rosana tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en su casa propia.
Ella tiene hectáreas de sembríos de arroz en otra ciudad, por lo que viaja muy frecuentemente con su esposo para traer sus productos y venderlos en Lima. Ellos logran buenas ventas porque le ponen mucho empeño a su negocio, tienen 9 años de experiencia en esta actividad y se sienten muy contentos porque les permite trabajar juntos por un bien en común, lograr el progreso de su familia. La parte más difícil radica en tener que viajar tanto para trasladar el arroz, dejando a sus hijos solos al cuidado de algunos familiares. Saben que todo trabajo requiere sacrificio y que todo es por brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos al lado de su grupo “Cristo Morado”, con el cual se siente muy contenta. Con dinero que solicita viajará hasta sus chacras para invertirlo en sus sembríos de arroz.
texts.en:
Rosana, 38, livs with her husband and their two children in a house they own. She has a small rice farm in another town and she and her husband travel a lot to carry their product to market in Lima. They manage to do well at market because they work hard at the business. They have 9 years of experience and they are very happy because they are working together toward a common goal: moving their family ahead. The hardest part of the business is leaving their children in the care of relatives when they travel. They know that work requires sacrifice and that everything they do will give their children a better quality of life. This is Rosana's fourth MFP loan and she has been very careful to pay past loans on time. She is very happy with her group, Cristo Morado. She will use the loan for the travel that she has to do for the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Travel for farming business.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
Yovana tiene 32 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y dinámica, comparte su vida con su  esposo e hijos en su casa propia.

Desde hace un año, junto a su esposo trabajan brindando servicio de transporte urbano de pasajeros, para ello cuentan con una camioneta para aproximadamente 12 personas. Ambos se esfuerzan mucho para que su trabajo sea productivo y les arroje buenas ganancias, es por ello que tratan de mantener su movilidad en óptimas condiciones. Su esposo es quien maneja la camioneta y Yovana administrar los ingresos y egresos, puesto que ella tiene un negocio paralelo de venta de productos de nutrición y para bajar de peso. Para el futuro, ambos quieren comprar otra camioneta parar formar su propia empresa de transportes.

Este es el cuarto crédito de Yovana con MFP y hasta el momento ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita refaccionará su camioneta para que siga brindando un buen servicio. También adquirirá más de los productos energéticos que vende.
texts.en:
Yovana, 32, is a very hard-working, dynamic woman; she shares her life with her husband and children in their own home. For the last year, she and her husband have been providing urban transportation services; they have a 12-passenger van. Both make great efforts to insure that their work is productive and that it generate good profits. This is why they try their best to keep their vehicle in optimum working condition. Her husband is the driver and Yovana manages income and expenses; she also runs a business selling nutrtition and weight-loss products. For the future, they want to buy another van and set up their own transportation firm. This is Yovana's 4th loan with MFP. To date, she has been responsible and punctual with repayments. She will use the requested funds to service her van so that it can continue to provide good service. She will also acquire more of the energy products she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For van service and maintenance.

loans.name: Mabel Del Rocio

texts.es:
Mabel tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su madre y hermana en el Asentamiento Humano Toribia Castro Chirinos, una zona urbano – Marginal de la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Mabel se dedica a brindar servicio de fotocopiado desde hace un año en su domicilio. La idea del negocio surgió cuando se dio cuenta de que no había fotocopiadoras en la zona y que los estudiantes tenían que ir hasta el centro de la ciudad a solicitar el servicio. Muchas veces poniendo en riesgo su integridad física.

Mabel desea ampliar su servicio con la venta de útiles escolares ya que se acerca la temporada de incio de clases en todo el país. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora y bastante entregada a su familia. Sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y la consideran una persona honrada y que siempre ayuda a los demás cuando se le necesita.
texts.en:
Mabel, 25, is single and lives with her mother and sister in the Toribia Castro Chirinos Human Settlement; a marginal urban zone of the city of Lambayeque, which is 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Mabel has a photocopy service in her home. The idea for her business arose when she realized that there were no photocopiers available in her area and students had to go all the way downtown if they needed to make copies, often putting their personal safety at risk to do so. Mabel wants to enlarge her operation by offering school supplies for sale because the new school term is about to start nationwide. This is why she is calling upon Edpyme Alternativa to request her first, 2000 new sol, loan that will help her reach this goal. She is a very hard-working woman who is quite dedicated to her family. Her neighbors and acquaintances hold her in high regard and consider her to be an honest person who is always helping others when needed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: Sara Rosaura

texts.es:
La señora Sara Rosaura es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 49 años, es soltera, tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 están en edad académica y los otros 2 son independientes, conoce a EDAPROSPO desde hace 8 años y ha demostrado ser leal a la institución. Se dedica a la venta de queso y se dedica al reciclaje de chatarras (latas, plásticos) y en otras temporadas cuando no vende queso trabaja cocinando en un restaurante, nos cuenta que se inicio porque siempre le gusto el comercio con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado tener una casa de 2 pisos en donde actualmente renta cuartos también compro una refrigeradora, muebles y aporto para la educación de sus hijos quienes son profesionales y está logrando mejorar su calidad de  vida. 
Sara nos cuenta que su gran sueño es poner un restaurante en su vivienda.
El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido para el techado de un cuarto de su vivienda. Sara está muy agradecida con los inversionistas por apoyar a todas las personas con bajos recursos y así  mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sara Rosaura, 49, is an enterprising woman; she is single and has 4 children, two of whom are school age and 2 are independent. She has been associated with EDAPROSPO for 8 years and has shown herself to be loyal to the institution. She sells cheese and recycles trash (cans and plastics). During seasons when she does not sell cheese, she works as a cook in a restaurant. She tells us that she started out in business because she's always liked commerce and her daily efforts have made it possible for her to have a two-story house where she rents out rooms. She also bought a refrigerator, furniture and provided everything her children needed for school; they are now professionals. She is managing to improve her quality of life. Sara tells us that her great dream is to open a restaurant in her home. The recent loan is to be used to install a roof on one of the rooms of her house. Sara is very grateful with the investors for supporting low-income people thus helping them to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a roof on a room in her house.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 36 años, vive al lado de su esposo y de sus hijos en la casa de sus padres.
Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de comida en una feria artesanal cercana a la zona donde vive. Su horario es de 8 de la mañana a 2 de la tarde y al anochecer vende anticuchos (brochetas de corazón de res). Gracias a su buena sazón y atención ha logrado hacerse de buenos y fieles clientes, los cuales la visitan día a día con el único fin de saciar el hambre con sus ricos platillos. Todo va bien en su negocio y cree poder mejorar, es por ello que quiere realizar algunos arreglos en su puesto para brindar un mejor servicio y así aumentar sus ventas.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, ella es parte del banco comunal “Cristo Morado” y todos sus compañeros son muy puntuales con los pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará ingredientes al por mayor (costales de arroz y alimentos no perecibles) para preparar sus platillos, además de bancas y algunos utensilios de cocina.
texts.en:
Elsa, 36, lives with her husband and childrfen in her parents' house. For the last 5 years she has sold prepared meals at a crafts market near the area where she lives. She works from 8am until 2pm. When night falls she sells anticuchos (skewered grilled beef heart). Thanks to her good seasoning and customer service she has acquired regular customers who visit day by day to satisfy their hunger with her delicious dishes. Everything is going well with her business and she believes it can improve still. For this reason, she wants to make some improvements on her food stand to provide better service and increase her sales. This is her fourth loan with MFP; she is a member of the "Cristo Morado" communal bank. All of her fellow members are very puntual with their repayments. She will use the funds requested now to buy ingredients at wholesale (sacks of rice and nonpersihable items) to prepare her meals as well as some benches and kitchen utensils.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Felix Fausto

texts.es:
El Señor Felix es un cliente antiguo que retorna desde el año 2003 despues de haber trabajado con el Grupo Solidario "Vuelo del Condor" por tres secuencias, el cliente actualmente tienen casa propia y dos autos, su actividad principal es el transporte publico de pasajeros, y como su otra actividad es el negocio familiar tiene un local en el comedor de Mallasa (frente al zoologico) donde vende parrillas y platos extras los sabados y los domingos, es por este motivo que el señor Felix solicita este credito para capital de trabajo, ya que la zona de Mallasa esta de fiesta este mes, por lo tanto todo el mes sera de festejos y ferias donde se incrementara la cantidad de visitantes elevando asi tambien la demanda por comida. El destino del credito es para la compra de verduras, papa y otros productos para la elaboracion de sus platos.

Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.					

Si quiere saber mas sobre el Zoologico de Mallasa visita la pagina http://www.soprama.4t.com/zoologicoart.htm.
texts.en:
Felix is a long time client who returned in 2003 after having worked with the Vuelo del Condor Community Bank for three cycles. He currently has his own house and two cars. His main job is public passenger transportation. His other activity is the family business in the Mallasa restaurant (in front of the zoo). He sells grilled meats and prepared meals on Saturday and Sunday. That is why Felix is asking for a loan for working capital. The Mallasa region is celebrating this month, and there will be celebrations and fairs all month. There will be more visitors and also more demand for food. The loan is to buy vegetables, potatoes, and other products for making his dishes. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence given in granting the loan. If you want to know more about the Mallasa Zoo, visit this page: http://www.soprama.4t.com/zoologicoart.htm.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Verónica tiene la edad de 40 años, nacida en la comarca Santo Domingo, procreo tres hijos, desde pequeña trabajaba en la agricultura, pues sus padres eran de pocos recursos económicos lo cual dependían de la siembra. Cuando se caso su esposo trabaja tierras alquiladas hasta ahora no han logrado comprar tierras propias, pero alquilan cuatro manzana en donde producen tomate, chiltoma, rábanos lo que dependen de la producción, las dificultades es que abecés por la sequía pierden parte la producción oh por falta de abonos lo cual a veces han invertido todo el capital en la semilla y se le hace difícil. Es por eso nace la necesidad de este financiamiento para comprar lo necesario en abonos, fertilizantes y semilla ya que cultivaran tomate y chiltoma lo que espera es poder producir buenos frutos que se vendan a buen precio al mercado para poder sastifacer las necesidades de su familia como pagar el financiamiento en tiempo y forma. Su anhelo es poder a corto plazo poder comprar las tierras para un futuro mejor de su familia.
texts.en:
Verónica, 40, is originally from Santo Domingo. She has three children. She has been a farmer since she was a little girl because her parents were poorl and they depended on their crops. When she got married, her husband farmed leased farmlands. To date they have been unable to purchase their own land. However, they lease four manzanas (a traditional unit of land area in Central America) on which they grow tomatoes, peppers and radishes. Sometimes, due to drought or lack of fertilizers, they lose part of the crops in which they have invested all their seed; this makes it very difficult. For this reason, the need arises to seek financing to buy the necessary manure, fertilizers and seed because they are about to plant tomato and peppers. They hope to produce good product that will sell at the best market prices so that they can meet household expenses and repay the loan on time. Her short-term goal is to be able to buy her own farmlands so that her family can have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed, manure and fertilizers for tomato and pepper crops.

loans.name: Martha Lucia

texts.es:
Martha Lucia González R. tiene 45 años y vive en el barrio Molinos del Viento, sector de alto movimiento comercial ubicado en la ciudad de Bogotá, capital de Colombia; tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 11. 15 y 23 años;  es propietaria de “Cigarrería la mejor” que ha sido el resultado de su disciplina y capacidad emprendedora. Martha es una mujer que valora su negocio y lo conoce muy bien,  inició comercializando productos desechables y desde  hace seis meses , compró la cigarrería donde vende dulces, refrescos, embutidos y artículos que conforman la canasta familiar; con este nuevo impulso ha logrado complementar apropiadamente su actividad empresarial, que siempre le ha proporcionado la forma de  mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de sus hijos, dos de los cuales estudian y el mayor se encuentra  trabajando.
Desde que ingresó a los programas e la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo ha recibido 7 créditos   en la línea de capital de trabajo a partir del año 2002; en la actualidad aplica a un crédito por de $ 1.500.000 para comprar productos desechables, platos, vasos, dulcería y gaseosas.
Su sueño es tener casa propia con sus propios ahorros y seguir creciendo con su negocio pues  reconoce que este es la principal fuente de ingresos con la cual ha contado para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martha Lucia González R. is 45 and lives in the Molinso del Viento neighborhood. It is an area with a lot of commercial activity, which is located in Bogotá, the capital of Colombia. She has three children; they are 11, 15, and 23 years old. She owns the Cigarrería la Mejor, which is the result of her discipline and enterprising ability. Martha is a woman who values her business, and she knows it very well. She started out selling disposable products. Six months ago she bought the store where she sells sweets, soft drinks, sausages, and basic daily needs items. With this new boost she appropriately complimented her business. She has always provided the way to improve the living conditions for herself and for her children. Two of them go to school, and the oldest is working. Since she entered the programs with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, she has received seven loans for working capital since 2002. She is currently applying for a loan for 1,500,000 COP to buy disposable products, plates, glasses, sweets, and soft drinks. Her dream is to have her own house with her own savings and to continue growing in her business. This is the main source of income that she has to get her children ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy disposible products, plates, glasses, sweets, and soft drinks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Zoila Maria

texts.es:
La señora Zoila María es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 60 años, es casada, tiene 4 hijos independientes de 27, 28, 30 y 32 años, se dedica a la venta diaria de productos de belleza por catalogo desde hace mas de 20 años, también se dedica a la guardianía de carretas de personas que comercializan de forma ambulante en los alrededores de un mercado grande de la zona c de Huaycán.
Zoila nos cuenta que los préstamos le han sido de mucha ayuda, ya que ha logrado mejorar su vivienda, sus ingresos cubren los gastos de pago de servicios, alimentos.
El gran sueño de Zoila es implementar y asegurar su vivienda.
El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido para comprar puertas para su vivienda. 
Zoila agradece toda la ayuda que le han dado porque gracias a eso ha salido adelante por eso es responsable con sus créditos, ha crecido y sigue creciendo junto con su familia y también  como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Zoila María is an enterprising woman. She is 60 years old and married, and has four grown children who are 27, 28, 30 and 32 years old. She has worked selling beauty products via catalog for more than 20 years. She also stores carts for street vendors on the outskirts of a large market in the area called "Zona C" in Huaycán, Perú. Zoila tells us that her previous loans have been a great help, as she has been able to improve her home. Her earnings cover the cost of utilities and food. Zoila's great dream is to further work on and secure her house. This loan will be invested in buying doors for the home. Zoila thanks everyone who has lent to her because thanks to this help she has been able to get ahead in life. For this reason she is responsible about repaying her loans. She has grown and continues to grow with her family and as a small business owner.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy doors for her home.

loans.name: Rodrigo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Rodrigo A. B., brinda servicio de taxi en Nagarote de lunes a domingo, el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de llantas para el vehículo para darles mayor seguridad a sus clientes que atiende, con las utilidades que le genera este negocio o servicio mantiene el hogar y la educación de su hija. Con los préstamos que se han atendido en CEPRODEL ha logrado mantener su vehículo en buen estado ya que además de las llantas ha comprado repuestos.
texts.en:
Rodrigo A. B. provides taxi service in Nagarote from Monday to Sunday. He needs the loan to buy tires for his vehicle so that he can provide greater safety to his customers. The profits generated by this work are used to support his home and the education of his daughter. CEPRODEL loans have made it possible for him to keep his vehicle in good running condition because, in addition to the tires, he has bought other replacement parts.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino tiene 29 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en el Anexo Los Valdera del caserío Santa Isabel, zona rural que pertenece al distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de animales. Cría aves de corral y ovejas en la parte posterior de su vivienda para luego ofrecérselas en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde vive. Esta actividad le provee ingresos permanentes, y también se genera ingresos adicionales trabajando en una orquesta conformada por habitantes de la zona.

Marcelino desea ampliar su negocio de venta de animales con la compra de ovejas y aves de corral para su posterior engorde y venta. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Allternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Marcelino es un padre de familia alegre, dinámico y bastante responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para brindarle a su familia la oportunidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marcelino, 29, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Santa Isabel's Anexo Los Valdera, a rural zone that is part of Mórrope district, which is 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He raises small farm animals for sale. He raises barnyard fown and sheep in his back yard and then offers them for sale to the various merchants that frequent the area on a regular basis. This activity provides a permanent source of income. However, he also earns extra income playing in an orchestra made up of residents of the area. Marcelino wants to enlarge his operation buying sheep and baryard fowl to raise and sell. He is asking Edpyme Alternativa for his first, 1500 new sol, loan to reach his goal. Marcelino is a cheerful, dynamic and quite responsible father. His greatest wish is to continue to work to provide his family with the oportunity to have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and barnyard fowl.

loans.name: Hortencia Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Hortencia Francisca D. C., vive en la ciudad de las Flores Masaya, ella tiene 63 años de edad y vive en el Barrio Camilo Chamorro, es casada  y tiene 5 hijos los cuales son mayores de edad y viven de forma independiente.

ella se dedica a la venta de pinolillo, cereal, ropa, plástico, comida, tiene una amplia gama de diferente productos  a ofrecer, dentro de los planes de la señora esta la rmodelacion total de los cuartos de us casa, el cual esta bastante deteriorado. Ella es una mujer muy humilde que vive en una casita que no posee los recursos óptimos de habitad. dentro de sus aspiraciones estqa la remodelacion de us hogar y para esto solicita el rpestamo para la reconstruccion y espera se le apoye economicamente, esto le traera la tranquilidad de ofrecerles a sus hijos un mejor lugar donde habitar o una herencia que dejarle a ellos.
texts.en:
Hortencia Francisca D. C., 63, lives in the city of Flores Masaya, in the Camilo Chamorro neighborhood. She has 5 adult, independent, children. She sells pinolillo (a traditional Nicaraguan beverage based on toasted, ground corn and cocoa), cereal, clothing, plastics, prepared meals - she has a wide range of different products to offer. Within her plans is the total remodeling of the rooms in her house, which are in pretty deteriorated condition. She is a very humble woman who lives in a little house that lacks the basic conditions required for habitability. Within her dreams is the remodeling of her house and for this she needs financing. She hopes that she will receive the financial help she needs; this will bring her peace of mind in that it will make possible a better place for her children to live or for her to leave them as an inheritance.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For room remodel.

loans.name: Edit Soledad

texts.es:
Edit Soledad es una mujer proactiva, a sus 27 años es una mujer luchadora, es conviviente tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 11 años, trabaja con EDAPROSPO prosperidad desde hace 5 años, se dedica a la venta de cereales, carne de cerdo y carnero que trae desde Huánuco personalmente o también le envía mediante encomiendas sus familiares de dicha zona, realiza esta operación desde hace 6 años y además hace servicios de lavado de prendas de vestir, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado comprarse un terreno para construir su propia vivienda ya que vivía en casa de familiares.
El gran sueño de Edit, es mejorar el acabado de su vivienda y tener un negocio grande.
El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido en la compra de prendas de vestir para comercializar en campaña escolar. Edit se encuentra muy agradecida por todo el apoyo brindado, porque le ha ayudado  a mejorar su calidad de vida y el de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Edit Soledad, 27, is a proactive, tenacious woman. She lives with her life partner and their two children, who are 9 and 11 years old. She has collaborated with EDAPROSPO PROSPERIDAD for 5 years. She sells cereals, pork and mutton that she personally brings from Huánuco or that she has her relatives in that area ship her. She has been in this line of work for 6 years and she also takes in washing. With the fruits of her daily efforts she has managed to buy a lot to build her house because she had been living with her relatives. Edit's great dream is to improve the finishings of her house and to have a big store. The latest loan will be used to buy school clothes to sell. Edit is very grateful for all the help she's gotten because it has helped her improve the quality of life of herself and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy articles of school clothing.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy B. has been married for 21-years. She is a rice grower and duck raiser from Sto. Nino, South Cotabato. The income which she gets from growing rice has helped her family a great deal in order to buy food and meet other basic needs. At present, she has a little problem in financing her rice farm so she is applying for a loan Php 15,000 from Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures Inc to buy farm supplies and fertilizers. The loan will also help in buying ducklings for her business of duck raising.

loans.use: To buy ducklings and farm supplies.

loans.name: Magda Araceli

texts.es: La señora Magda Araceli vive sola ya que su hija ya esta casada, ella es propietaria de una estancia infantil de nombre “Camila” por parte del gobierno de la cual recibe comisión por la atención a niños de madres trabajadoras, ella es una cliente disntiguida de nuestra institución ya que anteriormente se le otorgo un crédito para mejora de su estancia donde acondiciono una área de juegos para niños; y nuevamente tramita para inversión en compra de material didáctico, y así además de estar en un lugar seguro los niños pueden aprender cosas  educativas.
texts.en:
Magda Araceli lives alone because her daughter is now married. She owns a government daycare center called “Camila”. The government pays her a commission for taking care of the children of working mothers. She is a distinguished client with our institution. She previously received a loan to improve the daycare center by setting up a play area for children. She wants a new loan to buy educational material. In addition to being in a safe place, the children can learn educational things.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Educational materials for the children in her daycare facility

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: LA SEÑORA MARIA DEL CARMEN ESTA CASADA Y TIENE HIJOS PEQUEÑOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, SU ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL ES LA VENTA DE SACOS(BOLZAS GRANDES PARA CARGA DE DISTINTOS PRODUCTOS), TIENE  CLIENTES FIJOS QUE LE REALIZAN PEDIDOS, TANTO DEL MERCADO CAMPESINO COMO DE OTROS MERCADOS, SU ESPOSO, QUE ES TAXISTA, LE AYUDA A DISTRIBUIR LOS PEDIDOS, SE DEDICA A ESTE NEGOCIO DESDE HACE 5 AÑOS, VIVE EN CASA PROPIA, LA SEÑORA ESTA EN CUARTA SECUENCIA, DONDE HA DEMOSTRADO SER MUY RESPONSABLE Y FIEL CON EMPRENDER. CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO LA SRA. MARIA DEL CARMEN COMPRARA MERCADERIA PARA TENER VARIEDAD DE PRODUCTOS, ESTA AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
María del Carmen is married and has young, school-age children. Her main activity is selling sacks (large bags to carry different products). She has regular customers who place orders at the Farmer’s Market as much as in other markets. Her husband is a taxi driver, and he helps her deliver the orders. She has been in this business for five years. She lives in her own house. She is in her fourth cycle. She has demonstrated herself to be very responsible and loyal to Emprender. María del Carmen will use the money from the loan to buy merchandise to have a variety of products. She is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence given in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Gerardo Jose

texts.es: El señor Gerardo ha sido un hombre muy esforzado, tiene 50 años de edad, vive en el barrio Linda Vista, gracias al  apoyo de sus padres  logro el bachillerato con la ventaja que salía  bachiller y técnico a la vez en el instituto. Lo que desde joven logro comenzar a trabajar y apoyaba a sus padres, ya que eran una familia muy humildes. Su primer trabajo es en el Banco Nicaragüense en donde comienza como auxiliar contable. Luego se casa y junto a su esposa procreo tres hijos ya mayores de edad. Tiene veinte cinco años laborando y ayudado a sus hijos con los estudios, su casa no la ha logrado terminar por completo a un es de tierra y falta repellar las paredes lo que espera lograr a corto plazo. Siempre deseo sacar una segunda carrera que es derecho por gracias a Dios,  la término lo que espera poder comenzar hacer acesoria contable y legal para tener mejores ingreso. Con este financiamiento lo quiere para pagar el titulo de derecho que le es caro y no cuenta con este dinero es por eso de gran necesidad para poder pagar y comenzar su objetivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Gerardo, 50, has struggled much. He lives in the Linda Vista neighborhood. Thanks to help from his parents, he was able to finish high school receiving both his high school diploma and technical certification. From a very young age he began to work in order to help support his parents because they were a very humble family. His first job was with the Banco Nicaragüense where he worked as an accounting assistant. Then, he got married. He and his wife had three children, who are now all adults. He has worked for 25 years and has helped his children with their education. He hasn't mananged to finish his house completely; it's still made of dirt and the walls need replastering, which he hopes to do in the short term. He always wanted a second career: law. Thanks to God, he completed it. What he wants to do now is offer legal and accounting consultancies in order to earn better income. He will use this loan to pay for the costs of getting his professional law title; this is a very expensive process and he does not have the funds necessary for this and to start working toward his new professional objective.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for his professional law title which is very expensive and he does not have the money to do so.

loans.name: Angel Pablo

texts.es:
Angel es un padre de familia de 56 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el pueblo joven San Martín una zona urbano – marginal del distrito de Lambayeque, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Trabaja como chofer en una combi que cubre las rutas Chiclayo – Lambayeque y viceversa desde hace 20 años. Este negocio ha sido su fuente de sustento durante todo este tiempo y con ella ha sacado adelante a su familia. Su rutina empieza desde las 5 am y termina a las 10pm.

Las lluvias que se presentaron en la zona norte del país en las ultimas semanas provocaron algunos deperfectos en su vivienda. Por ello Angel se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le permitan ralizar las reparaciones correspondientes.

Angel es una persona alegre, carismática y muy trabajadora. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Angel is 56 and lives with his wife and their three children in the new out-lying area, San Martín , on the outskirts of the district of Lambayeque, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the past 20 years he has worked as a combi driver on the Chiclayo-Lamayeque route, and vice-versa. This business has been the source of income that has provided for and helped his family get ahead during all these years. His day starts at 5 am and finishes at 10 pm. The rains that have been falling in the northern zone of his country in the last few weeks have caused some problems with his house. That is the reason Angel is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 new sols. The money will allow him to make the necessary repairs. Angel is a cheerful, charismatic person and very hard-working. He has worked with our institution in the past and has shown punctuality and responsibility when he needs to take care of his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance of house expenses caused by the rains

loans.name: Adalgiza Maria

texts.es:
Adalgiza María Márquez G.,  tiene 35 años  de edad vive en Cundinamarca con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 5 y 13 años;  se dedica a la venta de víveres,  ranchos y bebidas y todo lo necesario para que las amas de casa se acerquen y realicen las compras de su canasta familiar, pues en ese sector hay muchos conjuntos residenciales, lo que hace más fácil la rotación de la mercancía que ella vende.
Desde hace   un año inició su negocio con la ayuda de un familiar y gradualmente ha crecido, pero no tiene muchas veces efectivo disponible para acceder a las ofertas con descuentos que hacen los depósitos y que como aumentan tan rápido los artículos y sus productos rotan rápidamente no tiene existencia en deposito que soporte el aumento de los precios. Es por esto que acude a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para   hacer su primer crédito por valor de $ 1.500.000 que invertirá en la compra de artículos como refrescos, lácteos, dulcería y mecatos con esta inyección de capital de trabajo, busca incrementar sus ingresos y sueña mas adelante con que  su negocio se amplíe cada vez mas  y es que la capacidad de trabajo y disciplina de Adalgiza, hace posible que  algún día un llegue a tener un autoservicio.
texts.en:
Adalgiza María Márquez G. is 35 years old and lives in Cundinamarca with her husband and two children, ages 5 and 13. She sells provisions, food, beverages, and all the necessities that housewives look for when they come by to shop. Since her business is located in a highly populated residential sector, she has an easier time of turning over the merchandise that she sells.

Adalgiza started her business one year ago with the help of her family. It has gradually increased, but often there is not enough money to take advantage of discounted deals. Her products sell rapidly but there is not enough capital to restock because of the increase in prices. For this reason, she has come to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to access her first loan in the amount of 1,500,000 COP to purchase soft drinks, dairy products, sweets, and snacks. With this infusion of operating capital, she hopes to increase her earnings and fulfill her dream of succeeding in her business. Adalgiza continues to grow each day and becomes more disciplined in her capacity to work. One day she hopes to open a self-service store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, dairy products, sweets, and snacks

loans.name: Maria Elia

texts.es: La señora María Elia es casada con el señor Roberto Pérez y son una pareja muy estable, pero sobretodo muy trabajadora. Ellos tienen un negocio de abarrotes de nombre “El Changarro” establecido desde hace 15 años con el apoyo de su marido e hijos los cuales les ha proporcionado a todos carrera profesional con el esfuerzo del trabajo de su negocio. Como una familia muy unida están solicitando este crédito para la inversión a su negocio.
texts.en:
María Elia is married to Roberto Pérez; they are a very stable couple, and above all very hard-working. They have a grocery store called “El Changarro” ("The Little Shop") which was established 15 years ago. María Elia benefits from the help of her husband and her children, who have all been able to learn a profession thanks to the family's hard work with the store. As a very united family, they are requesting this loan to invest in their business.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in her business by purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta owns a sari-sari (general) store and a rice field that is five hectares.  She is 66 years-old and a rice farmer in Banga, South Cotabato.  She started her business in 1980.  With the income she receives from her farm and store, the financial needs of her family are met.  

She joined Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in order to seek a loan for her farm.  She is asking for a 15,000 Php as additional capital to finance her business.  With this amount, she can buy fertilizers, seeds and also some additional groceries for her store.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la fotografía es el esposo de Silvia.

Silvia S. J. y su esposo se han esforzado para tener un patrimonio seguro a sus tres hijos, es por ello que quieren hacerle mejoras a su vivienda para preparase en un futuro y dejarle un techo donde puedan vivir cómodamente. Con este crédito será el segundo con la institución donde  pudo realizar su proyecto. Ahora en la casa quiere terminar el baño de esa misma casa para no tener que salir afuera y en esta temporada de frió y puedan contagiarse de alguna enfermedad.
El esposo de Silvia es quien sostiene los gastos de la casa por medio de su pensión.
texts.en:
The person appearing in the photograph is Silvia's husband. Silvia and her husband have worked hard to create a secure life for their 3 children. That's why they want to make improvements on their house and prepare for the future with a home where they can live comfortably. This loan will be their 2nd with this institution for this project. Now they want to complete their bathroom, so they don't have to go outside in freezing temperatures and risk illness. Silvia's husband covers the costs of the house by means of his pension.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUILDING A BATHROOM IN THEIR HOME

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan, 48, is a rice farmer in Banga, South Cotabato. She also owns a sari-sari (general) store as additional income for her family. She is a mother of three children, her eldest is 23 years-old. She started her business last year in 2009. She's now requesting a loan from Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures, Inc. for 8,000 Php. This will enable her to buy farm supplies and groceries for her store.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Yolen

texts.en:
37 year old Yolen has a hog raising business.  She started her business last year in 2009 and now she owns 2 pigs in Banga, South Cotabato.

She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in May 2009.  She said that she was able to finance her business with a low interest loan.  Now she would like to request a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more feed for her piggery business.

loans.use: To buy feed

loans.name: Jesus Martin

texts.es: CLIENTE H. M. JESÚS MARTÍN CASADO CON UN MENOR HIJO DE 01 AÑO CON NEGOCIO DE TRANSPORTE, POSEE UNA MOTOTAXI, LA UNIDAD DE TRANSPORTE LA MANEJA EL CLIENTE DESDE LAS 06 DE LA MAÑANA HASTA LAS 9 DE LA NOCHE , SOLICTA PRESTAMO YA QUE SU SUEGRA LE HA SEDIDO UN CUARTO EL CUAL TIENE TECHO DE CALAMINA Y NECESITA EL DINERO PARA TERMINAR LA CONSTRUCCION DEL TECHO DE MATERIAL NOBLE, SE PUDO EVIDENCIAR QUE ES UNA PERSONA EMPRENDEDORA YA QUE TRABAJA PARA MEJORAR POCO A POCO LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE SU FAMILIA , CUENTA CON BUENAS REFENRECIAS PERSONALES
texts.en:
Jesús Martín is married with a 1-year-old son and has a transportation business. He owns a mototaxi, which he uses to transport customers from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. He is requesting the loan because his mother-in-law has given him a room with a shabby roof, and he needs the money to finish construction with better materials. Jesús, who has strong personal references, has shown himself to be an enterprising person who has worked hard to improve his family's quality of life little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a better roof

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Sra C. P. Martha de 43 años de edad, es madre soltera. Tiene 1 hijo menor. Se encuentra domiciliada en casa de sus padres ubicada en la Urbanización Sebastian Barranca del Distrito de Santiago. Trabaja como Obrera de campo en una empresa agroindustrial desde hace 10 años. Adicionalmente percibe otros ingresos de pensión por alimentación. Gracias a su empeño y esfuerzo esta sacando adelante a su hijo y a podido adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para mejoramiento de vivienda ya que en el terremoto del 2007  se vio efectada. Su sueño es terminar de construir la vivienda para lograr una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Martha is a 43-year-old single mother with one young son. She lives in her parents' home in the Sebastian Barranca area of the district of Santiago. She has worked in the field for an agroindustrial company for the past 10 years. She also receives additional income from a pension, which she uses to buy food. Thanks to her hard work she continues making headway with her son and has been able to acquire her goods. She is requesting the loan to make improvements to her home, which was damage in an earthquake in 2007. Her dream is to finish building the home so she can have a better quality of life. She is very grateful for the support she receives through microfinancing.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Progreso Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Progreso es parte del centro focal de Panamericana.  Este es su segundo ciclo, la mayoría de las socias solicitaron recoger su ahorro y de esta manera cada socia tendría doble ingreso económico para impulsar el negocio: el del ahorro y el dinero desembolsado en el crédito.  Esta asociación tiene 10 clientes, 9 mujeres y 1 varon.  El varon extra que se encuentra vestido de chamarra negra es el esposo de una socia.

Los negocios de las socias son diferentes: tejido de mantas, venta de zapatos, albañileria, tejido de mantas de vicuña, venta de papas fritas, mantas, ropa, zapatos y abarrotes.

La señora Susana M.  contínúa a cargo de la asociación como presidenta.   Ella indica que su negocio de elaboración de mantas de vicuña necesita capitalizarse, pues se avecina la época de frio (Otoño e Invierno) y en la misma hay demanda de sus productos
texts.en:
The Progreso community group is part of a Panamerican regional center. This is their second loan cycle, and the majority of the members are requesting it to revamp their savings. In this way, each member can double the money they infuse into their business: from their personal savings and from the loan. There are 10 group members, nine women and one man. The extra man in the photo wearing a black jacket is the husband of another member. The members' businesses are varied: weaving blankets (which multiple members do), selling shoes and clothing, construction, selling french fries, and grocery sales. Susana M. continues to be in charge of the group as president. She says that her business making blankets out of vicuña wool, which is similar to llamas and alpacas, needs to raise capital since the cold seasons of fall and winter are approaching and her products will be in high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie P. is from the village of Galingon, Tampilisan. She is 43 years old. Rosemarie is married and has adult children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns & operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosemarie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rosemarie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sausales De Rio Seco Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “Sausales de Rio Seco” está conformada a partir de la iniciativa de una mesa directiva activa: la señora Teresa, Sonia y Maria Juana, son 8 integrantes en la asociación, 7 mujeres y 1 varon.

Los negocios que llevan adelante son:  venta de cosméticos, venta de flores, compra – venta de polleras, venta de ropa y mercadería de acuerdo a la época.

La presidenta María Juana Q., de 35 años de edad, casada con un solo hijo,  se dedica a la venta de frazadas en la feria de la Zona 16 de Julio.  La Feria de la Zona 16 de Julio es la más grande de la ciudad de El Alto, se extiende por todas las calles y avenidas de la zona, los dìas jueves y domingo, desde muy temprano en mañana hasta el atardecer. 
Las Frazadas y flores plásticas que vende la señora María Juana Q. son compradas por ella en el 
departamento de Oruro, en los últimos tres meses está viajando a chile.
texts.en:
The communal association, "Sausales de Rio Seco," started from an active managing committee composed of three women: Teresa, Sonia, and Maria Juana. There are 8 members in the association: 7 women and 1 man. They conduct the following businesses: the sale of cosmetics, the sale of flowers, the purchase and sale of skirts, the sale of clothing and other seasonal products. The president, Maria Juana Q., whom is 35 years old and married with one son, sells blankets at the Zona 16 de julio Fair. The Zona 16 de julio Fair is the largest of its kind in the city of El Alto. It extends down all of the streets and avenues of the area on Thursdays and Sundays, from really early in the morning until sunset. Maria Juana Q. buys the blankets and plastic flowers that she sells from the city of Oruro. She has been traveling to Chile these past three months.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Blankets and plastic flowers.

loans.name: Pupa

texts.en:
Pupa F. is 29 and married with 1 child.  She owns a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish .  Pupa has 1 year of experience in this business.  Pupa needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Pupa joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Pupa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Pupa F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Seutaatia

texts.en:
Seutaatia F. is 25 and married with 2 children.  She owns a business venture, selling pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam).  Seutaatia has 1 year of experience in this business.  Seutaatia needs a loan of WST $1000 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Seutaatia joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Seutaatia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.  Seutaatia joined the program to assist her business development.

The following social metrics for Seutaatia F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Jairo Efraín

texts.es: El cliente es originario del municipio de San francisco del norte y el crédito será destinado para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como: cemento, arena, bloques, mano de obra, madera para así tener una casa digna donde vivirá con su familia.
texts.en:
The client is from San Francisco del Norte. He will use the funds to buy building materials and supplies like: cement, sand, concrete blocks, lumber and to pay for labor costs so that his family will have a proper place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Chulumani Group

texts.es:
Pro Mujer celebra este año 20º aniversario como organización de apoyo a la mujer. El centro focal de Los Andes es uno de los más antiguos de la Regional de El Alto, a su vez la asociación comunal Chulumani es una de las más antiguas, pues cuenta con 25 ciclos en Pro Mujer (doce años y medio aproximadamente).

Los negocios que reportan las socias son: venta de calzados, ropa de bebé, tejido de chompas, tienda de abarrotes, venta de cañerías, tejido de mantas, macramé, venta de jugos y regrescos, venta de queso y de sal.

La señora Agustina Elena R. de 42 años de edad, casada con 3 hijos (2 mujeres y 1 varón), tiene el negocio de tejido de mantas durantes los momentos libres, en general en los dos últimos años ha estado viajando a los Departamentos de Cochabamba y Santa Cruz, llevando material escolar. Este negocio fue iniciado bajo el consejo de su hermana que ya tenía experiencia en el desarrollo de esta actividad económica. Sin embargo, estas no han sido las únicas actividades económicas que ha emprendido,  la  señora Agustina indica que en los 24 ciclos que ha sido socia de Pro Mujer a desarrollado diferentes negocios de acuerdo a las oportunidad que se le ha presentado.
texts.en:
Pro Mujer celebrates its 20th Anniversary this year as an organization that supports women. The main office in the Andes is one of the oldest in the El Alto Region, with the Chulumani being one of the longest standing communal associations, having had 25 loan cycles with Pro Mujer (approximately twelve and a half years). The businesses that the members conduct are: the sale of footwear, baby clothes, woven sweaters and blankets, canned goods, juices and refreshments, macrame items, cheese and salt, and a grocery store. Mrs. Agustina Elena R. is 42 years old and married with three children (2 girls and 1 boy). She has a blanket weaving business during her free time and has been traveling to the cities of Cochabamba and Santa Cruz these past two years, taking school supplies along with her. This business began under the advice of her sister, whom already had experience in the development of this type of economic activity. Nevertheless, these haven't been the only economic activities that Agustina has undertaken. During the 24 loan cycles that she has been a member of Pro Mujer, she has developed different businesses according to the opportunities that have been presented to her.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, paper, folders

loans.name: Jesus Te Ama Jov Group

texts.es:
Asociaciones Comunales de Jòvenes es una forma de trabajo que desarrolló Pro Mujer hace unos años, para el apoyo a las iniciativas de autoempleo de los jòvenes, este crédito era para grupos de  cuatro o más jòvenes, que se comprometan junto a sus pdres a mantener la garantía solidaria .
