loans.use: To buy pig feed and additional piglets

loans.name: Ruperto

texts.en: Ruperto, age 55, manages a rice and banana farm. It is located in his town in the province of Agusan del Sur. At his age, he still wants to provide for his children and grandchildren. He maintains the farm in order for his whole family to benefit from it. When he found out about CEVI, he immediately joined to have access to financial support for his business. He requested a loan of 6000 PHP. He said he would use it to buy farm supplies, like seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies, like seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila, age 38, has three children with her husband, Arnel. Her oldest child is only 9 years old. Lucila is involved in rice farming, and she also runs a small store located at her home. She said that her business really helped her family a lot. She wants to earn better in order to keep up with her children's increasing school fees.

Lucila is seeking a loan of 5000 PHP. She needs it in order to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm supplies for her rice farm. She also hopes to acquire additional supplies for her store.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: “I manage 2 hectares of rice field, and I was also able to start a small store to have an extra source of income," shares Cristina, an entrepreneur from Trento, Agusan Del Sur. At 53, she now has four children with her husband, Somy. Both of them agree that their children’s education should be a top priority. Cristina helps Somy maintain their rice field. She needs additional capital, so she applied to CEVI and asked for a loan of 5,000 PHP. With this amount, Cristina can buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies she needs.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is a new member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She said that the reason she joined is because she needs financial support for her business, which is a rice farm. She wants to keep the farm productive because it gives her income that provides for her family’s needs. She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP so she could buy seeds, fertilizers, and other supplies her farm needs.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Welina

texts.en: One thing Welina learned in managing a rice farm is continuous hard work and patience. She said that she faced a lot of challenges but was able to get through every obstacle. She also finds comfort in knowing that she and her husband are together for this journey. She has four children who also go to school. This is the first time she has joined an MFI. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from CEVI and will be using it for farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria’s income from her rice farm is only enough to pay her obligations and to buy food for her family. She wants to improve it so she could also save money and improve her family’s living conditions. She has three children with her husband, Wilfredo. Like any other businesswoman, she wants to succeed and give her children a bright future.

Maria is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use it to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma has been farming for years now. During her first few years, she was lacking financially, and it forced her to borrow from lenders who charged high interest. It brought her difficulties, but she was able to get through it. She works hard to help her husband provide for their family, especially for the education of their five children. She asked for a loan from CEVI, which she would use to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en: Gilda is a rice farmer. She is 56 years old and married with six children. She said that sometimes she does not earn anything from her farm, because her harvest is only enough to pay the lenders from whom she borrowed capital. Now that she has learned of CEVI, she settled her obligations and joined this microfinance institution. She is asking for a loan of 5000 PHP. She will use it to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and other farm supplies. She also hopes to buy piglets in order to start raising pigs.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en: Virgilia used to borrow her business capital from lenders who charged high interest with their loans. Her harvest from her rice farm was only enough to pay the lenders. She barely earned income for her family. She said now that she is a member of CEVI, she hopes to earn because of their lower interest rate. She said that paying back her loan will be a lot easier now compared to before. She is asking for a loan of 5000 PHP, which she will use to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other needed farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, and other needed farm supplies

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie raises pigs for a living. He is 37 years old and married. He also sells dried fish and uses his motorcycle to transport people around his community. He wants to prosper in his business in order to keep up with the growing needs of his household. He requested a loan of 5000 PHP, which he would use for purchasing pig feed and piglets. He also hopes to increase his supply of dried fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and piglets

loans.name: Survivor Group

texts.en:
Eleanor D. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Survivor. She is 32 years old and married with three children, ages 2, 5, and 9. Her oldest child is in the 5th grade, and her next oldest child is in the 2nd grade. Eleanor also helps care for two of her aunts.

Eleanor's business is making and selling tie-dyed clothes, something she's been doing for four years. She says she started her business with 500 LRD in seed money, and now she operates with 6000 LRD in working capital. She says her enterprise is a success. She also says that she faces difficulty when she allows customers to buy on credit, and they don't pay her back promptly. Eleanor sells the clothes she creates at the Chicken Soup Factory Market in Monrovia, the capital of Liberia.

With her 15,000-LRD share of this 95,000-LRD group loan, Eleanor intends to buy more materials to make tie-dyed clothes. She says the colors of her clothes are nice, which is what keeps her customers coming back. She hopes to provide the means for all her children to get a good education.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Eleanor is the one holding the sign. Ophelia S. is inset at the lower right.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socioeconomic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and LEAP puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy materials for making tie-dyed clothes

loans.name: Jemmar

texts.en:
Jemmar, 23, is the father of a 2-year-old child. He married his wife, Jenny, in 2006. His family lives in a town in Agusan Del Sur. 

Jemmar started his own business, which is farming, when he married his wife. He started with two hectares of field and he had his uncle's help to finance the farm. On harvest, he pays the capital, and he and his uncle split the income. When he learned about CEVI, he immediately joined to take advantage of its program. He was glad to have his own capital to use. He applied for a loan of PHP 6,000, which he would definitely use to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies that he needs. Hopefully, Jemmar will earn better income through this loan.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn farms for a living. She is 39 years old, married and has five children. She and her husband own and till a two-hectare rice field. She said that both of them work hard to achieve their goals, one of which is having all their children finish college. 

Marilyn learned about CEVI through her fellow farmers. She was encouraged to join because of the low interest it offers. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 6,000. With that amount, Marilyn can buy certified seeds, fertilizers and other supplies that her farm lacks.

loans.use: To buy certified seeds, fertilizers and other supplies that her farm lacks

loans.name: Nelly Ann

texts.en:
Nelly Ann, a rice farmer, wants to be successful in life. She wants to help improve her family’s living conditions. She currently has two hectares of rice field that she tills patiently. She also wants to venture into other kinds of businesses, but still waits for the right time. She is thinking of raising hogs so her family will have an extra source of income.

Nelly Ann is a new member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She said she needs PHP 6,000 for her business. She would buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies with the loan. She also hopes to buy piglets so she can start raising pigs.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth U. has three children. Her oldest child is 21 years old. 

Elizabeth invested in farming in 2005. She now has a hectare of rice field, which, according to her, currently needs farm supplies. She wants to grow her farm to be able to have a better income. She applied for a loan of PHP 5,000, which she hopes will help her grow her business. She will bU. certified seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies with the loan.

loans.use: To buy certified seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en:
Jeralyn, 20, is a young mother to a 1-year-old child. She married her husband, Nardjun, a year ago. 

Jeralyn is involved in rice farming and she said she learned to keep records of expenses to know if she is earning. She wants to be an active entrepreneur and she wants her farm to grow. She joined CEVI to gain access to its program. She requested a loan of PHP 6,000 that she would use for her farm. With this amount, she will be able to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Hiezel

texts.en:
Hiezel has been married to her husband, Ronie, for 18 years. They have five children, whom they send to school. 

Hiezel and her family live on farming. She and her husband till a rice field to be able to provide for the growing needs of the family. When free of farming duties, her husband does welding to have extra earnings.

It is Hiezel’s first time to join an MFI, and she is hopeful that its program will be really helpful to her farming. She requested a loan of PHP 6,000. She will use this loan to buy farming necessities, such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy farming necessities, such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi started farming when she married her husband, Antonio. She now has five children; the oldest is 23 years old. She and her husband work together at the farm to be able to earn a living. She also raises pigs to earn extra income. Like other mothers, she wants all her children to finish college and have a bright future. 

Noemi is seeking a loan of PHP 6,000 that she would use to fund her farm. She will buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She also wants to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and pig feed

loans.name: Delma

texts.en: Delma, age 38, is a married woman from Agusan Del Sur. Together with her husband, she maintains five hectares of rice field. She also runs a small store to have extra earnings. She wants her business to prosper, so she works hard to achieve prosperity. She recently joined CEVI to gain access to its program and other opportunities. She asked for a loan of PHP 6,000, which she will use to buy farm supplies, such as seeds and fertilizers. She will also acquire additional supplies for her store.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm, and additional supplies for her store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth dreams of prospering in her business. She manages a rice farm in her town in Agusan Del Sur. She is married and has children. 

One of the challenges Elizabeth has faced in farming is the lack of financial support. She said that it is hard to achieve an abundant harvest when the capital is small. Now that she is a member of CEVI, she is grateful to have gained access to its program. She hopes to stay long with the MFI. She is currently requesting a loan of PHP 6,000. This loan will be used for farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies, such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
“I have been farming for 15 years already,” shares Lilibeth. She is a 38-year-old married woman from Agusan Del Sur. She has six children and her oldest child is only 13 years old. She and her husband aim to have all of their children finish college and have a bright future. She helps her husband maintain their 1.5 hectares of rice field, which she wants to be productive at all times.

Lilibeth needs PHP 6,000 for her farm. She will use it to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies that her rice farm lacks.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies that her rice farm lacks

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda farms to earn a living. She has two children and her oldest child is 15 years old. She helps her husband work at the farm; she makes sure it is free of weeds and pests so that rice crops can grow healthy on the land. Sometimes, she also sells food at the school canteen. She said that it’s really hard to keep up with the school fees of her children, so she has to find ways to earn money. 

Merlinda is seeking a loan of PHP 5,000. She will use it to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. Receiving this loan is truly helpful to Merlinda’s farming.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn is a 26-year-old married woman. She has two children; the oldest is eight years old. 

Rubelyn owns tractors, which other farmers rent during plowing and harvesting. This is how she earns income for her family. She wants to acquire an additional tractor so more farmers can rent at the same time. She applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 from CEVI. If granted, she said she would use it to buy an additional tractor.

loans.use: To buy an additional tractor for rent to farmers

loans.name: Santos Margarita

texts.es: Santos Margarita se dedica a la venta de joyas y perfumes, tiene 53 años de edad, soltera, es primer crédito que solicita, sus referencias indican que es una persona responsable y trabajadora, necesita un crédito para incrementar su capital de trabajo en la venta de joyas y perfumes, en los últimos meses sus ventas han mejorado considerablemente el crédito le ayuda surtir su venta.
texts.en:
Santos Margarita sells jewelry and perfume. She is 53 years old and single. This is the first loan she has requested. Her references indicate that she is a responsible and hard-working person. She needs the loan to increase her working capital in selling jewelry and perfume. In the last few months her sales have improved considerably. The loan helps her stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jewelry and perfume

loans.name: Encarnacion Delfina

texts.es: Encarnacion tiene 59 años, es divorciada y tiene una hija. Ella estudio la primaria. Es conocida como una persona trabajadora y se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo y chicharron en el Mercado de Totonicapan, tiene diez años de experiencia en el negocio. Acudio a ASDIR para solicitar su primer credito para poder comprar unos marranos y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Encarnación is 59, divorced, and has a daughter. She has an elementary school education. She is known as a hard-working person. She sells pork and “chicharron” (made from 3 or 4 chunks of pork, served with fried potatoes, sweet or savory corn, onion, and spearmint salad) in the Totonicapan Market. She has ten years of experience in the business. She comes to ASDIR to ask for her first loan to be able to buy some pigs to get better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Women Empowerment Group

texts.en:
Mary B. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Women Empowerment. She is 50 years old, married, and the mother of eight children, whose ages range from 13 to 35.  Her youngest child is in the 6th grade, and the oldest attended university, but dropped out.  Mary herself never went to school due to poverty. Besides her own children, Mary also cares for a niece and nephew.

Mary's business is the sale of general goods, such as soap and candles, and food items, such as seasonings and pepper, onions, and rice.  She has been in business for more than 30 years, and today she sells from a market stall at the Chicken Soup Factory Market in Gardnersville, near Liberia's capital of Monrovia. During the Liberian civil war, Mary and her family fled the country for neighboring Guinea. When she returned to Liberia, she started her general goods business with about 30,000 Liberian dollars in seed money. With her 20,000 Liberian dollar share of this 75,000 Liberian dollar group loan, Mary plans to buy more inventory for her shop.

In the future, Mary hopes to grow her business and open a store that sells general goods. She wants to be able to provide for all her children, and to help them get a good education.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mary is the one holding the sign. Watta D. is inset at lower left.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy general goods such as soap and candles, and food items such as seasoning and pepper, onions, and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es: Don Carlos Manuel S. pequeño agricultor de la comarca El Pijibay del municipio de el Rama, es casado con la Sra. Cleotilde, tiene 4 hijos, Carlos Antonio de 36 años y Delvin de 34, quienes ya se casaron y tienen su propia familia, y las menores Carla de 15 estudiando 3er año de secundaria y Fatima de 8 añitos en 4to grado de primaria, habitan con el; Esta necesitando fortalecer su inventario ganadero por lo que solicita a Afodenic su primer financiamiento para la compra de 5 toretes ya que quiere aprovechar el precio que tiene el ganado.  La finca del Sr. Carlos Manuel S. es apta para el manejo de semovientes ya que presenta las condiciones necesarias, tales como aguajes, pastos y praderas. Personalmente atiende su finca ayudado por su hijo y mano de obra que contrata temporalmente. Sus vecinos y colindantes dicen que es una persona honesta y cumplida con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Carlos Manuel S. is a small farmer from the El Pijibay region in the municipality of Rama. He is married to Cleotilde, and has 4 children. His oldest sons are: Carlos Antonio who is 36 and Delvin who is 34, they are both married and have their own families. His youngest daughters are: Carla who is 15 and studying in her 3rd year of secondary school, and Fatima who is 8 and in 4th grade. Carlos’ youngest children live with him. Carlos would like to strengthen his cattle inventory, which is why he is requesting his first loan through Afodenic; his first loan will be used to purchase 5 young bulls given that he would like to take advantage of the current price of the cattle. Carlos Manuel S.’ ranch is well equipped to raise livestock as it contains the necessary elements for cattle raising, such as watering holes, pastures, and meadows. He personally attends to his ranch, helped by his son and workers that he hires seasonally. His neighbors say that he is an honest person, who fulfills his commitments.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase young bulls.

loans.name: Violeta Giuliana

texts.es:
Violeta tiene 27 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 8 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres en el sector Posope Alto un anexo del distrito de Pátapo, ubicado a cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad por sacar adelante a su hijo hizo que hace cuatro años empezara a trabajar vendiendo leche de soya y avena por las calles de Posope. Todas las mañanas Violeta se levanta muy temprano a preparar estos productos y luego los vende por litros a sus clientes que los consumen en el desayuno.

Este negocio es la unica fuente de ingreso con la que apoya a su hijo, pero ahora que este está creciendo y que ya está asistiendo a la escuela, Violeta siente que los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para sacarlo adelante. Por ello ha decidido iniciar un nuevo negocio de venta de utiles escolares, aprovechando el proximo inicio de clases escolares en el país. Para lograr este objetivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1600 nuevos soles.

Violeta es una mujer trabajadora y que lucha diariamente para salir adelante a pesar de su condicion de madre soltera. Su mayor anhelo es tener una casa en donde pueda instalar un negocio más estable. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Violeta is 27 years old. She is a single mother and she has an eight year old son. She lives in her parents' home in the Posope Alto sector in an annex to the district of Pátapo, located forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. The need to get her son ahead made her start selling soy milk and oatmeal four years ago in the streets of Posope. Every morning Violeta gets up very early to prepare these products and later she sells them by the liter to her clients who eat them for breakfast. This business is the only source of income to support her son. Now that he is growng and going to school, Violeta feels that the income she gets is not enough to get him ahead. Because of this, she decided to start a new business selling school supplies, taking advantage of the new school year about to begin in the country. To attain this goal, she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1600 nuevos soles. Violeta is a hardworking woman and she fights every day to to get ahead despite being a single mother. Her biggest wish is to have a house in which she could set up a more stable business. She has worked with our institution again and has shown herself to be punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to start the business of selling school supplies.

loans.name: Florinda Cruz

texts.es: Florida tiene 30 años de edad, soltera, cuenta con una tienda de consumo diario en su casa de habitación, ha trabajado un crédito anterior demostrando su responsabilidad pagando puntualmente el préstamo, necesita nuevamente el financiamiento para incrementar su capital en la su tienda, el destino será para la compra de mas productos e introducir otros que no las vende y que la clientela lo socita.
texts.en:
Florida is 30 years old and single. She has a store in her house, and she sells daily consumption items. She has worked with a previous loan, and she demonstrated responsibility by paying it punctually. She needs a new loan to increase the capital in her store. The loan will be to buy more products. She will also introduce other products that the customers are asking for that she does not now sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Alan Eduardo

texts.es: Alan tiene 21 años es casado, vive con su esposa e hija. Tiene un bus escolar y junto con su esposa se dedican a la venta de chumpas de cuero. El crédito solicitado será utilizado para la compra de más mercadería para tener productos mas surtidos para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alan is 21 and married. He lives with his wife and daughter. He has a school bus, and together with his wife he sells leather jackets. The requested loan will be used to buy more merchandise in order to have more products in stock for their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu, age 50, is married with three children who are between the ages of 11 and 20 years old. All her children go to school She resides and rents a two roomed house where she is staying with four people. Nulu takes care of one additional family member. There is no electricity and no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. 

Nulu resides and works in a semi urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. Nulu sells charcoal in Kamwokya market and gets charcoal from delivery trucks, so she doesn't incur transport costs. She sells to an average of 30 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for the business and feeding the family. She has been in this business for the past 11 years.

Nulu has been with MCDT for more than ten years and is servicing her 24th loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal  Nulu aspires to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent place of business. 

.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Marilux

texts.es: La señora Marilux es maestra de educación, tiene 5 años de experiencia es muy trabajadora es madre de una niña ella está solicitando el crédito para terminar de construir su casa ya que ha estado repellando sus paredes pero este crédito le ayudara.
texts.en:
Marilux has been a teacher for 5 years. She is very hard-working and is the mother of a daughter. She is requesting funds to finish building her house; she needs to plaster the walls and this loan will help her do so.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish building her house.

loans.name: Yuliana Elena

texts.es:
Yuliana tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el distrito de Santa Rosa, una zona predominantemente pesquera que se ubica a veinticinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de pasamanería (regalos, juguetes, adornos de cerámica y ropa) en su domicilio desde hace cuatro años, este negocio le está brindando ingresos para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar al sostenimiento de su familia.

Ella compra la mercadería en la ciudad de Lima y la ofrece a sus vecinos, en algunos casos atiende pedidos. Su negocio goza de muy buena acogida por la calidad de los productos y el buen trato que ofrece, por ello, Yuliana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más adornos de cerámica. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Yuliana es una joven bastante trabajadora y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo con su negocio para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Yuliana is 24 and single. She lives in her parents’ house, which is located in the Santa Rosa district. It is predominantly a fishing area located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has been selling general goods (watches, toys, ceramic decorations, and clothes) in her home for four years. This business is giving her income to pay for personal expenses, and it helps support her family. She buys the merchandise in Lima, and she offers it to her neighbors. In some cases she takes orders. Her business is well-received because of the quality of the products and the good service she offers. Yuliana wishes to expand her business by purchasing more ceramic decorations. To achieve this objective she has seen the need to request, for the first time, a loan from Edpyme Alternative for 1,000 PEN. Yuliana is a very hard-working and responsible young woman. Her greatest desire is to keep growing with her business in order to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ceramic decorations in order to expand her business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy O. is a 38-year-old mother of three (3) children living in Nambale, Busia District. Being a single mother, Lucy is the sole breadwinner of her family and that means that whatever she does has to generate income to sustain her family.

Lucy was a dairy farmer before starting a poultry farm, a business she initiated in 2004. She buys her stock at the Nambale center once a month. Lucy joined KMET, learned how to operate a business, and learned about the possibility of getting a loan for her business expansion.

She then decided to apply for a loan of Ksh.10,000 that would enable her to achieve her dream of having a business that would ensure economic sustainability.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie W. is 41 years old and married with four (4) children. She lives in and does her business in Nambale, Busia, Kenya. She is an entrepreneur who used to keep poultry – broilers and layers for the purpose of selling both the eggs and the broilers once they matured. In 2007, she changed to dairy farming because it was generating more income compared to the latter.

With her business not involving fast moving goods, Winnie buys her stock every two years in Kitale. With the dream of improving and expanding the business, Winnie needs to replace the dairy cattle that she has and add more stock. But with no other source of income to get this money from, she wants to borrow a loan of Ksh.20,000 to help her achieve her plans. This will enable her to be economically stable and put her in a position to support her family better.

loans.use: To buy more dairy cattle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Linus

texts.en:
Linus M. is a businessman who makes and sells bricks within the community where he lives. He started his business in 1998 after he finished his studies as a source of income. He is 38 years old and married with four (4) children living with him in Nambale Busia District. This is where he also does his business.

Linus wants to increase his brick production. That will enable him to achieve his goal of going large scale to be able to attain a profit that will ensure him economic sustainability and a better future for his family. To do this, he requires a loan of Ksh.10,000 that he will be repaying. He will save the profits generated from his business.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Faridah Musoke‘S Group

texts.en:
Faridah is 42 years old and married, with six children between the ages of 22 and 5 years old. Five of her children go to school and the first-born is working. Faridah owns and resides in a five-room house living with ten people. There is electricity and no water. The family gets three meals a day. 

Faridah resides and works in a semi urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She works seven days a week and operates from her home. She deals in bananas and charcoal, selling to all kinds of people both on wholesale and retail. Faridah sells to an average of 40 people per day. She buys bananas and charcoal from her home and doesn’t incur any extra transport costs. Faridah has been in this business for the past ten years .She first dealt in  bananas, but with subsequent loans from MCDT, was able to supplement her income by investing in a charcoal business.
 
Faridah has been with MCDT for the last six years and is servicing her 18th loan, working all this time with her same group. Her major challenge is defaulters in the charcoal business. She wants to use this loan to invest in farm produce to supply to various nearby schools. She aspires to construct rental houses in free space near her home.
.

loans.use: To invest in farm produce to supply to various nearby schools

loans.name: Arce

texts.en:
Arce Q. is from the village of Lunao, Gingoog City. She is 45 years old. Arce is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Arce owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Arce is just starting this business. Arce's previous business was managing video games in her place.

In 2009, Arce joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arce has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Arce is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Arce from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lambert

texts.en:
Lambert O. is a poultry farmer who lives in Miyanga Village in Nambale, Busia, District. He is 35 years old and married with five (5) children. Before venturing into poultry, Lambert used to ride a bicycle as a boda boda to be able to support his family, but the money he used to generate from it was not sufficient.
 
He buys his stock from the nearby market once a month but would like to be doing this more often due to the rising demand that he has been experiencing lately. He wants to expand the poultry farm by buying more poultry. This will allow him to achieve his goal of expanding his business to an extent that he opens a retail shop selling a variety of goods to be able to generate more profits. That will enable him to provide his children with a better education for a brighter future. 

He would like a loan of Ksh.10,000.

loans.use: To buy more poultry

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina, age 48, is the group leader of five members. She is a widow and she does not get any assistance from anyone else. She has children between the ages of 9 and 23 years old. Regina rents a one-room house where she stays with her children; she also has access to electricity and piped water. She does not care for additional family members. Normally she has one meal a day.

Regina is a tailor and she mainly tailors gomesis (Ugandan traditional wear) and school uniforms. She rents a shop where she tailors her clothes and she works six days a week. She normally sews about three gomesi's a day and her customers are mainly women and children. She normally sews materials that customers bring to her and only charges them labor costs. She has done this particular type of business for over 25 years. The problem she faces in her business is that of competition; there are many tailors around the place where she works. Also, her clients normally come seasonally, for example, when schools are opening for the term. 

Regina has been client with MCDT for more than eight years and she is servicing her 14th loan. The reason she chose to work with MCDT is because of the timely loans; she has worked with her group for eight years now. With this next loan, she wants to buy materials to resell to her customers. She will also use part of it to pay tuition for her children. Regina wants to one day be able to buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred A. sells cereals in Nambale Center and stays in Manyole village in the Nambale Busia District. She started her business in 1992 to be able to support her husband in bringing up their seven children and also be self-sustainable and independent. She is forty years old.

She buys her cereals to sell from Chwele town weekly, but she would like to increase the amount of stock she has so she can achieve her future goal of expanding her business. She is very determined to make that happen.

She is requesting a loan worth KSH 30,000 to help her accomplish her goal.

loans.use: To increase her stock of cereals for sale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma O. is from the village of  San Juan Gingoog City. She is 45 years old. Guillerma is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Guillerma owns and operates a business providing motorela services used to transport passengers to local communites. Guillerma is just starting this business, but still has a vulcanizing shop business.

In 2009, Guillerma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Guillerma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Guillerma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Guillerma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John L. is a businessman who sells shoes. He started this business in 2009 after quitting his previous job as a bar tender. He is twenty-five years old and still single. He is determined to make his life a success.
 
John buys his stock in Uganda twice a month, and he would like to increase the amount of stock he can sell. That is why he is requesting a loan worth KSH 20,000. He hopes the loan will enable him to expand his business so that he can one day own a house.

loans.use: To increase his stock of shoes for sale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon O. is thirty-one years old, and he is married with two children. Due to a high demand for cereals within his community, Simon closed down his bakery shop that was not doing well and started selling cereals in 2008 in Nambale town Busia District. Since then, his business has been doing so well that he plans to increase the amount of stock he has to sell, which he normally buys in Busia twice a week.

He has gotten to understand the K-MET loaning system's terms and conditions, and now he is requesting a loan worth KES 20,000 to be able to add more stock and expand his business to a point that he can sell his goods wholesale.

loans.use: To increase his stock of cereal for sale

loans.name: Walter Elias

texts.es: El señor Walter es un señor agricultor y ganadero que se ha desempeñado desde que era joven, su esposa es maestra de educación el cual lo apoya, el está solicitando un crédito para retener las vacas que él tiene para así no venderla.
texts.en:
Walter is a farmer an cattleman. He has been in this line of work since a very young age. His wife is a teacher and she supports his work. He is asking for funding so that he can keep his cow and not be forced to sell her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To keep his cow.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus O. has been a farmer since 2006 after he quit selling clothes due to its low profit. He does his business in Buhayo Central and lives with his wife and their nine children in Musoma Busia District. He is 36 years old.

Titus buys his supplies from Nambale center twice a year. He wishes to upgrade his farm with modern equipment that will enable him to increase his production. It is for this reason he wishes to get a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings. This will ensure more produce; hence, more income that will enable him to educate his children for a better future.

loans.use: To buy farm equipment

loans.name: Claricsa Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Claricsa del Socorro L., de 41 años de edad vive en el Barrio el Eden es madre soltera de 7 hijos dentro de los cuales 2 son mayores de edad y sobreviven de manera independiente, los demas estudian la secundaria y la primaria y apoyan a los trabajos de la agricultura. 

La familia se dedica a los trabajos de la agricultura desde  hace 30 años, y comenzaron gracias al apoyo económico del padre y dentro de los principales problemas estan la afectación de las tierras por las plagas, ellos por esta razon solicitan de un prestamo para la compra de fertilizantes, esto le ayudara de sobremanera a las tierras de la señora Claricsa y les apoyara económicamente al producirse un producto de calidad, ellos son una familia muy humilde que se apoyan entre todos y esperan que se les brinde un apoyo para emprenderse a nuevos proyectos de vida.
texts.en:
Señora Claricsa del Socorro L., age 41, lives in the Eden neighborhood. She is a single mother of 7 children. Two of these are older and live independently. The rest are in secondary and primary school. She supports them through agricultural work.

The family has been engaged in agriculture for 30 years. They began thanks to the financial support of her father. Among her principal problems is the susceptibility of her fields to diseases. It is for this reason that she is applying for a loan for the purchase of fertilizers. This will be exceedingly helpful to Señora Claricsa’s fields and will provide economic support to her family by producing high quality crops. They are a very humble family that supports one another and they hope that this offers them support for pursuing new opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for the maintenance of her crops.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris es una madre de familia de 41 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo en el caserío Vichayal del distrito de Tuman, ubicado a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Tiene un puesto de venta de verduras en el mercado de la ciudad de Tuman desde hace diez años, todos los dias se dirige a este lugar para ofrecerle a sus clientes yucas, choclos, cebollas, papas y todo tipo de tubérculos y legumbres. Este negocio es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia, ya que su esposo trabaja como obrero agrícola en la empresa agroindustrial de la zona y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos familiares.

Doris nos comenta que gracias a este negocio pudo sacar adelante a sus dos hijos, que ahora ya son independientes. Su negocio goza siempre de buena acogida ya que siempre trata de vender productos frecos y de ofrecer un buen trato a sus clientes. Doris desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Su mayor anhelo es poder vivir en la ciudad para no tener que movilizarse todos los dias del mercado a su vivienda. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Doris is 41 and is married with children. She lives with her husband in the rural community of Vichayal, located in the District of Tuman, half an hour from the city of Chiclayo. Doris has run a vegetable stand in the Tuman city market for the last ten years. Every day she goes to work, offering her customers cassava [yuca root], corn, onions, potatoes, and all sorts of legumes and root vegetables. This enterprise is a great help to her family's finances because her husband is a field worker for the local agrobusiness company and his income is not enough to cover all of the household expenses. Doris has told us that thanks to her business she has been able to help her two children get ahead in life. Both are now grown and living independently. Her sales are good because she always tries to sell fresh products and offer her customers a good deal. Doris would like to expand her business by purchasing more goods to sell. This is why she is asking Edpyme Alternativa [a Kiva Field Partner] for a loan of 1000 Peruvian Soles to help her meet her goal. Her greatest wish is to be able to live in the city so that she doesn't have to make the long trip each day back and forth from her home to the market. She has worked with Edpyme Alternativa before and has been responsible and on-time with her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to expand her business.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es:
La joven Mercedes del Carmen A. P., tiene la edad de 22 años y habita en el Barrio La Borgoña este es un barrio donde sus habitantes son personas de escasos recursos.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 11 años y dentro de los principales problemas que se le han presentado ha sido sequía que amenaza con la cosecha, fue gracias a su padre quien le apoyo económicamente para comenzar sus dias en este rubro laboral, hoy en día ella se siente capaz de solicitar un prestamo para la compra de fertilizantes y semillas paara diversificar la produccion y abrirse paso a nuevos negocios laborales, tales como la apertura de un tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Mercedes del Carmen A. P. is 22, and she lives in the La Borgoña neighborhood. This is a neighborhood where the inhabitants have scant resources. She has devoted herself to farming for 11 years. One of the main problems that she has encountered has been the drought that threatens the crops. She started working in this field thanks to her father, who supported her economically. She now feels capable of asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds to diversify the production. She also wants to open the door to new working businesses such as opening a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Madjiguene

texts.fr: Madame Madjiguene est une femme marie  de 46 ans. Elle habite dans le quartier de Ngaparou  a Yoff. Elle est membre de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis juin 2000. Elle a déjà bénéficié  de 3 prêts antérieurs. Elle a 4 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 7 et 25 ans. Elle s’active depuis 13 ans dans le commerce d’habits, de chaussures, de draps et de téléviseurs. En même temps elle vend du jus et de la crème. Elle a choisi cette activité par l’intermédiaires de sa grand-mère qui l’a beaucoup influence. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus ce sont les profits que lui procurent cette activiste. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs pour l’achat de thioub. Son objectif est de diversifier ses marchandises, augmenter ses profits et améliorer  sa situation familiale.
texts.en:
Ms. Madjiguene is a 46-year-old married woman.  She lives in the Ngaparou district in Yoff.  She has been a member of the lending group U-IMCEC since June 2000 and has already benefited from three previous loans.  Madjiguene has four children ranging from 7 to 25 years of age.  She has been active for thirteen years in the commerce of clothing, shoes, bed sheets, and televisions.  At the same time, she sells juice and cream.  She chose this work through her grandmother, who influenced her a lot.  The most interesting thing to Madjiguene is the profits that this business provides. She's requesting a loan of 150,000 francs for buying thioub (a type of dyed cloth).  Her goal is to diversify her merchandise, to increase her profits, and to improve her family's situation.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her capital

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is a 25-year-old married with three children aged between 4 and 7 years, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she lives with four people. There is electricity but no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Sylivia resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in Mulago in the outskirts of Kampala. Sylivia works seven days a week selling secondhand clothes. She buys her secondhand clothes from Owino market and incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. She pays monthly rent of 5000/=. She sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale.

Sylivia has been in this business for three years and with MCDT for nine months. She is servicing her second loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more secondhand clothes.

Sylivia is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and to start importing secondhand clothes directly.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Juana Cruz

texts.es:
Juana tiene 51 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el distrito D. Monsefú, ubicado a veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. sombreros D. palma desD. hace 30 años. Ella compra la palma (un tipo D. junco) importada D. la ciudad D. Ecuador en el mismo distrito, y con ella teje los sombreros que después venD. en el mercado D. artesanía D. la ciudad D. Monsefú. El proceso D. elaboración es meticuloso y demora D. una a dos semanas.

Estos productos gozan D. mucha aceptación en la zona. No sólo los pobladores los compran sino que también son adquiridos por turistas nacionales e internacionales. La ciudad D. Monsefú es conocida por tener a los mejores artesanos D. la región.

Juana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. más palma para elaborar más sombreros, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro D. su objetivo.

Ella es una madre D. familia trabajadora y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es hacer mejoras en su casa, ya que las lluvias que asolaron la zona norte hace algunas semanas han debilitado sus estructuras.
texts.en:
Juana is 51 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children in the District of Monsefú, located 20 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been manufacturing and selling palm leaf hats for 30 years. Juana buys imported palm leaf (a type of straw) in the city of Ecuador in the same district. She weaves the hats and sells them at the craft market in the city of Monsefú. The manufacturing process is meticulous and requires between 1-2 weeks. The products have become very popular in the area. Not only do residents buy them, but many are purchased by domestic and international tourists. The city of Monsefú is known for having the best craftspeople in the region.

Juana wants to expand her business buy purchasing more palm leaf for making hats. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN so that she can achieve her goal. She is a hardworking and responsible mother. Juana’s greatest wish is to make improvements to her home since the rains that have hit the northern part of the country a few weeks ago have weakened its structure.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase palm leaf for making hats

texts.en: Florence is 48 years old and married with seven children between 10 and 23 years old. All of her children go to school. The family resides in and owns   a five-room house where she stays with six people. She takes care of additional family members.  The family has access to electricity but no piped water at home.  The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, school fees for her children and medication. Florence deals in produce like beans, maize, and millet and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. She serves about five customers a day. She has done this business for over 15 years. Besides this business, she also sells cosmetics in Kampala city shops. Her main challenges are transportation and seasonality.  She sells at retail and at wholesale. She has been with MCDT for six years, taking her 14th loan working all along with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of maize, beans and millet plus cosmetics  She hopes to see her business grow bigger and to start employing at a least five people.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with four children, who attend school. She owns a two-roomed house where she lives with five people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. The family gets two meals per day. Her greatest monthly expense are food, rent and school fees. 

Jane owns a saloon where she works five days per week. She would like to purchase chemicals and machines for her saloon with the Ush. 800,000 loan from MCDT. She rents the space for her business, which she has been running since 1993. She has at least five customers, mainly women, per day. Her greatest challenge are thieves and seasonality. Jane has worked with MCDT since 1997 and chose the organization because they are reliable. Jane hopes to build her own house someday.

loans.use: To buy more hair chemicals and machines for her salon.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda M. is from the village of Valencia City. She is 42 years old. Yolanda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Yolanda owns & operates a specialized retail store selling used clothing or ukay ukay. At the same time, she is rents gowns and casual dresses for all occasions in the local community. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Yolanda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Yolanda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ursula

texts.es:
Ursula tiene 55 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos ya independizados, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito D. Monsefú, ubicado a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

DesD. hace 18 años tiene instalado en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. Monsefú un puesto D. venta D. verduras. Todos los días ofrece a sus clientes una variedad D. legumbres y tubérculos frescos. Este negocio es una fuente importante D. ayuda a la familia, ya que lo que su esposo gana como albañil no es suficiente para solventar los gastos familiares.

El negocio D. Ursula siempre cuenta con clientes que prefieren su buen trato y amabilidad. Ella está pensando en ampliar su negocio con la compra D. más mercadería, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ursula es una mujer bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y hacer mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ursula, 55, is married and has 5 children, who are all independent now; she lives with her husband in Monsefú district, which is 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has sold vegetables in Monsefú's wholesale food market for the past 18 years. Every day she offers a variety of fresh vegetables and tubers. This business is an important source of family income because her husband's earnings as a bricklayer are insufficient to cover all family expenses. Ursula can always count on her regular customers who prefer her for her kindness and good customer service. She is thinking of enlarging her business by stocking more merchandise but she needs an initial, 1500 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa to do so. Ursula is quite a hard-working woman who is dedicated to her family. Her greatest wish is to continue to grow as a businesswoman and to make some improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Ma. Esperanza

texts.en:
Ma. Esperanza J. is from the village of Tierra Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 45 years old. Ma. Esperanza is separated from her spouse and has four adult children. To make a living, Ma. Esperanza owns & operates a business selling dried fish and longanisa in the local community. Ma. Esperanza has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ma. Esperanza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Esperanza is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ma. Esperanza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: La joven Andrea M. es soltera y una cliente distinguida de nuestra institución ya que anteriormente se le otorgo un crédito para la mejora de su vivienda mediante la colocación de una losa de concreto en el frente de su casa, nuevamente esta tramitando pero ahora para la inversión en uno de sus dos negocios que tiene establecidos, su giro son venta de abarrotes entre otros productos, su negocio el que tiene establecido desde hace 1 año esta muy bien ubicado, pero hace 3 meses estableció uno nuevo y es al que desea invertirle en mercancía por medio de la compra en mayoreo y así obtener mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
Andrea M. is single. She is a distinguished client of our institution. She previously had a loan to improve her house by placing a concrete flagstone in front of her house. She is requesting a new loan to invest in one of her two businesses that she has established. Her line of business is selling groceries, among other products. She established her business one year ago, and it is very well located. But, three months ago she established a new business. She wants to invest in merchandise by purchasing wholesale to obtain greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business buy purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 32 years of age and married with four children aged between 10 and 16 years. All her children go to school. The family resides in and owns a one-room house where she stays with five people. The rest of her children stay in the village with her parents. She takes care of additional family members.  The family has access to electricity but no piped water at home.  The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, school fees for her children, medication and feeding the family. Florence owns a banana stall in Kisaasi. She sells bunches and clusters and doesn’t incur transport costs to and from shopping since she buys from her place of work. She receives an average of 40 customers a day. She has done this business for over seven years. Her main challenges are defaulters, the rainy season, and the ever-increasing prices of bananas.  She sells on a retail basis only. She has been with MCDT for over five years, servicing her tenth loan, working all along with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas. She hopes to see her business grow bigger, to own and to start going to the farmers directly. 
.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Aida Concepcion

texts.es:
Esta cliente es de la comunidad la quimera y se dedica a dar clase de primaria y tiene 15 años a dedicarce a esta actividad.
Y con los financiamientosn que ha adquirido ha logrado desarrollarce en su hogar y ademas a logrado venir preparando la educacion de sus hijos.
texts.en:
This client is from La Quimera. She has been a primary school teacher for 15 years. The loans she has had have made it possible for her to develop in her home and have also allowed for the education of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay university tuition and taxes.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en: Prossy is a 30-year-old single mother of three children. They are aged between 6 and 12 years. All her children go to school. She is also looking after two children for her deceased siblings. She rents a three-room house in which she lives with four people. There is no access to piped water or electricity. She resides in and works in a semi-urban and slum area, which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Prossy works six days a week in Kulambiro market outside Kampala, where she rents a space to sell bananas, a trade she has handled for over three years. There is a market for her service and she serves all kinds of people. Her main challenge is the rainy season since she works in a muddy place. After being with MCDT for six months, she increased her business and income. Prossy wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas.  She would like to put up a commercial building so that she can stop paying rent and instead collect income from the tenants.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Ndanou

texts.fr: Monsieur Ndanou D. est âgé de 53 ans et habite à Yoff. C’est un père de famille avec une femme et 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 5 et 7 ans. Il  évolué  depuis 1990 dans le transport, activite qu’il a choisi pour gagner sa vie et vivre décemment  avec sa famille. Ce qui l’y intéresse  le plus ce sont les profits relises Il sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs dans l’intention de renouveler la boite a vitesse de son taxi qui est défectueuse. Son crédit lui permettra de mieux rentabiliser son véhicule  et aussi d’améliorer  sa situation sociale.
texts.en:
Mr. Ndanou D. is 53 years old and lives in Yoff. He's married and the father of two children, age 5 and 7. Since 1990, he's been working in transport, a business he chose to make a living and provide decent support to his family. He's especially interested in the realized profits. He's seeking a loan XOF 250'000 in order to replace the defective transmission of his taxi. This loan will enable him to make his vehicle more profitable and to improve his social condition.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To replace the defective transmission of his taxi
